story:
McIntyre Musings, Original Art

Here is a brief introduction to us, what we do, why we do it, and how you can help!

  • McIntyre Musings is an artist duo out of Tucson, Arizona, Heidi and Casandra McIntyre. For the past two years we have been pouring our hearts and souls into this journey that is an art business. We create original paintings, drawings, sketches, magnets and prints! We love travelling to various shows to share and sell our art, including comic cons, gaming expos, local art fairs, and even at the Davis Monthan Air Force Base! We both love making art and are having a blast sharing all the fun stuff we create with the world!
  • This campaign was developed to help us supplement our current revenue in order to help us grow into a new market with new shows and new locations. 
  • With the help of our awesome campaign donors, like you, we will be able to take this business to the next level. We will be able to expand our market, build customer base, and build on the solid foundation we have created over the last two years. We started this journey with the help of a campaign just like this, and would like your help again to grow and expand!

Fundraising Needs & Donor Perks

Fundraising Needs:

  • New event registrations
  • Hotels bookings
  • Display Equipment
  • Marketing Materials

Perks:

  • Flexible magnets of original art
  • High-quality, full color prints on 100# cardstock
  • Custom original paintings
  • Many thank you's!

The Impact Your Contribution Can Make

McIntyre Musings was started with the help of a fundraising campaign, without which we would not be where we are now, a newly successful art business. Having access to fundraising avenues such as this IndieGoGo can have a huge impact on our ability to grow and expand our business while supplementing the current revenue base.

Since the majority of the revenue the business is bringing in is being used for event renewals and material supplies for new projects, this funding would have a most valuable impact on the following:

  • We would be able to sign up for a series of new events for 2018, expanding our sales market and client base, in turn helping us to continue to grow!

Some of these new events include:

  • Retro City Festival in Pamona, CA
  • Monterey Comic Con in Monterey, CA
  • LVL UP Expo in Las Vegas, NV
  • Denver Comic Con in Denver, CO
  • Kikori Con in Flagstaff, AZ
  • Permian Basin in Midland, TX, and many more!
  • We would be able to secure hotels for new and future shows in a timely fashion, allowing us to get the best rates possible.
  • We would be able to purchase new display equipment. As our product line has grown, and continues to grow, we need more display equipment. This equipment can include table stands, triangle grid racks, portfolio books, etc.
  • We would be able to purchase more marketing materials, such as business cards, banners, signage, and much more!

Risks & Challenges

As with any business venture, there will always be the potential for risks and challenges to interfere with immediate goals. Here are some of the risks and challenges McIntyre Musings faces in the upcoming show year, 2018.

  • The major risk we face in our industry is not breaking even at new shows due to an unknown, new market. You never know what the foot traffic, event advertising, and other unforeseen circumstances are going to be at new shows.
  • To minimize this risk we do as much research as possible before we sign up to do a show. Research includes looking at marketing strategies of the host show, looking at the turnout for previous shows, and talking to established artists about the shows they have attended.
  • Challenges in this industry are many, including: varying size setup spaces, travel and lodging expenses, eating healthy at shows, networking with established artists and show hosts, and being able to have sitting cash to register for new shows when they open as they can tend to sell out quickly.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and that is okay, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a couple ways you can help us reach our goals:

  • Share the campaign with your friends and family!
  • Share the campaign on your Facebook or other social media!

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign and contributing in whatever way you are able! Every assist is helpful and greatly appreciated! Looking forward to an amazing 2018 show season!

We love travelling to various shows to share and sell our art, including comic cons, gaming expos, local art fairs, and even at the Davis Monthan Air Force Base! We both love making art and are having a blast sharing all the fun stuff we create with the world!
This campaign was developed to help us supplement our current revenue in order to help us grow into a new market with new shows and new locations. 
With the help of our awesome campaign donors, like you, we will be able to take this business to the next level. We will be able to expand our market, build customer base, and build on the solid foundation we have created over the last two years. We started this journey with the help of a campaign just like this, and would like your help again to grow and expand!


Fundraising Needs & Donor Perks
Fundraising Needs:

New event registrations
Hotels bookings
Display Equipment
Marketing Materials

Perks:

Flexible magnets of original art
High-quality, full color prints on 100# cardstock
Custom original paintings
Many thank you's!


The Impact Your Contribution Can Make
McIntyre Musings was started with the help of a fundraising campaign, without which we would not be where we are now, a newly successful art business. Having access to fundraising avenues such as this IndieGoGo can have a huge impact on our ability to grow and expand our business while supplementing the current revenue base.
Since the majority of the revenue the business is bringing in is being used for event renewals and material supplies for new projects, this funding would have a most valuable impact on the following:
We would be able to sign up for a series of new events for 2018, expanding our sales market and client base, in turn helping us to continue to grow!
Some of these new events include:

Retro City Festival in Pamona, CA
Monterey Comic Con in Monterey, CA
LVL UP Expo in Las Vegas, NV
Denver Comic Con in Denver, CO
Kikori Con in Flagstaff, AZ
Permian Basin in Midland, TX, and many more!
We would be able to secure hotels for new and future shows in a timely fashion, allowing us to get the best rates possible.
We would be able to purchase new display equipment. As our product line has grown, and continues to grow, we need more display equipment. This equipment can include table stands, triangle grid racks, portfolio books, etc.
We would be able to purchase more marketing materials, such as business cards, banners, signage, and much more!


Risks & Challenges
As with any business venture, there will always be the potential for risks and challenges to interfere with immediate goals. Here are some of the risks and challenges McIntyre Musings faces in the upcoming show year, 2018.

The major risk we face in our industry is not breaking even at new shows due to an unknown, new market. You never know what the foot traffic, event advertising, and other unforeseen circumstances are going to be at new shows.
To minimize this risk we do as much research as possible before we sign up to do a show. Research includes looking at marketing strategies of the host show, looking at the turnout for previous shows, and talking to established artists about the shows they have attended.
Challenges in this industry are many, including: varying size setup spaces, travel and lodging expenses, eating healthy at shows, networking with established artists and show hosts, and being able to have sitting cash to register for new shows when they open as they can tend to sell out quickly.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute financially, and that is okay, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a couple ways you can help us reach our goals:

Share the campaign with your friends and family!
Share the campaign on your Facebook or other social media!

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign and contributing in whatever way you are able! Every assist is helpful and greatly appreciated! Looking forward to an amazing 2018 show season!

story:
Support Norte Maar’s #makemoreart campaign!

As we race towards our teenage years (the second year into our second decade!) we need your support to keep us on the edge, at the forefront of new art, poetry and dance in Brooklyn and beyond. Quite simply… help us... help artists... #makemoreart

By supporting Norte Maar you not only support our core programs but also our creative agenda based on ideas of imagination, spontaneity and cross-disciplinary collaboration.

Everyone who supports us knows just how far their gift goes to financially support our volunteer-led organization and our mission to encourage, promote and present new art, new poetry, new performance while bringing attention to emerging artist communities in Brooklyn and beyond.

Now more than ever, we need to think bigger, smarter. And we need to do it more often with a cast of diverse voices that echo the artists and community we represent.

Help us to help others to fly effortlessly, to break out beyond the studio, to stretch boundaries that seek to keep art quiet, inaccessible to some or out of reach for others, to come together to share experience and ideas, to build community.

With your donation to Norte Maar's #makemoreart campaign you may choose a perk that is well worth your money. From tickets to performance, art tours and a rural weekend, to postcard art by Rico Gatson and Tamara Gonzales, ceramic mugs by our artist collaborators in the Adirondacks, or the unique print edition of Audra Wolowiec, you'll find something that connects you with the mission of Norte Maar. And of course, you can always choose the #makemoreart trucker hat or t-shirt!

Thank you to all our wonderful supporters, to our terrific Board of Directors, to all the artists and collaborators and their families, to our audiences near and far, and to our volunteers. All of you are integral to the work of Norte Maar.

Norte Maar is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization founded in 2004 by curator Jason Andrew and choreographer Julia K. Gleich. Donations made to Norte Maar are fully tax-deductible less the estimated value of any goods or services received.

Film Credits:
"a white room" a film by Jason Andrew
choreography by Julia K. Gleich / art by Debra Ramsay
danced by Kara Chan, Tiffany Mangulabnan, Izabela Szylińska
director of photography & editing: Theodore Collatos
special thanks to ODETTA, Bushwick

Norte Maar Projects 2016:

Visual Arts
Paracosm: new worlds in glass, (curated by Suzanne Peck and Erin O’Connor) Norte Maar, Cypress Hills, Brooklyn, Sept 11-Oct 23.

Ways and Means: a new look at process and materials in art, 1285 Avenue of the Americas, NYC, Jul 11-Oct 7.

3rd Annual Jay Invitational of Clay, Norte Maar, Jay, NY, Jul 15-17.

Kris Grave: The Testament Project, a photographic exploration and re-conception of the contemporary black experience, Norte Maar, Cypress Hills, Brooklyn, Jun 4-Jul 31

Literary Arts
Pin the Tail on the Tiger: poetry by Bob Holman / art by Jessica Weiss, published by Norte Maar, May.

Performing Arts
4th Annual Dance at Socrates, Aug. 1-21, Socrates Sculpture Park, Long Island City, Queens.

CounterPointe: new work by women choreographers and their collaborations with artists, Actors Fund Arts Center, Brooklyn, Apr 8-10.

Community
Free Kids Art Days at Norte Maar, Oct-Nov.

Beat Nite Greenpoint, Greenpoint, NY, Oct 28.

“Artist Panel: Ways and Means,” Art Student League, NYC, Sept 28.

2nd Annual Ausable River Valley Studio Tour, Au Sable River Valley, NY, Jul 16-17.

“Beat Nite Lite: Bay Ridge,” Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, May 14.

“CounterPointe Panel with Kathryn Posin,” Actors Fund Arts Center, Apr 9.

Beat Nite Downtown, Downtown Brooklyn, NY, Feb 26.

story:
**This campaign is now closed, but we are still working to reach our fundraising goals. If you would like to make a donation, please send an e-transfer to info@aliasdanceproject.com, making the password "alias". Alternatively, you can mail a cheque to:

Alias Dance Project

368 Coxwell Ave.

Toronto, ON

M4L 2B7

Thank you in advance for your support!**

Alias Dance Project is about to embark on their 10th anniversary season, opening with an epic double bill of two new works. A world premiere by Alias choreographic duo Lauren Cook and Troy Feldman, in collaboration with sound designer/projection designer/art director, Omar David Rivero (Driftnote). The second work directed and choreographed by acclaimed choreographer, Hanna Kiel. "through your eyes" created and performed with dance artists: Caitlin Amodeo, Drew Berry, Francesca Chudnoff, Lauren Cook, Amanda Davis, Luke Garwood, Emily Law and Greg Selinger. 

This work has been generously supported by the Toronto Arts Council, the Ontario Arts Countil and the Canada Arts Council, but with a cast and crew of 13 artists, the production budget for this project still outweighs its support. 

Now we turn to you, our supporters, our family, and our fans, to help us bring our vision to life!

Our campaign goal for this production is $4,000! All proceeds from this campaign will help support:

Production equipment: additional lighting, sound equipment, projectors, etc.

Materials, building and design for set, costumes, and projections.

If we don't reach our goal, Indiegogo will take an additional 5% (they take 4%, no matter what) of the funds raised as a fee. Every little bit donated towards this project makes a difference, no matter how small! We would be grateful for any contribution that you can make, and hopefully we can push beyond the $4,000, as it is only the bare minimum  amount needed to cover costs.

  • If you cannot contribute financially, help us share our message and campaign to your friends and family! We want to reach as many people as possible, and any way that you can help us share our art is greatly appreciated. No matter what, we hope to see you at the show February 2nd - 5th 2017, 8pm, Dancemakers Centre for Creation

BUY TICKETS HERE

"through your eyes" is a result of years of research, training and exchanging with artists across the Toronto dance community, integrating diverse movement styles and backgrounds into a combined vocabulary of contemporary dance, martial arts, parkour, various street dance styles and alternative partnering techniques. With the collective energy of diverse artists and collaborators, this double bill stands as a landmark in Alias' 10 year history, and is the beginning of the next chapter. After building a reputation as a leader of innovative artistic collaborations in Toronto, ADP moves forward in establishing a unique dance experience that is distinctly of the Alias spirit. 

You can also help support Alias by checking out:

Creative Lab with Hanna Kiel

10th anniversary ADP Merchandise

story:
Check out my website to see more of my work:     http://www.lindsayweitzman.com

 

Arquetopia Printmaking Residency in Puebla, Mexico!

 

I've been given the opportunity to spend one month at Arquetopia, a residency program in Puebla, Mexico. I'll have 24/7 access to studios and printmaking facilities, and all the time in the world to draw, carve, ink, press and pull prints! I've never had this much time to devote solely to my art practice, and I couldn't be more excited...and ready to work!


As an artist, it can be extremely difficult to find the space and time to create. Residencies provide both of these things, as well as a community of like-minded people, an environment full of creative energy, with the added benefit of an inspiring new location. 
This past fall, I began a woodcut series based on satellite images of Earth, studying the patterns humans create. I'm interested in creation and destruction, and the connection between human and nature. The first image I chose was of the US/Mexico border. Little did I know, I would be crossing it for the first time six months later!

A little bit about me:

  • I studied graphic design and printmaking at Boston University. I'm an artist, yogi, and bartender. Traveling and experiencing new cultures feed my inspiration like nothing else!
  • I will admit, I'm also terrible at self-promotion (i.e., this is weird). Most of the reason I decided to start this campaign is because it will force me to share my work, as well as offer it for purchase to those of you that have continuously asked me!

Quid Pro Quo

Here's what this adventure costs:

  • Program fee (includes studio, housing & meals): $2300
  • Airfare, local travel & accommodation (estimate): $700
  • Materials: $350 

Here's what you get:

  • An opportunity to purchase my prints, while supporting the creation of my future work!
  • Any extra funds will go towards materials (for both the "perks" and future work, $350 is a hopeful but very unlikely estimate) and creating even more work.
  • My eternal love and devotion (who says you can't buy love?)

Risks & Challenges

Planning to create prints in a new and unfamiliar shop is difficult. The space, press size and equipment can drastically change plans. I have a very rough idea of what I will create, but its very possible that things might have to shift along the way.

  • I will do my best to honor the description of the art works listed. However, if plans change, as they often do, I will make sure that every one is pleased with the work they receive.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's ok if you can't contribute cash, but you can contribute something!

  • Tell yer friends! Or perhaps suggest that their walls look bare.
  • Feel free to share this campaign on social media!

story:
Short Summary

The Shalom Community Center (Bloomington's only daytime resource center for people experiencing extreme poverty), working with community artist Joe LaMantia, hopes to bring both beauty and compassion to Bloomington through a unique public art project to be installed in front of our Center's downtown location on South Walnut Street.

The public art project is driven by the theme of “More than Homeless” and inspired by the countless women, men, and children without homes who experience horrible prejudice and even hatred because of their situation.

Crystal Banks, a formerly homeless mother, described her experience of homelessness when she said, "One of the hardest things about being homeless was that I was so afraid to tell anybody that I was homeless. You get looked down upon, because people don’t even stop to try and hear your story and understand why you’re homeless. You’re just automatically put in that box of, ‘You’re homeless. You’re a bad person. You obviously did something wrong.’ And that’s not the case... This has been one of the most humbling experiences that I’ve ever had.” 

Motivated by the experiences of the homeless and countless examples of public art, which help people see homelessness differently, we, at Shalom, felt Bloomington needed its own public message of compassion, inscribed in community art.

That inspiration led us to the perfect person to move this idea forward, community artist, Joe LaMantia. With 20 years of experience as a collaborative community artist, Joe has completed over 40 similar projects all over Indiana and the Midwest (www.lamantiastudio.com).

Through Joe's unique team-building process, guests of Shalom, students and staff from local schools, and members of the general public will all be involved in the design, creation, and construction of this unique art spectacle, which, when completed, will be available for all to learn from and enjoy.

What We Need & What You Get

The overall cost of this public art project is about $14,000. Through the generous funding of the Bloomington Arts Commission, the Bloomington Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Commission, and the Bloomington Urban Enterprise Association, we have already raised over $4,000 to get us started.

Our crowd-funding goal is $10,000, which will cover the remaining costs associated with the creation, installation, and fundraising of the project, including the costs for the artist and the materials needed to complete the project.

When the project is complete, Bloomington will have a public art piece of both beauty and compassion. It will serve as a symbol and a reminder to our community to live with open hearts to the marginalized and downtrodden in our community.

We know that many of you prefer to give simply from the kindness of your own hearts, but we also have some gifts for you to say THANK YOU for your support. Our favorite is having your name permanently inscribed on the sculpture to acknowledge your generosity to making this work of beauty real. Check out all the other THANK YOUs to see what best fits you and your desire and ability to help.

100% of the funding we raise over the final costs of the art piece will be dedicated to the work of Shalom Community Center to help aid and empower people experiencing hunger, homelessness, and poverty.

The Impact - Details on the Art Piece

Until you've witnessed it, it's hard to explain the level of prejudice and even hatred directed at people experiencing homelessness. We believe this community art piece will play a significant role in helping our community open up in understanding and compassion.

We have already conducted Brainstorming sessions where ideas, thoughts and drawings, related to the project, were collected from the community. The Design Phase incorporated ideas generated by these sessions into the project design with a strong focus on recyclable, reused materials which are the media of choice of Project Artist Joe LaMantia. A Review Committee was formed to oversee and provide feedback on the project at all stages as it moves towards completion.

The Heart Shelter is the main element of the project. It will be placed in front of the Shalom Community Center at 620 S. Walnut Street. It will be constructed almost completely of donated recycled materials (galvanized street posts and signs, car license plates, tiles and mirrors).

A  Mural will be displayed on the windows that stretch across the entire front of the Shalom Center, just behind the Heart Shelter. This mural will be a black silhouette of people who are guests of Shalom. A statement “Like you, I have a story worth sharing”, will appear above the silhouette.

A Wild Life Sanctuary, composed of native plants found in Indiana, will be planted around the Heart Shelter. Also included will be painted birdhouses, a mason bee house, a butterfly house, and a birdbath.

The project is now in the Fabrication phase. The primary structure and the heart are being constructed. Mirror pieces are being attached to the heart by students at Stone Belt. Students at Hoosier Hills Career Center are creating other parts of the framework, including the weather vane that will sit atop the sculpture.

In the summer, Shalom guests, students, and the general public will be invited to get involved in building and assembling the rest of the sculpture.

The installation phase will begin with the pouring of footers in the space in front of the Shalom Center. The sculpture will then be moved over to the site by truck and installed by the use of a crane, in the fall of 2015.

Risks & Challenges

In moving this project forward, we've overcome many challenges already, including finding the right artist, getting the appropriate permissions from the City, designing the art project, and obtaining some initial funding for the work.

Our next biggest challenge is raising the additional funding to make this work. That's where YOU come in. With YOUR support, we will take this beautiful dream and make it into a real work of art!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not all of you can help out financially as much as you'd like, but you can still help!!

Please get the word out. Share this with your friends. Get excited!! Make some noise!!

Also, check the updates section for opportunities to volunteer.

including the weather vane that will sit atop the sculpture. 
In the
summer, Shalom guests, students, and the general public will be
invited to get involved in building and assembling the rest of the sculpture. 
The installation phase will begin with the pouring
of footers in the space in front of the Shalom Center. The sculpture will then
be moved over to the site by truck and installed by the use of a crane, in the fall
of 2015.
Risks & Challenges
  In moving this project forward, we've overcome many challenges already, including finding the right artist, getting the appropriate permissions from the City, designing the art project, and obtaining some initial funding for the work.
Our next biggest challenge is raising the additional funding to make this work. That's where YOU come in. With YOUR support, we will take this beautiful dream and make it into a real work of art!!
  Other Ways You Can Help We know that not all of you can help out financially as much as you'd like, but you can still help!!
Please get the word out. Share this with your friends. Get excited!! Make some noise!!
Also, check the updates section for opportunities to volunteer.

story:
Michael Clague Montreal painter and printmaker.


  • Need to raise funds to pay for another art booth at RAW artists in Montreal
  • It's important that I keep making new contacts for my work
  • Your help will  be once again appreciated by me 


I need  to sell $300.00 worth of tickets on line 

The minimum amount I can raise here is $ 500.00 the total tickets are valued at $ 300.00  The extra $200.00  is for transportation

  • Tickets are only $ 15.00 each  and that will let you in at Le Tulip and get to see more amazing work that I didn't show at the last expo.
  • What a deal for $ 15.00 you get a pack of 8 postcards with different images 
  • The funds will go to partial payment to rent my booth for one day 
  • After my last expo at the Montreal Yes Art Expo I made a few contacts with the public and I would like my contact list to grow the last expo was a great success and I want to keep up a email tree
  • With my last Indiegogo campaign I raised 45 % of my goal and I was able to send several  contributors their perks by mail


 No risk at all satisfaction guaranteed 

  • .

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • So  if you have a email tree to share that is also worth gold
  • Share on you're social sites

And that's all there is to it. Thanks again ! Michael

story:
Taking my next step..........

After being a self employed artist for approximately the last 3 years I'm now looking to taking the next step to opening up my own Gallery and Studio space.   This will help me to work towards promoting and growing my business.  After working for home for all this time, I feel its the correct time to have a space to work in so people can come and see me create, and view the creations in person instead of from a computer screen.  I feel this would benefit the people who are looking to commission me, to come and see me in a space and chat face to face about what they want, and what I can offer to them.  I want a place for people to come and to learn from me, I would love to start small art classes for all ages, this would bring colour and fun to the community.  I have a couple of places in mind to do this from, but need to raise a bit of money before taking the steps closer to renting my space........

I want a place where anyone can come into, this is not going to be a gallery where everything is completely out of everyones price range, I want to have a place where anyone and everyone can find something affordable and meaningful to them. I want a gallery that no body is scared to enter, there will be no snobbery or camaraderie in anything that I hope to do. It would be the go to gifts, everyone forgets a birthday and needs a last minute gift and card, as I hope to have many other crafters work in my shop this will be the place to come for all gift needs, weather they are last minute or planned, for birthdays, weddings, leaving presents, baby showers, new babies, engagements, christmas gifts or just gifts for yourself and your home.

 Apart from spending a short time at Aberdeen's Gallowgate College at 16 years old where I did various art, graphics, ceramics and design modules for 1 year, I am mainly self taught. I have been drawing and painting for as long as I can remember. I have pursued a couple of different career paths over the years but now feel that I have found my true calling and know this is what I was born to do. I have experience in various types of art and design including portrait's, illustration, pet portrait's, landscapes and pointillism. I live for this stuff and love creating at every possible moment. 



What are you pledging for????

Your pledge will help me to refurbish and help with the costs of starting up a brand new place all money raised will go directly into the business.

I am looking for some support to help me along the way to my dream of having my very own gallery with studio space.  Currently trying to find the correct space for me with a few places in mind, i need to have some financial backing behind me before I can go ahead with this.  My aim is to open a space to promote and sell Scotland's finest talents from artist's, crafters and makers, along with a space for my own work too and a place for me to work from.

I would like to promote and sell quirky individual arts and crafts not found on the high street.  I want this to be a very unique and welcoming shopping experience for everyone who comes in.  I will make it a happy and welcoming place, wherever it may be........

Any Help will be so gratefully received.

Dreams can happen if you make them happen :)

story:
“What is happiness? Happyness comes to you like a free bird. You are not supposed to hold on to it or catch it. But instead you are meant to care for it and cherish it. It is like a present that you receive from the universe or nature.” [Female voice over]

 THE JUMP from the series SAUERBRUNN by © Navina Neverla

What has already happened?

The project has already received funding in order to cover for production from Larga Marcha Arte y Ediciones, Spain for editing by Marcos Flórez in 2015 and from HfBK Academy of Fine Arts Hamburg in 2012 for shooting on super8 Film. It has been mentored in the second phase by Victor Jorge, Prof. for Moving Image at Ar.Co Centro de Arte e Communicação Visual Lisbon as well as by the artist patron Carlos García-Alix.

Under this link you can find a the raw edit that has resulted from these 2 production phases so far::



What is happening now?

We have very recently been invited for an artistic residency  by AADK to Centro Negra | Espacio de Investigación y Creación Contemporánea in Murcia, Spain from August - October 2016. 

This is THE  unique chance!

Moreover, Gängeviertel,  Hamburg, Germany is looking forward to present the work at the Galerie Raum Links Rechts in Hamburg.

THE FEET from the series SAUERBRUNN by © Navina Neverla

In order to finish this wonderful project, we are now going into the 3rd. phase of production for which we are now launching this crowdfunding campaign!

Please help us finishing this amazing project by supporting with a financial contribution or even sharing it amongst your friends.

What is it about?

Sauerbraunn - Hold on to Freedom is an interactive multimedia installation created by Navina Neverla & her team.

"It is an art work about Presence and Absence" [María Rogel, LAPOR].

The universal theme of this work moves in an endless loop through 3 different stages::

1. Home / Paradise / Safety / Security and Comfort
2. Trauma / Loss / Disintegration / Fragmentation /Dissolving of structures
3. Transcending / Detachment/ Letting go


Have you ever experienced a total loss? Can you identify?

In fact Sauerbrunn - Hold on to Freedom is my very personal story of the loss of my grandparents house in Austria, where I have spent the wonderful time of my childhood and those beautiful childhood memories of peacefulness & nature, which was like a home to me, a place of comfort, security, love and safety.

A little paradise, where things seem to always remain the same and time stands still. A home, which I otherwise did not have due to my international & intercultural background, always moving around...


What is researched?

Due to it's theme of paradise the work raises questions around the relationship between ART and KITSCH. And in the course of the realization of the project those questions shall be researched and reflected upon & respectively their limits will be sounded.

Super8 Film Still Image THE CHERRIES from SAUERBRUNN by © Navina Neverla

However, this story of paradise, loss, finally transcending & letting go of that that loss will not be told in a common way!


How will the project be implemented & presented?

The artwork will consist of Moving Image: Super 8 Film in b/w & color, Analogue Fine Art Photography Prints, Sound Art, Elements that engage with the sense of Smell & a Big Swing, in the middle of a space, as an interactive component, that invites audience members to engage with their kinesthetic sense.

Fotography Installation by Navina Neverla recently presented at Galeria Bessa Artes Lisbon 2016


Furthermore, the finished edited super8 Film shall be projected on 3 walls of the same room, fotos hanging from the roof, sound artist composing and mixing live sound, a big swing in the middle of room which invited audience members to dwell in childhood memories, the smell of fresh grass and summer fruits shall further inspire the oligofactory sense. 


Who is the Team?

Artistic direction & Head of Production:: Navina Neverla
Production Part 1 & 2:: Carlos García-Alix - Larga Marcha Arte y Ediciones &
HFBK Hamburg,
Producer:: Virginia Cromie
Sound Artist Spain:: Diana Combo
Sound Artist Germany:: Marcos Rondon aka Tomate van Monte
Mentoring:: Birgit Dunkel aka Bibi Dark
Mentoring Spain:: AADK Team / Abraham Hurtado
Visual Artist for Stage [Swing Sculpture]:: Swen-Erik Scheuerling
Editing:: Marcos Flórez
Editing:: Tom Bewilogua/ Kinematograph 24/7
Camera:: Navina Neverla
Cast:: Irene Neverla

The DIVE from the series SAUERBRUNN by © Navina Neverla


Thanks to Bernhard Hetzenauer, Julia Hehlke, Victor Jorge, Lugh O'Neill, Udo Engel, Barbara Schmidt-Rohr, Andec, Wittner & many more.

Who is the Artistic Director?

Portrait Navina Neverla Foto by Julia Hehlke

My Name is Navina Neverla and I am a multimedia artist born in Germany in 1984, of Indian and Austrian descent. I am a Nomad, living inbetween cultures and coutries. A so-called third culture kid.

As an artist in transition between Performance & Visual Arts, I am interested in crossing, merging, experimenting, transcending & mixing media.

In fact my recent art work fluctuates between Installation & Performance Art. 

In my work I am to think out of the box. My work is collaborative, sometimes conceptual and I am to cross boundaries of art forms and cultures.

Basically I believe that all is one and there are no limits.

My work has been presented since 2007 at  Kampnagel Hamburg, DanceKiosk, Gängeviertel, Künstlerhaus Vorwerkstift, AmbulArt Mexico, Galeria Bessa Artes & a variety of international short film festivals.

Selected for a Fleetstreet Residency; Project Funding from Hamburg’s Cultural Ministry, Augstein- and Hamburgische Kulturstiftung in the past.

And I have worked as a performer amongst others with Bojana Cvejic at Tate Modern, Vânia Rovisco, André Guedes, Isabelle Schad & God’s Entertainment.

Holding an MA Creative Practice from Laban/ ID London, Diploma in Visual Communication from HFBK Academy of Fine Arts and BA in Mediaculture.

Recently been invited by Victor Jorge, Prof. Ar.Co Lisbon to join the collective Súbita Prácticas de Composição e Criação.

Where can you find more information about Navina Neverla's work?

www.MovingImageMovingBody.com
www.NavinaNeverla.com
https://vimeo.com/user9456708
https://www.facebook.com/Navina-Neverla-Freelance-Artist-1404305476449270/
https://en-gb.facebook.com/people/Navina-Sauerbrunn-Crowdfunding/100012456457402
https://www.facebook.com/Project-Sauerbrunn-Hol...
http://trinitylaban.academia.edu/NavinaNeverlaChellani

http://trinitylaban.academia.edu/NavinaNeverlaC...


Where does your money go?

The Shower from the series Sauerbrunn by © Navina Neverla


The entire project is estimated with an amount of 17.000 Euro which is 19.200 $. From this amount, a partly amount of the financial ressources shall come from two Hamburg-based institution: Hamburgische Kulturstiftung 5000 Euro, that is 6200 $ & Rudolf Augstein Stiftung with 2300 Euro, that is 2600 $.  Funding applications have been sent out accordingly already.

In order to realise this piece to its potential and to fairly compensate my incredible collaborators, I am seeking funds to support the following costs:

Budget remuneration for staff: 10.300 $ (= 9100 Euro) Compensation for our Team members, that includes: Video editor, Sound artist, Visual Artist creating the swing sculpture, PR, Production, Producer, Camera.

Costs for production material 8980 $ = (7950 Euro). This includes technical equipment such as Cameras, Projectors, Editing devices, the Material for the swing sculpture, the printing of Fine Art Fotography, travel expenses, accomodation for the team.

With the funding goal of 10.000 $ (=8700 Euro) we will be able to implement this project . If we bypass the funding threshold and raise 19.200 $ (= 17.050 Euro) we would be able to go one step further by being able to have a decent budget that covers for income fee of artists as well as production costs.

This project guarantees added value for the society as well as art industry due to it's universal theme as well it's holistic; multicultural and multidisciplinary approach.

A detailed budget plan exists of course and can be sent any time upon request.


    How can you help if you really do not have any money at all?

    We are so grateful if you will help us spreading the word by telling people about the project and sharing this link on your social media or even in an Email to selected people:

    https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/2209b671

    Thank you so much! :)

What are the risks and challenges?

The project will be realised either way. The question at stake is, how can we as artists do our work and earn a minimum renumeration, while having a realistic budget available that covers the budget for production such as needed technical equipment. So please help us to create the best outcome possible and to create decent working conditions for the artists of the team.

How we will show our gratitude for your support?

In gratitude for the means to be free to create and complete a work that meets my aspirations and vision, I am so grateful for the enormous contributions of the creative community who have helped me each step- in so many ways. This artwork represents a new level of collaboration for me, and I am thrilled to be able to share the process of creation and the objects and elements of the piece itself with all of you, as co-creators.


Super8 Film Still Image GLITTER from SAUERBRUNN © by Navina Neverla


Your participation counts!

I would like express my truthful gratitide once again for your honest interest in my work staying with me until this point! :)

Thank you so much!

And we hope to see you at the presentation of the interactive multimedia installation Sauerbrunn - Hold on to Freedom!

story:
Pixeneer is a unique innovative art design concept that provides you infinite possibilities to demonstrate your creativity and turn anywhere into your canvas. With the small self-adhesive foam rubber tiles, Pixeneer can get your creative juices flowing around!

We probably all have bare wall in our home. The one that we’re going to hang a picture on. One that’s stylistic yet personal. One that melts in with the rest of the décor but still stands out. The wall remains bare. Just simply stick the Pixeneer tiles on wherever you like and turn your wall into a work of ART. Don’t worry, they won’t damage your wall and they can be reused for over 50 times and even washable with the special sticker behind!

 

We are a group of professional engineers who are extremely passionate with Pixel Art. There is a new trend around the world that lots of famous pixel artist bringing their design from gallery or museum onto the street. They believe that they are hackers of public space spreading a virus of mosaic. As museums and galleries are not accessible to everyone, installing them at street level will let ordinary people enjoy the art on a daily basis.

Inspired by them, we come up with an idea that we might even bring them back to our home – to design a stylish home with pixel street art! After 2 years of infinite trials and errors, we finally got to the final step of our product development cycle. So please support us and bring these stunning and innovative wall decorations back to your home.

Each tile is 2cm x 2cm x 0.8 cm in size, weighting less than 1 gram. It is made of light and durable EVA foam rubber. EVA-foam rubbers are completely harmless, resistant and baby- friendly.

The sticker behind is specially designed and has several features. We have tested over hundred types of different materials to come up with these stickers. They are self-adhesive, waterproof and can be reused for unlimited times. The most important thing is no residue will be left on your wall!!

The Pixeneer chips can also be washed with water to clean the dirt and will not leave any residue on your wall. They can be fixed to most types of walls, including the wall inside your bathroom and the uneven ones. However, a freshly painted wall should dry for at least 14 days prior to fixing Pixeneer chips.

Pixeneer is available in 16 colors: Red, Orange, Yellow, Pale green, Green, Dark Green, Cyan, Blue, Violet, Pink, Skin Tone, Brown, Grey, Dark Grey, Deep Grey and Black.

We are working on reference drawings for hundreds of different design and we will be ready to build an online platform that will clearly show all the designs and can be viewed by smart phones.

For each box of Pixeneer, we will include a reference drawing with instructions to show how easy it is for you to create your masterpiece with Pixeneer chips.

We also plan to create an online platform that allows everyone to create Pixeneer art themselves and share their masterpiece with the community. Within this platform, we can gather all the fans of pixel art and let everyone interact with each other. Everyone can be a Pixeneer!

Demos:

\

After you back our project, please kindly send us a message and we will arrange the design package for you. We will contact you individually to confirm the design package arrangement.

Design for the Hex Pixeneer:


We can't express how grateful we are to have all you here with us. A huge thank you to everyone who has supported us throughout our wonderful Pixeneer journey so far! We couldn't have done this without all your supports!

Some things just appear, though, and this wonderful art should have just appeared in any case and bring joy to the world. We all enjoyed a great time when we were working together to create Pixeneer and we hope through the campaign, we can share this joy to everyone around the world.
story_txt: Pixeneer is a unique innovative art design concept that provides you infinite possibilities to demonstrate your creativity and turn anywhere into your canvas. With the small self-adhesive foam rubber tiles, Pixeneer can get your creative juices flowing around!We probably all have bare wall in our home. The one that we’re going to hang a picture on. One that’s stylistic yet personal. One that melts in with the rest of the décor but still stands out. The wall remains bare. Just simply stick the Pixeneer tiles on wherever you like and turn your wall into a work of ART. Don’t worry, they won’t damage your wall and they can be reused for over 50 times and even washable with the special sticker behind! We are a group of professional engineers who are extremely passionate with Pixel Art. There is a new trend around the world that lots of famous pixel artist bringing their design from gallery or museum onto the street. They believe that they are hackers of public space spreading a virus of mosaic. As museums and galleries are not accessible to everyone, installing them at street level will let ordinary people enjoy the art on a daily basis.Inspired by them, we come up with an idea that we might even bring them back to our home – to design a stylish home with pixel street art! After 2 years of infinite trials and errors, we finally got to the final step of our product development cycle. So please support us and bring these stunning and innovative wall decorations back to your home.Each tile is 2cm x 2cm x 0.8 cm in size, weighting less than 1 gram. It is made of light and durable EVA foam rubber. EVA-foam rubbers are completely harmless, resistant and baby- friendly.The sticker behind is specially designed and has several features. We have tested over hundred types of different materials to come up with these stickers. They are self-adhesive, waterproof and can be reused for unlimited times. The most important thing is no residue will be left on your wall!!The Pixeneer chips can also be washed with water to clean the dirt and will not leave any residue on your wall. They can be fixed to most types of walls, including the wall inside your bathroom and the uneven ones. However, a freshly painted wall should dry for at least 14 days prior to fixing Pixeneer chips.Pixeneer is available in 16 colors: Red, Orange, Yellow, Pale green, Green, Dark Green, Cyan, Blue, Violet, Pink, Skin Tone, Brown, Grey, Dark Grey, Deep Grey and Black.We are working on reference drawings for hundreds of different design and we will be ready to build an online platform that will clearly show all the designs and can be viewed by smart phones.For each box of Pixeneer, we will include a reference drawing with instructions to show how easy it is for you to create your masterpiece with Pixeneer chips.We also plan to create an online platform that allows everyone to create Pixeneer art themselves and share their masterpiece with the community. Within this platform, we can gather all the fans of pixel art and let everyone interact with each other. Everyone can be a Pixeneer!Demos:\After you back our project, please kindly send us a message and we will arrange the design package for you. We will contact you individually to confirm the design package arrangement.Design for the Hex Pixeneer:We can't express how grateful we are to have all you here with us. A huge thank you to everyone who has supported us throughout our wonderful Pixeneer journey so far! We couldn't have done this without all your supports!Some things just appear, though, and this wonderful art should have just appeared in any case and bring joy to the world. We all enjoyed a great time when we were working together to create Pixeneer and we hope through the campaign, we can share this joy to everyone around the world.

story:
BlackRock Dragway is a project to be brought to Burning Man in 2018. Burning man the week long Art and Music gathering, held in a dry lake bed about 100 miles from Reno every year always ending on the first Sunday of September. Home of the ten principles, Radical Inclusion, Gifting, Decommodification, Radical Self-reliance, Radical Self-expression, Communal Effort, Civic Responsibility, Leaving No Trace, Participation and Immediacy. 

  This interactive art project will provide spontaneous and late night drag racing entertainment and competition during the Event.

  Consisting of two mutant vehicles being built, one being , "the Starting line", the other " The Finish line". We would like to invite all the other mutant vehicles of Burning Man to come participate in 1/16th of a mile drag races on the playa, "Dusty drags". With a 5mph speed limit imposed on all vehicles at the event the races will be restricted to 5mph.  There will be radar guns that will display and monitor the speeds of the racers. Over 5mph and the racer will be red lighted and forfeit the race. L.e.d. timer boards and electronic timing will keep track of race times. ( a perfectly run 1/16 of a mile at 5mph would take 45 seconds) Records of racers times will be kept showing the over fastest times and fastest mutant vehicles through out the week. Trophies to be awarded to the top times posted during the week. All race winning participants will receive a BRDW winners flag.

 

The original design for the project was an idea to use a off road platform lift for the base vehicle and a 55 gal. drum as the starting line.    Coming across an older international harvester truck, (formally a state bridge service vehicle) in the fall of 2017 and I knew it was the perfect base vehicle, with the rear bed box sides being able to fold down and the whole bed being able to rise 18' foot in the air gives us a 15' by 15' raised viewers and officials platform with bleachers for seating. When not running the drag races the main vehicle will be used as transportation for the citizens of BRC. 

 After its initial debut at BRC this year the vehicles will be making the rounds of different Burning Man regionals next year with the addition of 6 adult sized big wheels for big wheeled drags at your local regional. 

 

 This campaign is to raise the funds needed to buy the final things to pull this all together and bring BlackRock Dragway to Burning Man in 2018. We are hoping to raise at least $10,500 to help cover the final push and help with expenses. It was a interesting time getting approval from the different departments that this project falls into to be invited to Black Rock City this year, requiring us to get dual mutant vehicle/ art project invitations. But that is a hurdle that has been cleared.

 The truck that is our base vehicle, "The FinishLine",     the secondary vehicle,  "StartingLine",    Your contributions will help with the final stretch cost of mostly electronics, lighting, radar guns, LED display boards, the bleachers, printed canvas and misc. (maybe a tee-shirt cannon for race nights)

 

 There will be a few weekend builds in the next few months to tie it all together.

 We are hoping you like our items that have been chosen for gifts to our supporters in the project,

                                                                                                                 

  and also please go to Face Book, ( https://www.facebook.com/BlackRock-DragWay-2358 ) for the BlackRock Dragway page and like to follow along on the builds grand completion.

 

  Thank you if you contributed, for every dollar will help us bring even more and make it even more spectacular. You are helping bring a most interactive mutant vehicle to the Burn this year, our DragWay is your DragWay, flag us down and come ride the playa with us or join us for one of the burn nights for a spectacular view from the bleachers. If you could not help us right now we understand, but please ask that you pass this projects page info along. 

   Hope to see you all and stop by to drop the winning flag, "In dust we trust",  FestieMike

story:
Ever wondered what a giant LED amusement park for grownups would look like? Well, we think about this on a rather strangely often basis and so this year the question will finally be answered, Dragon Burn style to boot!

The Electric Menagerie began as a germ of a concept in early 2018, as local Shanghai-based artists put their heads together in efforts towards a powerful vision for the 2018 Regional China Burn a.k.a. Dragon Burn. Various members of this collective had previously worked on wildly successful exhibits including Hammockville (3 years total experience), TRON, LadyFest, Storm Festival, and many more with clients including K11, 1933 Art Space, Island6 Art Collective, Remy Martin, Kulou and dozens more in collaboration with hundreds of local foreign and domestic artists/designers/creative types. 

However, this year was going to special, since everyone was motivated to kick things off early and so therefore enabling a greater effort with more impact and benefit to the festival. And so, The Menagerie (as it’s referred to in a shorter context, or TEM, or The Electric Menagerie if you’ve got time to spare) was born. 

It started off with a basic, relatively simple idea - how about a giant robotic LED-lit spider sculpture? How could we build something like this, and would it be combustible? All these ponderings eventually progressed into the current concept which resembles more of an exotic petting zoo for mad-hatters then anything else, if we had to sum it up in a short summary format. Or rather - A playground for the creative souls, the Post-Y Generation of digital nomadic types who are intrinsically drawn towards the innate beauty of illuminated LED abstract artworks. 

Eventually, the Menagerie concept was adapted to integrate as part of Hammockville, which also needs funding for Boxton, the art corner, Comfortress, and our various other essential neighborhoods that are being planned by our eager team known affectionally as Hamacas (the chosen residential nomenclature for said tribe of comfort enthusiasts). 

Hammockville is the coziest spot at Dragon Burn, for it offers everything comfort, cuddly, and cushy. Walking around town, we welcome you to visit our different boroughs of relaxation, sensory stimulation, and creativity. Our little town features a number of small neighborhoods that provide something for everyone - you may sway the day away in a 10-person hammock, or find yourself relaxing in The Comfortress (communal fort area for hosting DJ sets & workshops & more), or maybe you’ll end up in Slack City or Boxton. 

Hammockville is a community that welcomes everyone. We will have communal meals twice a day and take turns preparing for events and workshops. By day, Hammockville is a dream garden with never ending chill spots, hidden caches of hammocks and good vibes while at night it becomes a glowing LED playground. With an extensive network of LED cables connecting all corners of the camp, we ensure that we will be glowing all night long. This year, Hammockville will feature The Electric Menagerie as a psychedelic sculpture installation for late night chill outs as well as a compliment/roast chair, 3D printed chaos, Wook’s LED masterpiece “Illumination Type One” and many more surprises! 

Hammockville 是“龙焰”最舒服的位置，为人们提供最舒服，轻松，怡人的环境。

我们欢迎你走进我们的小镇，参观小镇不同的区域，轻松小镇，感官刺激小镇和创意小镇。 我们的小镇旨在建立多个为每个人提供服务的小型社区。 

你可以在一个供十人使用的吊床里摇上一整天；自由自在地在休息区里休憩（宽敞的供人休憩的工作室和DJ台），又或者你会在Slack City或者 Boxton小镇的快乐氛围中结束一天。 

想了解更多关于这些区域的朋友，请加入我们的阵营并且跟我们一起合作，让我们知道今年你想在Hammockville看到的东西。

Hammockville欢迎所有的人来加入我们，我们每天将举行两次集体聚餐，轮流准备活动和研讨会。白天Hammockville 是一个梦幻般的花园有永不停息的活动，隐藏的缓存和吊床，到了夜晚则变成LED发光游乐场, 凭借广泛连接所有区域的LED电缆网络，我们确保Hville将整夜灯火通明。今年，Hammockville将推动在深夜举办迷幻魔术秀，以及一个华丽的大厅来赞扬或吐槽你的朋友。只要按照地图和路牌指示，您就不会错过Hammockville所提供的任何景点。

story:
Short Summary

The www.mamastitches.com online creative community will be host and serve as a central hub to all the various aspects of the Mama Stitches brand including shopping Mama Stitches merchandise, our non profit, Cover With Love, games, and more!

 

 

 

WEBSITE BREAKDOWN

 

***Homepage***

The Mama Stitches Brand is one that is diverse with many inter relatable aspects including a non profit, app games, educational materials, socio-emotional healing and more.

 

The homepage for the Mama Stitches will be a dynamic, active page where any guest on the site can access every single aspect of the Mama Stitches Creative Community.

 

 

***Mama’s Mailbox***

Mama's Mailbox will a heartwarming aspect of the site where children can write personal letters to Mama Stitches and she can reply with an inspirational message of hope.

 

 

 

 

***Shop***

Users will be able to shop all of the awesome Mama Stitches gear!

 

 ***Book***

Educators can book Tunde & Mama Stitches for workshops, live readings and more!

 

 

***Mama Stitches I Love My Dog Blog***

The Mama Stitches I Love My Dog Blog will be an exciting online community where dog lovers from around the world cans hare dog training secrets, earn prizes, and upload their favorite adorable dog videos!

 

 ***Cover With Love***

More than a book series, Mama Stitches mission of love permeates into our world in the form of the Cover With Love non profit dedicated to being the hands and feet of love in the community.

 ***Byron’s Barbershop Books***

Byron's Barbershop books is a dynamic community literacy program where children earn prizes for reading to their barber! In collaboration with New Britain's own, Dallas Cowboys cornerback, Byron Jones.

***Sponsors***

The Mama Stitches.com Creative community would not exists without our sensational sponsors. We would like to extend a formal thank you you to the following organizations for believing in our vision!

SPONSORS

 

Mayor Erin Stewart 

New Britain Police Athletic Union

Lifeway Church

 

 ***Links***

The Mama Stitches.com website is more than just a traditional site, but a creative community.
We believe in the power of collaboration and that true leadership is lifting while climbing. Feel free to click one of the links below to check out more information about one of our collaborating  organizations!



WWW.BRASSCITYGAMERS.COM

 


 

WWW.INTHECUTBARBERLOUNGE.COM

 

 

WWW.DMTSRADIO.COM

***Mama Stitches Mega Readers/ I Love Reading Schools***

The Mama Stitches Mega Readers portal will be a specialized area where parents and educators can login to track student reading, download exciting new Mama Stitches content

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP?

 

WHAT YOU GET!


 

 

CUSTOM ART GALLERY

 

Mama Stitches Tears of Love HD Digital Print

 

 

A City Changed By Love HD Digital Print

 

Little Mama Basket of Love HD Digital Print

 

Miss Kate HD Digital Print

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

 

I am excited to be partnering with Cindy Donaldson of Red Barn Consulting to create the website! Cindy and her amazing team have over 20 years f experience inc eating dynamic and professional websites for a variety of lines including artists and banks!

 

They have quoted me for $3,000 for a basic website but in under to actually create the full fledged website I will need $10,000!

 

I decided to go with an Indiegogo to at least start us off with with the following benchmarks

$1,000- Base Target Goal!

$3,000-Base  website

$5,000- Advanced Features( Advanced blog features, interactivity)

$10,000- Full fledged, fully functional website with back hosting and a sizeable database!

I have had some support to go towards the $3,000 so decided to at least

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

 

PERKS LIST

$5- (Airbud High Five) (Social Media Shoutout & Thank you!)

$10-  (Beethoven)-  Airbud High Five + 2FREE  8.5x11 Digital Print download( of your choice) 

$20-(Snoopy)- Airbud High Five + Beethoven+ FREE 11.17 Digital Print download( of your choice)

$50-(Wishbone) Airbud High Five + Beethoven + Snoopy+ FREE 18x24 Digital print download of your choice

$100-(Clifford)-  Airbud High Five+ Beethoven+ Snoopy+ Wishbone+ FREE early release demo version of Butterscotch's Bubblegum.

$150( Lucky Package)+ Airbud High Five + Beethoven + Snoopy +Wishbone + Clifford+ One FREE Month's membership to the Mama Stitches I Love My Dog Blog!!

$300+ Mama Stitches Mega Package
Airbud High Five + Beethoven+ Snoopy+ Wishbone+Clifford+ Lucky Package+ one FREE Custom Thank You Video to be shared on all Social Media Outlets with your permission.

The Impact

Your support will go a long way to making this dream of a Mama Stitche interactive creative community a reality. Too often many children grow up in broken homes and never get told that they are loved. Help us spread Mama Stitches message of hope and love up and down and all around the world!

 

In the Past I have held several events funded by dedicated crowd funders including our Victory Film Premiere

 

And the Mama Stitches 5,000 back to School Book Release Block Party!

***MAMA STITCHES 5,000 BACK TO SCHOOL BOOK RELEASE BLOCK PARTY TRAILER***

 

 
 
***MAMA STITCHES 5,000 BACK TO SCHOOL BOOK RELEASE BLOCK HIGHLIGHT VIDEO***

 

Risks & Challenges

We risk not making the full target goal for the website but I have already began meeting with investors to be able to fund the remaining amounts!

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to spread the word and share the link on all forms of social media!

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Introduce yourself and your background.
Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get
 
I am excited to be partnering with Cindy Donaldson of Red Barn Consulting to create the website! Cindy and her amazing team have over 20 years f experience inc eating dynamic and professional websites for a variety of lines including artists and banks!
 
They have quoted me for $3,000 for a basic website but in under to actually create the full fledged website I will need $10,000!
 
I decided to go with an Indiegogo to at least start us off with with the following benchmarks
$1,000- Base Target Goal!
$3,000-Base  website
$5,000- Advanced Features( Advanced blog features, interactivity)
$10,000- Full fledged, fully functional website with back hosting and a sizeable database!
I have had some support to go towards the $3,000 so decided to at least
Break it down for folks in more detail:

Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

 
PERKS LIST
$5- (Airbud High Five) (Social Media Shoutout & Thank you!)$10-  (Beethoven)-  Airbud High Five + 2FREE  8.5x11 Digital Print download( of your choice) $20-(Snoopy)- Airbud High Five + Beethoven+ FREE 11.17 Digital Print download( of your choice)$50-(Wishbone) Airbud High Five + Beethoven + Snoopy+ FREE 18x24 Digital print download of your choice$100-(Clifford)-  Airbud High Five+ Beethoven+ Snoopy+ Wishbone+ FREE early release demo version of Butterscotch's Bubblegum.$150( Lucky Package)+ Airbud High Five + Beethoven + Snoopy +Wishbone + Clifford+ One FREE Month's membership to the Mama Stitches I Love My Dog Blog!!$300+ Mama Stitches Mega PackageAirbud High Five + Beethoven+ Snoopy+ Wishbone+Clifford+ Lucky Package+ one FREE Custom Thank You Video to be shared on all Social Media Outlets with your permission.

The Impact
Your support will go a long way to making this dream of a Mama Stitche interactive creative community a reality. Too often many children grow up in broken homes and never get told that they are loved. Help us spread Mama Stitches message of hope and love up and down and all around the world!
 
In the Past I have held several events funded by dedicated crowd funders including our Victory Film Premiere

 
And the Mama Stitches 5,000 back to School Book Release Block Party!

***MAMA STITCHES 5,000 BACK TO SCHOOL BOOK RELEASE BLOCK PARTY TRAILER***
 

 
 
***MAMA STITCHES 5,000 BACK TO SCHOOL BOOK RELEASE BLOCK HIGHLIGHT VIDEO***


 


Risks & Challenges
We risk not making the full target goal for the website but I have already began meeting with investors to be able to fund the remaining amounts!

Other Ways You Can Help
Feel free to spread the word and share the link on all forms of social media!

story:
One of our teens, Star, began attending the weekly ChopArt sessions after she’d been kicked out of her house when she and her parents discovered her teen pregnancy. At first Star didn’t really trust anyone, and for good reason. The adults around her had demonstrated their disinterest in her well being, and she was on the streets with her baby growing inside her not knowing where she would sleep or if she would have a meal outside of school hours. Despite her reluctance to speak to the ChopArt staff, she came every week to sit in a corner of the room and write poetry. While the rest of the class worked on their canvas work, Star covered her canvas with red paint and carved her poetry into the wet paint before drowning her words in another layer of red paint. She did this for about a month...she literally drowned out her own voice over and over again. About 6 weeks in, Star came to the shelter and didn’t pick up any supplies. She just sat. Her ChopArt mentor went over to that corner of the room and sat with her. Silently, she just sat there with Star willing her and giving her permission to feel whatever it was she was going through. After about a half hour, Star began to cry. It was almost like she was crying for everything that had ever gone wrong in her life. She revealed that she’d lost the baby. She was stressed and malnourished and didn’t make it past the first trimester. This was such a horrific outcome, we couldn’t imagine how she’d mustered up the strength to come to class. Later Star told us that ChopArt class was the only place she could exhale, it was the only place she didn’t feel judged, and it was the only place she felt like she was in control.

This is what it means for the Arts to be a tool for trauma recovery for homeless teens.

A little over a year ago, ChopArt's CEO & Founder met Sara Blakely, Founder of Spanx, and her wonderful team. Our Founder, along with some other incredible women sat at Center for Civic Innovation (CCI), poured their hearts out to Sara which resulted in an investment in 10 women entrepreneurs for 2017. That investment elevated ChopArt with ongoing training from CCI, the ability to try new strategies and serve more teens, and the privilege to work alongside 9 other brilliant women entrepreneurs. 

We are hoping to continue serving homeless teens with that same momentum! It only take $55 to sponsor a teen for a full year of Arts mentorship. Please make this investment in our teens to show Star and her peers that you are committed to her well being and her ability to be seen. 

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

I discovered (and fell in love with) clay in 1971 when I was a sophomore in high school. For more than 20 years I studied ceramics in high school and college. And though I also worked toward a career that would pay the bills, for several years I sold everything from clay jewelry to large decorative sculptural pots in crafts fairs and shows, winning several competitions around the Intermountain West.

In 1996 I got married and started nearly a 20-year stretch where I gave up doing pottery and became a community college writing teacher and adult educator and missionary. I was doing my best to help people, working in the Native American population in the American Southwest.

In 2013, I ended up in the hospital due to the stress of a too-heavy workload in a Christian nonprofit. I "retired" from this, and, wondering what I would do next, I purchased my first electric potter's wheel with money from my mother's estate. This is when I had the "crazy" idea of using my gifts as an artist and potter to reach hurting people among this population. I quickly learned that it was not a crazy idea at all, but something many people around the world were beginning to use: creating in the arts as a way to open hurting and traumatized individual's hearts, leading to opportunities to learn and grow and move ahead in life.

As you participate in this, you will be enabling suffering people to move ahead in their lives, when otherwise they would remain stuck as victims of trauma and hurt.

What We Need & What You Get

I have been working with the local college adult education center director for the last three years. She has asked me to set up a pottery/art studio in the center, which I have started to do. This is an amazing opportunity to use the arts in this setting and to be able to offer classes to the community at large.

To do this properly, I need $15,000: $5,000 to set up the studio, $3,000 to refurbish and set up a class-sized gas kiln that was donated, and $6,000 for a used pickup truck for hauling all the various things involved in a project like this. I have created spreadsheets that detail the specific needs in each of these areas.

If you participate in this project, you will be helping to set up the first studio of its kind in this area. The only pottery classes available in this area at this time are those at the local community college, but one has to sign up for a semester. The classes I offer will be very individualized, and, as I have already stated, will offer a "community of love" in which to work and grow.

Finally, there are perks! For the last four years, I have been working part-time getting my pottery skills back. I have made mainly bowls and mugs and will offer these are perks. For a $50 contribution, you will receive a mug (you can specify how small or large). For a $75 contribution, you will receive a planter or serving-size bowl. For a $150 contribution, you will receive a set of 4 cereal-sized bowls. For larger contributions, we can work out something.

My pieces are made of high-fired stoneware or porcelain and are microwave and dishwasher safe.

The Impact

Why is this project valuable?
 
Gallup, NM (where I live) is 75% Native American, 20% Hispanic, and 5% all others. Poverty, violence, and alcohol and drug abuse are far above the national averages. Because of this, the high school dropout rate is high, and of those wanting to attend the local community college (UNM-Gallup), 80% require remedial courses before they can take regular college classes.
 
The question is, always, "How do we help people in this region to succeed in life?"  Frequently, an individual needs time to work through and heal past hurts and trauma, in an adult education environment, before he or she can take classes that will enable them to achieve a high school equivalency diploma. This is where Hope Pottery & Arts comes in. Located in the adult education center, students are already in a place where they have the opportunity to learn, and now they will be able to create in clay and other materials, an activity that helps push back trauma and open the heart to healing.
 
Just one example: Judy (not her real name) deals with anger issues. She comes from a home where not only is she not wanted, but where her mother has told her that she ought to kill herself so the mother won't have to deal with her. Amazingly, she still comes to class. But sometimes it is too much for her and she can't stay in the classroom. She came outside and help me work on a project where I was creating a framework on which to put 400 handprints in clay. After 15 minutes, she was able to return to class and finish her work. The teacher told me later how powerful this was.
 
It is seeing this scenario repeat itself over and over that will come of your participation in this project.
 

Risks & Challenges

1. Though I have been firing my own small gas kiln for many years, I have never rebuilt a large one, like the one that's been donated. I had to remove all the bricks before I could haul it along a very bumpy dirt road and then 175 miles further to Gallup. I believe I have the skills, and I am sure many people will be interested in this project. After all, this is not about me; it is about all of us.

2. I am raising funds now for setup but will need funds for a continuous operation of the studio. The costs are relatively low because I am not in my own building, and I will be charging students in the community. I am also very interested in reaching out to all the various ethnic groups in the community to encourage their participation. This is certainly part of what this is all about.

3. I have done things by myself my whole life, so it is a new challenge to enlist others to participate and to not just be in charge and make sure things are done my way. However, on the other side, the last several years (I'm 62 now), something significant has happened inside me so that I am able to reach out to others in ways I never could before.

4. Since I am setting up the kiln on the center property, it is possible that I will have to move it to my home (liability, etc.). The kiln can be moved, on paved city streets, to my home.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways, outside the financial, where you can help! Certainly, if you live in the area, you can contact me and we can talk about how you might help. You can also share with your social network all about this endeavor. And you can use the Indiegogo share tools. Finally, you might know of equipment or tools that you or someone else is not using that could be send this way.

story:
katsea gallery is a new art gallery coming soon to Towson at the Towson Commons on Pennsylvania Avenue. 

katsea gallery is a preparing to be a space for unknown, up and coming and established artists to showcase their work. 

 

The contributions will assist in getting the gallery open. Funds will be used for furniture, display and hanging systems, supplies and permits. There are additional items...But that's the bulk of it. 

 

Art is Important! Your contributions will be assisting artists and their work!

 

If you can't contribute at this time, please share the page with friends and family!

 

THANK YOU!
