story:
In this issue of Heavy Music Artwork magazine looks at the question of 'Belief'. Of course, the question is mainly philosophical and is not intended to refer to religion alone necessarily. The previous issue we focused on ‘Nihilism’, the belief in nothing. We are moving on to explore what bands and artists do believe and what makes their work matter on a spiritual level.

Featuring: Dimmu Borgir, The Mystery of the Bulgarian Voices ft. Lisa Gerrard , At The Gates, Amorphis, Immortal, Kamelot, Powerwolf, Necrophobic, Marduk, Tsjuder, Hooded Menace, Craft, Pungent Stench and Lik.

Ken Sarafin, David Herrerias, John Santerineross, Elijah Gwhedhú Tamu, Thomas Ewerhard, Gustavo Sazes, Rafael Tavares and Mark Cooper.

  • Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable-based inks
  • Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
  • Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
  • 100 pages
  • 1700 Total units printed 

Arte Divina highlighted divinity and the holy act of creativity. Arte Arcana focus on the dark side of the arts from whatever philosophical source artists draw their inspiration. Speaking across cultures and traditions is difficult to say what can be considered "dark". We invite artists to share their visions, interpretations, critiques, thoughts and discussions.

'Arte Arcana' In approx numbers 

  • 50 artists 
  • Extended articles 
  • 240 pages (approx) 
  • 500 high-quality art images 
  • 300 Limited Editions 
  • Hardback gloss finish 
  • 200 gms high gloss 
  • 260mm deep x 210mm wide 
  • Hand numbered and embossed

Participating artists
Adolfo W.B. ☩ Abstract Chaos Design (The Art of Federico Bossinga) ☩ Adrian Bilozor ☩ Agardnas ☩ Andrej Bartulovic ☩ Angelo Roccagli ☩ Anna Levytska ☩ Arjen Kunnen ☩ Artem Grigoryev ☩ Bahrull Marta ☩ Björn Gooßes ☩ Brian D'Agosta ☩ Brian Sheehan ☩ Caelan Stokkermans ☩ Carlos Fides ☩ Carlos Andres Jacome ☩ Chadwick St. John ☩ Christophe Szpajdel ☩ Daniele Valeriani ☩ Elijah Gwhedhú Tamu ☩ Fabiano Gagliano ☩ Federico Bossinga ☩ Felipe Machado Franco ☩ Gianluca Gambino ☩ Giannis Nakos ☩ Gustavo Sazes ☩ Jason Marshall ☩ JL Rey ☩ Juha Vuorma ☩ Justin Bartlett ☩ Justin Meyers ☩ Ken Coleman ☩ Lenore Ani ☩ Ludovic Cordelières ☩ Max 'Teratogen' Winter ☩ Mayhem Project Design ☩ Mike Hrubovcak ☩ Nick Deligaris ☩ Putrefurnaced Guerrilla Sketches ☩ Rhett Podersoo ☩ Roberto Lezama ☩ Roberto Toderico ☩ Sam Hayles ☩ Santiago Ramos ☩ Simon Bossert ☩ Metal Artworks ☩ Timon Kokott ☩ Vagelis Petikas ☩ Vladislav Cadaversky ☩ more to be confirmed.

Your contribution will help us release our 8th installation 'Belief' and 'Arte Arcana' book. Is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the world. We are looking to raise a base of £3,000. This will help us with the release the magazine and of course help with bills, etc.

This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards

  • 30% Production costs
  • 20% Marketing
  • 18% Overheads
  • 25% Printing costs
  • 7% Campaign fees

  • End post-modernism
  • Promote graphic artists, music artists
  • Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
  • Examine through music, art, and literature all aspects of the human condition

  • Your contributions will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as a whole
  • We are dedicated to having our publications in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
  • Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands

Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement. Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 12K HMA email subscribers. We also have an online store where you can buy directly from us www.heavymusicartwork.bigcartel.com

Debemur Morti Productions, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Pitch Black Records, Snapper Music, SPV, Warner Music, Svart Records, Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.

As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years of delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. We are already in the 3rd book and 7th magazine release.

If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.

Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 12K HMA email subscribers. We also have an online store where you can buy directly from us www.heavymusicartwork.bigcartel.comDebemur Morti Productions, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Pitch Black Records, Snapper Music, SPV, Warner Music, Svart Records, Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years of delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. We are already in the 3rd book and 7th magazine release.If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.

story:
(Litote + You) x Bangkok Biennial 2020 = Liminal Pavilion

 

Hello Everyone!

We are Litote, a curatorial collective from Montreal, Canada. Today we are looking for your support to make the Liminal Pavilion a success!
 

We are collaborating with the Bangkok Biennial 2020 to create, organize, and realize a pavilion that will showcase groundbreaking and under-represented artists from around the globe. It will be presented twice: first in Montreal, Canada (Oct 31st- Nov 21st), then in Bangkok (March 13 -April 3rd).
 

Consisting of digital prints and video works, the Liminal Pavilion is born from the transformation our world is undergoing. We wish to take these uncertain times and show how it can be an incentive to creativity, social connections, and eye-opening possibilities. 
 

The Liminal Pavilion is a platform that amplifies these voices of change, these new realities.

 

Why Do We Need Your Help?


Right now, the pavilion is 100% self-funded by us, Litote. We are seeking your help in alleviating  certain costs related to the production of this project and allow us to offer a participation fee to our amazing artists!!!
 

So how will we use the funds?

We came up with an approach that benefits everyone involved : You, the Artists, and the Pavilion. This is how it works:
 

  • You: In exchange of your support, we are making limited edition prints to add to (or start) your art collection. Each of which comes with our infinite gratitude!
     
  • Artists: We believe that every artist deserves financial compensation for their creative work. That's why 50% of each print sold goes directly in the artist's pocket.
     
  • The Pavilion: With this money, we will:
    • Produce and ship to you the limited print you chose
    • Buy technological material to show the works ( mini-screens, raspberry Pi)
    • Create digital prints on vinyl to be shown at the venue ( around 20 prints)
    • Build a marketing campaign that will allow all our artists to be at the forefront of this event

 

Own a Limited Edition Art Prints and Poster!!!

 

These Limited edition artworks are made specially for the occasion! Each one is 4 x 6 inches (10,2 x 15,2 cm) and the edition of 20 printed on museum-grade paper (Verona 300R [300g/m2]). Here's the selection of the prints:

 

Curro Rodriguez, Debla

 

Alexandre Silveira, The Weight of the Earth

 

Shir Handelsman, Who Owns the Sun?

 

Yuyen Lin-Woywod, Stilluntitled – Way of Listening

 

Gene Chen, Aly 9, Ln 82, Sec 1, Bade Rd

 

Wei Zhang, Father, Dad, Daddy

 

Leonardo Sinopoli, 331

 

Frank Yefeng Wang, The House of the Solitary (The Quarantine Poems)

 

Bengisu Uykusu, Limbo of the Screens

 

Mollye Bendell, Sketch for Sleepers

 

Rastros de Diógenes Potiguara, Mandinga Manual

 

Fabio Thieme, Salon Gloria

 

Myriam Haccoun, The map isn't the territory

 

Robert Gabris, You will never belong into my space

 

Yiannis Pappas, Control 'til End

 

Robin Lopvet, Family Album

Julie Lequin, Video-journal

 

Pavilion Poster: Made by a member of Litote and a conceptual artist Pierre Chaumont, this image beautifully translates our idea of liminality. A4 size and the edition of 20.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

You can also help us by sharing our campaign on social media and getting the word out!  To receive the project updates, please visit our social media pages and website:

Facebook here
Instagram here
Website here

 

Thank You Note

Lastly, we would like to thank everyone of you who've shown your interest in our project.
We also want to express our gratitude to Alexandra, Bengisu, Curro, Fabio, Frank, Gene, Julie, Leonardo, Mollye, Myriam, Rastros, Robert, Robin, Shir, Wei, Yiannis and Yuyen for making this campaign possible. We are excited to showcase your amazing works with the world in October.

- Marie and Pierre from Litote

story:
English first, y Español a continuación.

Who we are

El Sr. Corchea is an independent art-related blog getting increasing traction with 10000 visits during the last three months since our rebranded comeback. El Sr. Corchea is led by Elvia Rosa Castro, a well-known and respected Cuban intellectual, curator, and Art critic with more than 25 years of writing, teaching, and promoting Art. It has been outlined as a free venue, away from the institutional censorship and exclusion policies. Those who want to collaborate, no matter the race, genre, age, language, and nationality, are very welcomed here. Liberty, democracy, and responsibility are the scent of this publication. 

The beauty of the intellect is everywhere, and El Sr. Corchea reveals it by publishing daily high doses of articles, interviews, reviews, and essays related to Art. That’s why intellectuals, artists, students, and culture lovers regularly come looking for inspiration, support, knowledge, and ideas exchange.

Why we do this

We've been consistently committed with defending the Cubans’ artistic nation against all odds: overcoming bureaucratic hesitations, technological constraints, and almost non-existent funding. Also, El Sr. Corchea is the foundational stone of a much larger and ambitious independent editorial project.

Our goal is to achieve greater visibility of these essential critical voices, artists, and by extension, culture. The blog needs to maintain periodical releases that include, among others:

  1. Administration
  2. To expand the network of collaborators by paying a fee for their work
  3. Translation into English of the texts published in that space
  4. Promoting the blog

This campaign aims to raise funds to help to achieve these goals.

Until now, El Señor Corchea has delivered news and texts because of the selfless collaboration of many Cuban art critics, and also thanks to the generosity of some of Elvia's friends, who have paid for hosting services, among others. And above all, because of the goodwill of its founder, Elvia Rosa Castro, who has been managing, editing, and promoting the blog without receiving remuneration or profit, only moved by her excessive altruism, philanthropy, and trust in the new generations she has helped to educate.

Below, a comparison among similar publications performance on social media.

Why supporting El Señor Corchea?

It is the first blog of visual arts issued inside Cuba from a completely autonomous and independent position. El Sr. Corchea also was the first blog inside the visual arts in creating massive bridges between artists and art critics of the diaspora and those who reside in Cuba, as well as with art-loving readership.

Now, El Sr. Corchea operates outside Cuba y its challenges consist of widening the promotional horizons by increasing the frequency in collaborations, as well as reaching targets that are art lovers and English-speakers. 

El Sr. Corchea is still is one of those vulnerable and fragile projects that need the patronage and goodwill of arts and culture lovers. More than significant, your contribution is vital.

El Sr. Corchea needs your support today!

Why now

It is always a good time for stepping in for supporting arts and culture. El Sr. Corchea aims to remain independent, raising its voice for encouraging Cuban artists, students, critics, art historians, dealers, and art lovers. Now is always the right moment, and we’re back to stay.

Why you

Since we've experienced firsthand your interest in arts and your ties to Cubans lifestyle and culture, we would love to have you as a patron. Indeed, we’ve designed a section on our blog for specifically showcasing the persons committed to defending art-related causes.

What we need

Would you consider donating today for helping this project to continue?

To donate and to share this message is a good starting point. Can we count on you?

¡Thank you very much, and let’s put this campaign in motion! 

 

 

¿Quiénes somos?

El Sr. Corchea es un blog independiente relacionado con el arte que ha ido generando gran interés del público desde su regreso, con de 10000 visitas en tres meses. El Sr. Corchea está liderado por Elvia Rosa Castro, reconocida y respetada intelectual, curadora y crítica de arte cubana quien ha estado enseñando, escribiendo y promoviendo arte por más de 25 años. Ha sido concebido como una avenida libre, alejado de la censura institucional y de las políticas excluyentes. Aquellos que quieran colaborar, sin importar la raza, edad, lengua, género y nacionalidad son bienvenidos aquí. Libertad, democracia y responsabilidad son el aroma de esta publicación.

La belleza del intelecto está dondequiera, y El Sr. Corchea las revela publicando diariamente y sin descanso altas dosis de artículos, entrevistas, ensayos y reseñas relacionadas con el arte. Por eso, los intelectuales, artistas, estudiantes y amantes de la cultura regularmente lo visitan buscando inspiración, apoyo, conocimiento e intercambio de ideas.

¿Por qué lo hacemos?

Hemos defendido permanentemente la nación artística de todos los Cubanos contra viento y marea: venciendo obstáculos burocráticos, dificultadas tecnológicas y un financiamiento inestable. Además, El Sr. Corchea es la piedra fundacional de un mayor y ambicioso proyecto editorial.

Para lograr una mayor visibilidad de estas necesarias voces críticas, de los artistas y por extensión de la cultura, el blog necesita una sistematicidad editorial que contempla, entre otros: 

  1. Administración
  2. Ampliar red de colaboradores mediante remuneración
  3. Traducción al inglés de los textos que en dicho espacio se publican
  4. Promoción del blog

Esta campaña tiene el propósito de recaudar fondos para alcanzar estas metas.

Hasta ahora, El Señor Corchea se ha mantenido gracias a la colaboración desinteresada y gratuita de varios críticos cubanos, a la generosidad de algunos amigos que han sostenido financieramente la plataforma en que está hospedado el blog y a la voluntad de su fundadora, Elvia Rosa Castro, quien ha estado administrando, editando y promoviendo el blog sin ningún tipo de remuneración o ganancia, movida únicamente por su desmedido altruismo, filantropía y fe en la nueva generación que ella ha ayudado a formar. 

Debajo, una comparación del rendimiento en redes sociales de algunas de las publicaciones similares.

¿Por qué apoyar a El Señor Corchea?

Este es el primer blog de artes visuales creado dentro de Cuba desde una postura totalmente autónoma e independiente. El Sr. Corchea también fue el primer blog dentro de las artes visuales en crear puentes entre artistas y críticos de arte de la diáspora y los residentes en Cuba, así como con lectores amantes del arte. 

Ahora El Sr. Corchea opera generalmente fuera de Cuba y sus nuevos retos son ampliar los horizontes de promoción mediante el incremento sistemático de colaboraciones, así como alcanzar al público amante del arte pero que no es hispanohablante.

Pero aún El Sr. Corchea es uno de esos proyectos vulnerables y frágiles que necesitan del mecenazgo y la buena voluntad de los amantes al arte y la cultura en general. Más que significante, tu aporte es vital.

¡El Sr. Corchea necesita tu apoyo hoy!

¿Por qué ahora?

Siempre es buen tiempo para apoyar el arte y la cultura. El Sr. Corchea desea permanecer independiente, amplificando las voces de artistas, estudiantes, críticos, historiadores, dealers y amantes del arte. Ahora es siempre el momento exacto, y hemos regresado para quedarnos.

¿Por qué tú?

Ya que sabemos de primera mano acerca de tu interés por las artes y de tus vínculos con la cultura cubana, nos encantaría contar contigo como sponsor. De hecho, hemos previsto toda una sección dentro de nuestro blog dedicada a las personas interesadas en apoyar proyectos artísticos.

Lo que necesitamos

¿Considerarías una donación en el día de hoy para ayudar a la continuidad de El Sr. Corchea?

Donar y compartir este mensaje es un buen comienzo. ¿Podemos contar contigo?

Muchísimas gracias y pongamos esta campaña en marcha!

story:
Short Summary of the Owner, The Dream, & The Obstacles

  • My name is Brian K. Rice. I've worked over 15 years in engineering across many cities but my DREAM was to move back home and create spaces in under served areas for ENTREPRENEURS and for PEOPLE DEVELOPMENT so we can IMPROVE our communities.
  • I thought with my engineering background and the purchasing of the buildings it would have been easier to secure funding create spaces for the Arts, Business Incubators, Entrepreneurship Development, Restaurants, Lofts and more. I learned that when banks don't want to loan in certain communities they find ways to do just that. In my case, the bank had my 8 buildings appraised at $0, making it the worst appraisal not just in Alabama but in the United States. 5 of the buildings are in the background of the Believe in Ensley Urban Studios picture.  These buildings have value and our communities have value. If you remove the inequality in banking, I would have received my funding almost 2 years ago and all 8 of my buildings would be completed with a variety of businesses that add vibrancy, new jobs, restaurants, technology focused spaces, youth entrepreneurship, business incubators, mixed with the visual arts and performing arts for music, painters, and dance for the community. It is very important that others know that local access to resources has been the greatest obstacle for African Americans for well over 100 years. We have to get creative and I'm hoping you invest in this project to launch the next phase of development. 
  • By contributing and helping us reach our rehab goal for the Urban Studios, you will help create spaces for over 25 CREATIVE ENTREPRENEURS from this community and surrounding communities

Where Will Your Investments Go

  • The space we are updating is a 100 year old former theater. It was one of the first motion picture theaters in the state of Alabama called the Belle Theater. We need $150,000 for the next phase of renovations of approximately 3500sf which will help us renovate almost half of the first floor of approximately 7500sf which will give over 25 creative youth and adult entrepreneurs shared spaces to develop and host clients. The building where this will be housed is 3 stories and over 17,000sf.  If we were to try to tackle the first floor alone the price would exceed $350,000 and almost $2,000,000 if we tried to tackle the whole building and twice if we tried to renovate all 8 buildings on the block. This project will help launch the other projects. By placing creative on the block first, we will have a team of professionals to help market future expansions for the future entrepreneurs needed for other buildings.  
  • Whether you give as little of $1 or you are able to give the full amount for all renovations of this building and others, we will use your contributions to renovate this block and improve this community. We hope you contribute.
  • Your contributions will help us get closer to this phase of renovations and if we exceed the contributions we will put the funds into the next of the 8 buildings on this block that will help develop this community. 

Your Contributions Will Help Over 25 Creative Entrepreneurs in Phase 1

  • Your contributions in this phase will help over 25 creative entrepreneurs. Once all buildings are renovated on the block we will have spaces for over 50 entrepreneurs through shared spaces from the Believe in Ensley Urban Studios to future developments that will consist of Art Studios, Dance/Yoga, Business Incubators for Various Professionals, Lofts and more
  • In Phase 1, in addition to space for the entrepreneurs we will be launching workforce development training for videographers, photographers, graphic designers, script writers, and we will be offering digital music lessons out these spaces
  • If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Brian through www.briankrice.com
  • Brian has a true heart for the community building, people building and for business building.
  • Contribute to this campaign and help us build a healthy and balanced community. 

Risks & Challenges

  • There are risks and challenges in everything we do. Our greatest risk is leaving the buildings and our community undeveloped, therefore creating more chances for unfortunate circumstances. This creates daily risks and challenges for the youth and adults of the community
  • The greatest challenge has been the unfair banking challenge in this community and your funds will help us move past this challenge. In this commercial district, we have only learned of 1 African American business owner to ever receive a loan to develop their buildings and that is why it is important to utilize crowd funding to get past the unfortunate practices of inequality banking. Brian K. Rice, who we call "The Community Engineer" has sacrificed it all to lead the charge and because this was his dream over 10 years ago, he always says, "some things are too important to leave for the next generation to change, we have to do all we can to make our difference." When it comes to the funding challenge, Brian always says, "If we are met with the obstacle of few resources, we must keep searching until we find the resources we need."

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If know of others who may support, please share this campaign with them and ask them specifically to help where you think they can make the greatest impact. 
  • Please share through Text Messages, Phone Calls, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, other Websites, Emails and more.
  • Please share through Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please send people to www.briankrice.com if they want to help Brian in other ways

Thank you,

Brian K. Rice, The Community Engineer, www.briankrice.com

I thought with my engineering background and the purchasing of the buildings it would have been easier to secure funding create spaces for the Arts, Business Incubators, Entrepreneurship Development, Restaurants, Lofts and more. I learned that when banks don't want to loan in certain communities they find ways to do just that. In my case, the bank had my 8 buildings appraised at $0, making it the worst appraisal not just in Alabama but in the United States. 5 of the buildings are in the background of the Believe in Ensley Urban Studios picture.  These buildings have value and our communities have value. If you remove the inequality in banking, I would have received my funding almost 2 years ago and all 8 of my buildings would be completed with a variety of businesses that add vibrancy, new jobs, restaurants, technology focused spaces, youth entrepreneurship, business incubators, mixed with the visual arts and performing arts for music, painters, and dance for the community. It is very important that others know that local access to resources has been the greatest obstacle for African Americans for well over 100 years. We have to get creative and I'm hoping you invest in this project to launch the next phase of development. 
By contributing and helping us reach our rehab goal for the Urban Studios, you will help create spaces for over 25 CREATIVE ENTREPRENEURS from this community and surrounding communities

Where Will Your Investments Go

The space we are updating is a 100 year old former theater. It was one of the first motion picture theaters in the state of Alabama called the Belle Theater. We need $150,000 for the next phase of renovations of approximately 3500sf which will help us renovate almost half of the first floor of approximately 7500sf which will give over 25 creative youth and adult entrepreneurs shared spaces to develop and host clients. The building where this will be housed is 3 stories and over 17,000sf.  If we were to try to tackle the first floor alone the price would exceed $350,000 and almost $2,000,000 if we tried to tackle the whole building and twice if we tried to renovate all 8 buildings on the block. This project will help launch the other projects. By placing creative on the block first, we will have a team of professionals to help market future expansions for the future entrepreneurs needed for other buildings.  
Whether you give as little of $1 or you are able to give the full amount for all renovations of this building and others, we will use your contributions to renovate this block and improve this community. We hope you contribute.
Your contributions will help us get closer to this phase of renovations and if we exceed the contributions we will put the funds into the next of the 8 buildings on this block that will help develop this community. 

Your Contributions Will Help Over 25 Creative Entrepreneurs in Phase 1

Your contributions in this phase will help over 25 creative entrepreneurs. Once all buildings are renovated on the block we will have spaces for over 50 entrepreneurs through shared spaces from the Believe in Ensley Urban Studios to future developments that will consist of Art Studios, Dance/Yoga, Business Incubators for Various Professionals, Lofts and more
In Phase 1, in addition to space for the entrepreneurs we will be launching workforce development training for videographers, photographers, graphic designers, script writers, and we will be offering digital music lessons out these spaces
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Brian through www.briankrice.com

Brian has a true heart for the community building, people building and for business building.
Contribute to this campaign and help us build a healthy and balanced community. 


Risks & Challenges

There are risks and challenges in everything we do. Our greatest risk is leaving the buildings and our community undeveloped, therefore creating more chances for unfortunate circumstances. This creates daily risks and challenges for the youth and adults of the community
The greatest challenge has been the unfair banking challenge in this community and your funds will help us move past this challenge. In this commercial district, we have only learned of 1 African American business owner to ever receive a loan to develop their buildings and that is why it is important to utilize crowd funding to get past the unfortunate practices of inequality banking. Brian K. Rice, who we call "The Community Engineer" has sacrificed it all to lead the charge and because this was his dream over 10 years ago, he always says, "some things are too important to leave for the next generation to change, we have to do all we can to make our difference." When it comes to the funding challenge, Brian always says, "If we are met with the obstacle of few resources, we must keep searching until we find the resources we need."


Other Ways You Can Help

If know of others who may support, please share this campaign with them and ask them specifically to help where you think they can make the greatest impact. 
Please share through Text Messages, Phone Calls, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, other Websites, Emails and more.
Please share through Indiegogo share tools!
Please send people to www.briankrice.com if they want to help Brian in other ways

Thank you,Brian K. Rice, The Community Engineer, www.briankrice.com

story:
Jardin de pommes et d’argile || Le déambulatoire poétique  est l’initiative des artistes multidisciplinaires Joann Coté et Marjorie de Chantal, en collaboration avec la ville de Mont-Saint-Hilaire et le Ministère de la Culture et des Communications du Québec.

Le projet

Le projet Jardin de pommes et d’argile se veut un sentier poétique au sein d’un environnement naturel et patrimonial. Des oeuvres intégrées au jardin proposent au public un parcours  de découvertes alliant l’art, la nature et le patrimoine bâti.

Pour sa première édition, Coeur de pomme invite les artistes céramistes ou les artistes en arts visuels à exposer leurs oeuvres à même les infrastructures naturelles du site, en les intégrant de façon inusitée voire éclatée, sur le sol, suspendues aux arbres, sur les balcons etc. Le verger sera ainsi transformé en parcours d’exposition artistique empreint de poésie.  

Prenant place au milieu de l’installation, se trouvera un petit café éphémère offrant produits locaux à déguster.  

Mission Sociale

Jardin de pommes et d’argile || Le déambulatoire poétique souhaite renforcer le lien entre les artistes et la communauté. Des ateliers de façonnage seront offerts aux enfants, aux adolescents, aux personnes ayant des difficultés d’aptitudes sociales ou de handicaps légers. Le fruit de leur travail sera intégré au déambulatoire poétique.

Votre contribution

Vos dons nous permettrons d’aménager le déambulatoire:

Les espaces d’exposition:
Le Café éphémère
Le Salon de terre
Le Déambulatoire dinatoire
etc.

L’espace atelier créatif

Les infrastructures techniques

Matériaux projet social et ateliers

Les cachets pour les artistes invités (oeuvres éphémères)

story:
The Cause

On May 25th, 2020 George Floyd was murdered by an officer who kneeled on his neck for eight minutes and forty six seconds while George begged for his life. As a mother and human being it broke my heart to watch a grown man call for his mama in his final moments as we all watched helplessly. This death is just one in a long sad history of police brutality and misconduct with no accountability. I felt trapped in the face of this tragedy, unable to attend protest myself I have been searching for a way to add my voice to the cause and make a meaningful impact on society. As an artist I was inspired to channel some of this collective grief and rage we are all feeling into a memorial piece for George Floyd, version one titled ‘8:46’, and version two titled ‘Justice for George’, creating a lasting symbol of a man who moved a nation. I’m creating a high quality 12x12 print at an incedibly low price, of which all the profits will go towards the Southern Alamance Chapter of NAACP in North Carolina.

Version One : ‘8:46’ or Version Two : ‘Justice for George’ - 12 x 12 Art Print

 

 

The Impact

I want to raise awareness and further inspire people to donate to the organizations doing the hard work on the ground to enact change that will last for decades to come. I’m offering prints to collect funds for the NAACP, and encourage anyone who’s hesitated to donate by offering incentives! Our local chapter is particularly important as we are a swing state and have a history of conservative policies that have hindered progress in the black community. 

  • NAACP - The mission of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) is to secure the political, educational, social, and economic equality of rights in order to eliminate race-based discrimination and ensure the health and well-being of all persons.

 

Other Notable Organizations

  • Black Visions Collective - BLVC is committed to a long term vision in which ALL Black lives not only matter, but are able to thrive.
  • ACLU - The American Civil Liberties Union, or ACLU, is the nation's largest and oldest civil liberties organization. Its mission is to defend and preserve the rights and liberties of people in the United States.
  • The National Bail Fund - The National Bail FundNetwork is a national project that works with organizers, advocates, and legal providers across the country that are using, or contemplating using, community bail funds as part of efforts to radically change local bail systems and reduce incarceration.


Risks & Challenges

  • Our Nation and World is at a breaking point and it’s time to decide which side of history you want to be on. Join the movement, make an impact, and get a beautiful high quality piece of art to remember this moment in history forever. 
     
  • Printing risk are minimal as I have reliable printing sources and shipment options that enable me to print quantities as needed at a fast rate. Preorders keep the print limited and allow me to understand demand, while also creating a bulk order that keeps cost cheap so we can keep as much of the funds going toward the NAACP as possible. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get  the word out and make some noise about the change you want to see in the world, demand police reform and help dismantle systemic racism.
  • If art isn’t your thing, please go donate directly to any of the organizations referenced here or to any local group in your own community fighting for equality for all and the end of police brutality. 
  • Volunteer for your local NAACP chapter or other similar organizations.
  •  Actively address casual racism in your everyday life, in a racist society it is not enough to not be racist, one must be actively anti-racist.

story:
I am running this campaign in order to fund my artistic research. I am offering exquisite perks in order to raise funds for my professional development as an artist-researcher-artist. This campaign is important to me because it will help me to continue my career as an artist-researcher-teacher. Contributors will help me achieve to publish my first chapter of my thesis: 'Images of Violence from Mexico: A performance art based enquiry.' This book will contain some of the most important insights of my research on performance art, empathy and ethical representations of violence through performance art. 

If I do not reach my entire goal, the money will go to pay the materials used to create the campaign's perks and the rent of my studio space. I had proved that I can publish and accomplish ambitious performance art projects before this campaign. Thus, contributors will be reassured that the money will go to fund my career. Your contribution will make possible my life in the UK as an exceptional artist. I may face some challenges to achieve my goal and I am willing to give up my studio space if I cannot achieve my goal. I plan to transform  my room at Cowley Road into a studio space. I am also looking for other funding options. If contributors can't help with money there are other ways to contribute such as sharing the campaign with friends, retweeting my campaign, share my campaign among your friends.

I aim to raise £1500 and in exchange people would get exquisite and exclusive perks made by me  in the United Kingdom.

I am asking for donations of £5.00 £7.50  £10.00  £20.00 £25.00 £37.00 and £65.00 

Perk #1 £37.00

Tote Bags

During my job in a very famous store I met a very talented colleague. She taught me how to use a sewing machine and how to saw tote bags. Thus, I had sawn some tote bags with very beautiful fabric from Marimeko (Finland), Designers Guild and Osborne Little and John Lewis & partners %100 cotton  (United Kingdom). The tote bags are made in UK. 

Perk #2 £10.00 each

Posters of Performance Art Costumes

The posters are printed in risograph printing. They are reproductions of  sketches for performance art costumes. I created this costumes in different parts of the world this year such as China, Zurich, Finland, London, and Oxford.

Perk #3 £8.00 each

Book Squash & Stretch 

This book is the culmination of one year work as a curator, event manager and performance art practitioner. The book is a compilation of performance artists' creative writing who were part of Squash & Stretch International Performance Art Festival in Oxford. It is beautifully printed in risograph and it is a map of contemporary different styles of performance art made in the UK.

Perk #4  £20.00 

Zine workshop: ‘Challenge your inner shopper.’

Contributors will learn how to make an A4 zine with recycled material from vintage books and fashion catalogues. The workshop is limited to 5 people. Material, and coffee and biscuits will be provided.

Perk #6 £65.00 

Watercolour commission 

Commission a watercolour and I will deliver to you before February 2019

Perk #7 £25.00

Art Tutorial

I am offering one hour tutorial for your art project for £25.00

Perk #8 £20.00

Home Design advice

I am offering home design advice for your home.

And that's all there is to it.

The perks will be shipped if contributors pay £5.00 more or people can get in touch with me and I can deliver them in Oxford.

story:
Our Story

Before I was born, my father made his living in the Philippines producing stunning batiks - an ancient and lengthy process of painting onto cloth using wax and dyes. His growing success as an artist back in the 70's was rudely interrupted by the arrival of first my sister, and then me. He didn't paint another thing until finally upon his retirement he had the opportunity to return to the Philippines, where my beautiful mother, Chita, and extended family are from, to continue his love of batiks.

Dad had hoped to sell his paintings not only to make a living, but also to support local communities in need, having seen first-hand the devastation and despair after Typhoon Hainan hit our home village in 2013.  He didn't work alone, he had help from a number of my cousins, who he had hoped to train up in order to support themselves and their families long after he was gone. Sadly his vision was never achieved when he passed away unexpectedly just six months after starting the business. My cousins did not feel able to continue on without him so for the last few years, I have sat with a room full of his original paintings, wanting to share them with the world, but unable to part with them. (That's me below!)

 

 

Introduction to Batiki

I wanted to find a way to share and sell Dad's art without having to physically let go. I also had to consider that a lot of the originals are huge, and would probably be too big for most urban living spaces, thus the idea of Batiki was born. A future range of over 50 batik designs as prints, cushions, fashion and wall art.

I have been very slowly building Batiki with my own limited funding, but a lot of the products I would like to manufacture, such as cushions, scarves and full size screen prints are out of reach this early in the process.  I'd love to launch the company properly so that I can print onto the best quality materials, whilst maintaining an eco-friendly and sustainable approach to our papers and fabrics.

Hopefully you like my Dad's art as much as I do (even though I'm obviously biased) and any support is appreciated! The average sizes of the original batiks are shown below with our stunning model Giada - who in another life and time would have been my Dad's Granddaughter-in-law. She's still family to me. 

 

 

Future Plans

I'm hoping to raise £5,000 to create the first run of merchandise, ideally all in time for Christmas. This will include greeting cards, framed prints and cushions as a starting point. Currently the majority of our prints can only go up to approx A3 as the process to digitise them at full size is very costly. One of the first things I'll do with the funds after all perks have been fulfilled will be to digitise the paintings so that I can reproduce them as screen prints on cloth so that they can be enjoyed similar to the originals.

Eventually where possible, all products will be manufactured on eco-friendly, sustainable and vegan materials, for example I'm very excited to use vegan suede for the cushions, which are not only animal friendly, they are also  incredibly soft to touch and very comfy!

Our Perks include:

- A6 Mounted Prints in 8"x 10" Frame (Choice of 3 designs)

- Pack of 6 Greetings Cards

- Framed A3 Giclee Prints (Choice of 3 designs)

- Vegan Suede Cushions (Choice of 4 designs)

- A2 Giclee Prints (Unframed - Choice of 2 designs)

- Limited Edition 'Ziggy' Screen Print with Certificate of Authenticity

- Two of my Dad's Original Batiks 

You can see the different designs available for each perk at www.batikidesign.com/support

(Note: The cushions in the images here were early samples on cotton fabric and do not reflect the high quality of the cushions I plan to produce) 

 

My Personal Mission

I'm not so naive as to think that launching, building and sustaining a business is easy work, but I have the passion and drive, not to mention a lifetime of sales experience! Also, whilst I'm not trying to change the world here, I'd like to think I can try to make a difference somewhere. Just as Dad wanted to use his art to try and help support those in need - if I can make a success of this, then I would like to honour his wishes and find ways to use Batiki to give back to our communities in anyway I can. The first on my list will be New Horizon Youth Centre in Camden, London, an incredible haven for young homeless people. I've seen first-hand the amazing work that the charity does, and so even if you don't feel inclined to support this campaign, please take a moment to check out what they do and if you can spare a pound or two, consider donating to them instead. 

 

The Team

I may for all intents and purposes be a 'One Man Band' in terms of setting Batiki up, but I wouldn't be where I am without the love, input and support from so many people. Firstly my Dad and my cousins who have created these amazing batiks; my mother who has supported the entire family on both sides of the world through thick and thin, and probably saved us from ourselves many times over; my husband whose unwavering belief knows no end (and hopefully his art contacts won't hurt!) and my wonderful, oh so loyal friends who have seen me through the best and the worst of times, more than once. Hopefully you guys will fill the remaining vacancy within the team as supporters, investors or simply fans. Any financial, emotional or business support would be gratefully received.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread the word! Share this campaign with your friends and family and stay in touch on Social Media (Facebook and Instagram) @batikidesign

Above all else, campaign aside - be kind, to yourself and to others. We can all do our bit to make this world a better place and it doesn't have to involve money. A smile, a hug, a little bit of understanding can go a long way to making someone's day!

(Note: The cushions in the images here were early samples on cotton fabric and do not reflect the high quality of the cushions I plan to produce) 


 
My Personal Mission
I'm not so naive as to think that launching, building and sustaining a business is easy work, but I have the passion and drive, not to mention a lifetime of sales experience! Also, whilst I'm not trying to change the world here, I'd like to think I can try to make a difference somewhere. Just as Dad wanted to use his art to try and help support those in need - if I can make a success of this, then I would like to honour his wishes and find ways to use Batiki to give back to our communities in anyway I can. The first on my list will be New Horizon Youth Centre in Camden, London, an incredible haven for young homeless people. I've seen first-hand the amazing work that the charity does, and so even if you don't feel inclined to support this campaign, please take a moment to check out what they do and if you can spare a pound or two, consider donating to them instead. 
 
The Team
I may for all intents and purposes be a 'One Man Band' in terms of setting Batiki up, but I wouldn't be where I am without the love, input and support from so many people. Firstly my Dad and my cousins who have created these amazing batiks; my mother who has supported the entire family on both sides of the world through thick and thin, and probably saved us from ourselves many times over; my husband whose unwavering belief knows no end (and hopefully his art contacts won't hurt!) and my wonderful, oh so loyal friends who have seen me through the best and the worst of times, more than once. Hopefully you guys will fill the remaining vacancy within the team as supporters, investors or simply fans. Any financial, emotional or business support would be gratefully received.
 

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help me spread the word! Share this campaign with your friends and family and stay in touch on Social Media (Facebook and Instagram) @batikidesign
Above all else, campaign aside - be kind, to yourself and to others. We can all do our bit to make this world a better place and it doesn't have to involve money. A smile, a hug, a little bit of understanding can go a long way to making someone's day!

story:
INKtober 2018 by Eric Ninaltowski

For those of you who don't know me, I have been an industry professional for 12+ years, working on projects like Samson, Monomyth, the MEG, and others. I’ve always wanted to create my own content when it comes to comics. Since I started drawing, I’ve always wanted to create my own stories and my own characters to dawn the pages of comic books!

With the decline of current titles and publishers turning our most beloved characters into villains and politically correct heroes, the time is ripe for independent creators to take to the shelves and revive this declining medium! As a fan of the 90’s and as an artist who has been inspired by that blooming era, I want to introduce a book that will give readers – longing for good content , and the flare of those 90’s books- hope again. Books my kids can read and that they can get excited about.

By supporting this campaign not only will you be getting a sweet book of classic 90's characters and top notch art, but you'll also be helping me jump-start my ultimate goal of writing, penciling, and inking my own book series called Shadow Sentry. Shadow Sentry is an X-Men meets the Matrix superhero comic that is classic Good vs. Evil, with a Supernatural twist. It will bring back that awesome 90's vibe of great characters and that creator owned passion that made the 90's what it was. In the INKtober book backers will get an exclusive sneak peak at 10 of my Shadow Sentry characters.

This campaign will give backers a lot of options for supporting... and it's going to have flexible funding, so backers will get what they order even if I'm not able to get to that 4k goal...

But as an added incentive to get there... if we can make it to 4k I will SIGN everything before it ships! So let's get there!

  • You can get just the INKtober ashcan book; a sketchcover variant; or an original piece of art from the book along with the regular INKtober book.
  • You also have the option of getting your hands on books that Eric has worked on in the past, like Monomyth; Samson; The Art of Eric Ninaltowski; and The Hand of the Morningstar! Check out more info on those in the ADD ONs section below*

 

 

The Details

Let's get specific:

  • INKtober 2018 collects all 31 illustrations from the popular artists challenge from the month of October. You'll see some of your favorites from 90's comics from Image, Marvel, and DC. You'll also be getting a look at some characters of my own creation for my new and upcoming comic series called: SHADOW SENTRY.
  • The INKtober book is a 8.5"x 5.5" book, in an Ashcan format, typical convention lingo.
  • The characters in the book are as follows... Grifter, Spartan, Zealot, Warblade, Maul, Voodoo, Jacob Marlowe and Void, Helspont, Pike (Yes... pretty much all of the WildCATS!), Caitlin Fairchild, Grunge, Deathblow, Omega Red, Stryker (from Cyberforce), Mr. Majestic, Union, Savage Dragon, Spawn, Batman, Diehard (from youngblood), and Weapon X.... From the Shadow Sentry... Brazen, The Angel Vangeleon, Gannon, Noble, Cogent, Glare, Deacon, Blood Bane, Vengent, and Hopscotch. - If you're going to get an original piece of art from the book, you'll need to know who is in there! ;)
  • Printing cost is $5/INKtober book, it might cost a little more but I'll be using a local small business that I know and trust, so printing will be quicker. The other books I already have printed and on hand, that's why I only have limited quantities available for those ADD ON perks. 
  • Why I need your help and partnership!

    As with any endeavor, there is always a need for capital to get it going. After I finish the current comic project I’m working on for a client, my goal is to start working on Shadow Sentry more full-time and prepare for that launch. So with this campaign I’m hoping to raise enough funds to provide a buffer and allow me the time and money to get that started and not have to work on other things during that period that would require my time and energy. So I would greatly appreciate your support and consideration, as I ask you to partner with me as I get things rolling and as I seek to create comics once again that fuel the fire, scratch the itch, and inspire once again!

 

 

This project really took on a mind of it’s own and you’ll see the illustrations become more complex as they go, and just get better and better. I even started adding some color with Deathblow, (you have to add the red on his face!) and then continued adding some red color here and there to accentuate some characters. But the crown of this book is the Shadow Sentry characters (In my humble opinion!) My goal is for you to take a look back, but also take a look forward at what is to come, and my hope is that you will get as excited as I am!

 

You'll be getting a sneak peek at 10 of my characters I've created for my SHADOW SENTRY series, as well as the full colored team pic to really showcase the core team and get you excited for more. Also in the book you'll see other villains like Blood Bane, Hopscotch, Vengent, and the elite government operative part of the XI-Hunters: Deacon. I can't tell you how excited I am to get these character in front of you and get you pumped for what's to come!

And if you want to see more art from me that I've done previously: check out these ADD ONs...

 

ADD ONs

You'll also be able to add on some of these cool books that Eric has also done... here's a brief run down of each so you know what you're getting.

  • The Art of Eric Ninaltowski Ashcan - in full color - Pictured above with Lion-o on the cover this book is an 8.5" x 5.5" 16 pg. book with select illustrations that Eric has done, like the Thundercats, Deadpool, Wonder Woman, Deathstroke, Captain America and others.
  • The Art of Eric Ninaltowski Vol. 1 - Black & White - White Captain America and Batman on the cover is a 45 pg. 8.5" x 11" book that features a wonderful look into the behind the scenes and process of Eric's work. Over 100 images from sketches to fully inked illustrations this book has a little bit of everything and is perfect for the admirer of the arts.
  • Monomyth tpb - Collecting 3 issues of the series from OSSM comics, written by Siike Donnelly, illustrated by Eric, and colored by Peejay Catacutan. What if Adam and Eve never ate the apple? What if it was Michael who revolted and not Lucifer? Follow Enoch on an epic tale to save Eden from the evils of the other Devil! 90 pages, plus 6 extra pages added just for the tpb, and also featuring a sketch book of Eric's work developing the look and feel of the characters.
  • Samson Volumes 1 & 2 - presented by Rooted Chronicles- Take an in depth look at one of the most well known characters in the Bible: Samson. Volume one, features art from the talents of Nadir Balan, and colors by the stunning Liz Buenaventura, written by Luis Serrano. Volume two, has two chapters, the first with art by the talented Mike Abuan, and I follow up with the most intense part of the story... the slaying of the 1,000 Philistines!
  • Hand of the Morningstar- 2 enormous tomes collecting 8 volumes and 1,200 pages of story and art. Since there are only 2 available they will be offered as one huge package! HOTM showcases Eric's first published work from 2008-2011 on 6 of the 8 volumes. The first two volumes were done by none other than Mike Miller, who also supplied some writing. "In the battle between good and evil, it's hard to tell who's on which side. With the world watching, the opposing forces of super powered beings clash in battles that reveal whether the Morningstar fights for the cause of good.... or evil." These books were originally published by Zondervan and Lamp Post Publications, and created by Brett Burner. The books will also be signed by Eric, Mike Miller, and Brett Burner! Check out this video!*

 

Here's a peek at a few pages from Samson Vol.2 as well!

 

Stretch GOALS!

Here are some cool things I'd like to offer if I hit these milestones!

4k Stretch Goal - If we can get to this initial goal I will sign all the books before they ship! Let's do it!

5k Stretch Goal - tba!

8k Stretch Goal - Shadow Sentry Art print- Full color! 

10k Stretch Goal- I will hand color all the images from the INKtober book! Which not only means you'll get a full color INKtober ashcan in your hands, but anyone who purchases an original illustration will get a full color illustration! (This may delay shipping however, just a heads up! but it will be well worth it!)

15k Stretch Goal- Shadow Sentry Trading Cards!

20k Stretch Goal - Comic Sized metal print of the Shadow Sentry full color!

 

Risks & Challenges

More like Pluses and more Pluses!

The Risks on this endeavor are low- Challenges... low! But the Pluses are enormous! You'll be helping me in a tremendous way, and help me get a jump start on my passion project and bring you the comics you deserve! Plus- you'll be helping a local printer earn some bucks, because I'm going with a local, small, mom n pop shop for my printing, sure it'll cost more, but I want to help the little guy like me. Plus- it means turnaround will be quicker, PLUS- I can ensure every book looks good before I accept it! Win, Win!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

  • If you can't contribute with the money, don't sweat it, you can help by just telling people what I'm doing! Help me get the word out to all those people you know who like cool art and love comics!
  • Just use the Indiegogo share tools up at the top!

And that's all there is to it. Thank you guys so much for sharing the love, and showing your support, together we're going to bring back the awesome that once was COMICS! Done by people who were passionate, and people who had a great ideas of their own! Thanks for helping me make comics great again!
