story:
ONE ARRT believes if we can work together for a bigger purpose, ONE ARRT will reach the goal to be the 1st art supply brand to contribute towards smaller art groups and organizations that nurture and support all creative people.

 

With every ONE ARRT product order- You are contributing towards making a difference in your ART community!

 

1. Several art organizations/small groups go unnoticed and unfunded because of lack

of support. ONE ARRT plans to change that.

2. Smaller communities deserve to have access to the arts, including

workshops and classes.

3. Receiving an art-related grant or scholarship can be a challenge, ONE ARRT would like to assist in making this possible and accessible. 

4. The ONE ARRT residency program for especially for creatives

5. The ONE ARRT Internship/Apprentice

 

ONE ARRT -PROJECT SUMMARY

As an artist, I have always depended on the common “art store” to purchase my art materials and supplies. The most common supplies are acrylic or oil paint, gel mediums, brushes, color pencils, charcoal, and canvas. Without even thinking about it, I personally would walk down the aisle of the art store and grab the art supplies that were within my budget. If I had a bit more to spend, I would treat myself to a higher end item. As an artist, you may find yourself having to purchase art supplies repeatedly and then you realize that sometimes you are buying products more than selling artwork. As artists, we are resourceful and can create with pretty much anything but regardless, options are always a plus! That's where ONE ARRT comes in!

Artist/Founder of ONE ARRT- Rebecca Robinson

 

 

During my career as a professional artist, I always had a love for the creative process. During that process, I had to learn how to hone my craft, create a budget for the supplies I needed to create original artwork and last but not least, brand myself. One of the challenges of my personal art journey was obtaining the proper resources to build a strong platform which in turn would be fulfilling, inspirational to other aspiring artists and lucrative. Being able to do what you love and make a living doing so is possible!!

 

THE ONE ARRT MISSION gives a percentage of profits (after all business expenses are paid) directly to specific educational programs, community projects, privately owned art galleries and museums that focus on the growth and advancement of ALL artists including fine art, performing arts and visual arts.

ONE ARRT'S goal is to reach as many small groups and art organizations as possible around the country who need our help!

 

HOW ONE ARRT WILL HELP ARTISTS/CREATIVE PEOPLE

  • Supports creatives who wish to pursue a career in the arts
  • Supports working artists with resources to further their career
  • Funding for workshops and classes for children and teens
  • Supports students who are art majors  or creative concentration at University/College level
  • Career workshops, portfolio creation, career advising for artists
  • Funds for artists to participate in art residency programs

HOW ONE ARRT WILL HELP THE COMMUNITY

  • School-age children who will benefit from exposure to the arts
  • Community/Public Art projects
  • Public Art Installations/Projects for communities in need
  • Funding for privately owned art galleries 
  • African American owned art galleries/exhibitions
  • Exhibitions/Small Museums in need
  • Art Residency programs (Current and Future)

  • and MORE....

For every ONE ARRT product sold, a percentage of profits is donated to

1. The ONE ARRT Sponsorship - to support various art programs in small towns/cities that may go unnoticed and or unfunded. 

2. The ONE ARRT  Workshop/Classes for deserving communities

3. The ONE ARRT Scholarship for students

4. The ONE ARRT internship/partnership for students/working artists

5.. The ONE ARRT Residency Program 

 

 

PLEASE CONSIDER MAKING A DONATION WHICH WILL  ALSO CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS TRAVEL EXPENSES TO VISIT and FORM PARTNERSHIPS WITH EXHIBITIONS/GALLERIES/SCHOOLS AROUND THE COUNTRY IN ORDER FOR ONE ARRT TO ASSIST WITH RAISING FUNDS FOR THEIR PROGRAMS!

ONE ARRT

DO YOU HAVE AN ORGANIZATION YOU WOULD LIKE TO SEE RECEIVE FUNDING? LET US KNOW!

YOUR PROGRAM OF CHOICE MAY BE SELECTED

FOR A DONATION!

OR PICK OUR $500 DONATION PERK AND WE WILL DONATE TO THE ORGANIZATION OF YOUR CHOICE ON YOUR BEHALF UNDER THE ONE ARRT BRAND.

 

ONE ARRT believes if we can work together for a bigger purpose, we can reach our goal to be the 1st art supply brand to contribute towards art programs that nurture and support all creative people!

 

WHERE THE ONE ARRT BRAND WILL BE SOLD RETAIL

  • ONLINE
  • PRIVATELY OWNED ART SUPPLY STORES
  • BOOKSTORES
  • GIFT SHOPS
  • SPECIALTY SHOPS

WHERE ONE ARRT WILL BE SOLD WHOLESALE

  • SCHOOLS/UNIVERSITIES
  • ART WORKSHOPS/CLASSES
  • ART SCHOOLS
  • SPECIAL EVENTS

HOW ONE ARRT WILL CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS THE MARKET

  • ONE ARRT will provide an additional selection of art supplies to complement the store's diversity
  • ONE ARRT will provide affordable products for its customers 
  • ONE ARRT will give customers an opportunity to invest in a quality art brand that also contributes directly to the art community.

 

 

 

 DID YOU KNOW, THE MAJORITY OF ART SUPPLY COMPANY'S AND MANUFACTURERS ARE 

» Family owned

» Been in operation since the early 1900s

» Specialize in art supplies and framing

»  Are Manufacturers and distributors

» Design and develop their art supplies

» In house craftsman/production 

» Warehouse efficiency and order inspection 

» Serve millions all over the world

 

ONE ARRT'S MISSION AND BUSINESS OBJECTIVE IS TO ESTABLISH THE BRAND AND BECOME KNOWN IN THE ART SUPPLY MARKET FOR GIVING BACK TO 

SMALLER ART ORGANIZATIONS/GROUPS IN NEED AROUND THE COUNTRY

 

 

YOUR DONATION WILL HELP TOWARDS

  • Securing a manufacturer (Made in USA)  to develop all products (especially ECO-friendly)
  • Creating ONE ARRT product samples
  • Kickstarting the ONE ARRT partnerships
  • Creating/developing brand image/packaging/website/e-commerce
  • Advertising/Public Relations Campaign 
  • Funds for social media advertising/boost
  • Creating ONE ARRT commercials/ads to reach our target audience 
  • Securing a Public Relations partnership
  • Special events to introduce the ONE ARRT brand
  • Hiring an assistant -To assist with branding, social media presence, presentations

 

 

ABOUT ARTIST REBECCA ROBINSON (aRRt)

If you didn't notice, the name of the art brand is ONE ARRT with two R's in the word "Art" which represents artist Rebecca Robinson's initials. 

Rebecca recognized something was missing in the typical art supply store. There were always art products and supplies, but there weren't any brands that specifically helped the smaller organizations or groups in small towns or cities that are in need.  

ONE ARRT IS ON A MISSION TO FIND ART ORGANIZATIONS/GROUPS THAT ARE MAKING A DIFFERENCE AND NEED OUR HELP!

 “It was a win-win situation. I have always enjoyed browsing the aisles in art supply stores, seeing new products and being excited when my favorite supplies were on sale. Art supplies are expensive. and it is also an investment. It would give me a sense of pride to buy an art product that contributes towards smaller art programs and community projects throughout the county. I have always made it a priority to give back and ONE ARRT will definitely change the way people shop for art supplies"  - Rebecca

 

Rebecca Robinson  BIO

The founder of ONE ARRT, Rebecca Robinson studied fashion design in Atlanta, Ga. and continued her education at North Carolina Central University where she majored in Visual Communications and graduated with honors. Her background includes art history, printmaking, photography, graphic design, and creative marketing. Rebecca is mostly known for her fashion design company psnob.com (pronounced snob) which launched in 2001. In 2016 Rebecca started a new venture "Black ART Matters"  in order to support African-American Creatives/Artists and provide obtainable resources and consultation services.  Rebecca has contributed towards several nonprofit organizations throughout the country by auctioning her one of a kind handbags and fine art. Rebecca's artwork has been featured in dozens of media outlets including; Jezebel Magazine, Pattern Magazine, New York Examiner, Points North Magazine, The National Endowment Of The Arts and most recently, exhibited her artwork at the Chicago Museum of Science and Industry. Rebecca is also a self-published author of the book "Arts Honor".

 

Artist Statement
“As long as I can remember art has moved me. Expressing myself with my artwork allows me to convey a thought, an emotion, a personal experience or an important message. As an artist, it is my duty to push the envelope and create artwork that sparks a dialog and remains timeless.” - Rebecca Robinson

 

To learn more about Rebecca Robinson and view her C/V, please visit her website www.psnob.com

 

In the spring of 2014, Rebecca and her father Dr. Earle U. Robinson Jr. had an idea to create a documentary film that would honor her family legacy and also to those who contributed towards medical history. Rebecca reached out to Filmmaker/Writer/Director Joyce Fitzpatrick, Filmmaker/Producer/Director Brian Shackelford of  FLATCAT PRODUCTIONS and Tunnel Vizion Entertainment to get the documentary project underway. 

Joyce Marie Fitzpatrick

Joyce Marie Fitzpatrick is an award-winning, Producer/Writer/Director who has enjoyed a career in television, film, and promotion.  She has produced, written and directed several feature-length documentaries: “Sunshine, Noodles and Me” (aired on PBS) and “Discovering Mary,” along with several mini-docs, short films, web-series, comedy sketches, animation, music videos, and promos.  Her experience includes credits for ABC, NBC, CW/UPN, BET, E! Entertainment, PBS and, the Discovery Channel. Joyce is currently working on several new projects and continually writes.  She is always looking for fresh talent in all areas of film and TV.   https://www.flatcat-productions.com/

 

 

Brian Shackelford (Creator of the ONE ARRT Animation)

Animation script was written by Rebecca Robinson  Voice Over by Rebecca Robinson

Brian Shackelford post-production background includes over 600 hours of original, non-fiction programming for the following companies: 20th Century Fox, VH1, MTV, 51 Minds Entertainment, 44 Blue, Ryan Seacrest Productions, World of Wonder, T Group Productions, Electus, Scott Sternberg Productions, and Down In Front Entertainment.  In 2008 Shackelford created Tunnel Vizion Entertainment, a production and post-production company specializing in giving lower budgeted projects the look and feel of high end 

Executive Producer/Director -Joyce Fitzpatrick

Co-Producer/Director- Brian Shackelford

Co-Producer/Media Manager -Rebecca Robinson

Completed for private screenings in March of 2018, the film has premiered to sold-out audiences from the Missouri History Museum to Washington University and other universities and health institutions throughout St. Louis and is continually being requested for screenings nationwide. The Color of Medicine: The Story of Homer G. Phillips Hospital won Best Feature Length Documentary at the Montreal International Black Film Festival-the largest black film festival in Canada in 2018, The Gary International Black Film Festival in Indiana and The National Black Film Festiva in Houston, TX.  

The film continues to be accepted into various film festivals nationally [Capital City Black Film Festival in Austin, Texas - Founded by award-winning actress Viola Davis and her husband Julius Tennon] and internationally [The St, Louis International Film Festival] and the recent screening at the Halifax Black Film Festival in Nova Scotia, Canada.  In October of 2018, The Color of Medicine: The Story of Homer G. Phillips Hospital was chosen as an honoree of the Office of Diversity Programs’ Homer G. Phillips Public Health Lecture Series at Washington University and was recognized by Mark Wrighton, the Chancellor of Washington University; David Perlmutter, the Dean of Washington University School of Medicine; Will Ross, M.D. M.P.H., Associate Dean for Diversity and Lisa Stevenson, M.B.A. Assistant Dean for Student Diversity. In February of this year, The Color of Medicine: The Story of Homer G. Phillips Hospital was sponsored by The County of Los Angeles California and Supervisor Mark Ridley-Thomas and screened at the Martin Luther King Community center.

To learn more about THE COLOR OF MEDICINE: THE STORY OF HOMER G. PHILLIPS HOSPITAL

VISIT WWW.THECOLOROFMEDICINE.COM

 

 

PLEASE CONSIDER MAKING A DONATION WHICH WILL  ALSO GO TOWARDS TRAVEL EXPENSES TO VISIT and FORM PARTNERSHIPS WITH EXHIBITIONS/GALLERIES/SCHOOLS AROUND THE COUNTRY IN ORDER FOR ONE ARRT TO ASSIST WITH RAISING FUNDS FOR THEIR PROGRAMS!

 

OUR GOAL

ONE ARRT's initial goal is to raise $15,000. 

This amount would assist in the initial stages of development of the ONE ARRT brand the first LAUNCH product. 

Manufacturing, proper packaging and a marketing/public relations budget is the majority of the costs, but with our strategic marketing plan and creating sufficient inventory to enter the market as a new art label/brand, we will be able to utilize funds raised accordingly and efficiently. 

 

ONE ARRT intends to start at a comfortable pace and build a relationship with our target customers while building relationships with art supply stores throughout the country.  By starting modestly,  we can manage our progress accordingly.

 

SELLING IN RETAIL STORES

ONE ARRT will research flagship stores and research the type of products that they currently offer.  We will check products that compete with ONE ARRT, identify the differences and we will establish a competitive market price.

PREPARE A ONE ARRT PRESENTATION TO RETAILERS TO FORM A PARTNERSHIP

ONE ARRT will develop an initial presentation to present to art supply stores.  The presentation will include key facts such as the target market for the product, reasons why the product will appeal to specific customers, the retail/wholesale price and discount levels, the volume that ONE ARRT can supply and merchandise and promotional plan.

 

PROVIDE/DONATE ART SUPPLIES TO DESERVING SCHOOLS/WORKSHOPS 

There are several school children who unfortunately cannot enjoy a proper art curriculum because of the lack of art supplies and art materials. Having exposure in the arts allows young people to be more well rounded and to also be able to express themselves! Creating art also is also therapeutic. There is no reason for students to go without having their own art experience. When customers purchase ONE ARRT products, profits will be contributed towards various schools/workshops/afterschool programs across the country!

 

PERKS 

Make a donation and receive a gift!

 

1. A $10 donation, you will receive an online thank you! (shout out on our social media platforms)

2. A $25.00 donation, you will receive a ONE ARRT TEE SHIRT and online shoutout!

3. A $50.00 donation, you will receive a ONE ARRT  SWEATSHIRT and online shoutout!

4. $100 Your name will be listed on our launch product-The ONE ARRT acrylic paint or illustration markers box set and you will receive a ONE ARRT TEE SHIRT and online shoutout!

5. A $500 donation, you can choose an art/educational organization of YOUR choice for ONE ARRT to donate to on your behalf. Your name will be listed on our launch product and a ONE ARRT TEE SHIRT  and online shoutout!

 

WHAT IF WE DO NOT MEET OUR CROWDFUNDING GOAL of 15K??

If ONE ARRT does NOT meet the $15,000 goal but still receives donations, ONE ARRT will determine what initial steps to take first with the funds that we have raised but continue our fundraising efforts to make ONE ARRT art supplies a reality!

 Every penny counts and every bit helps in getting ONE ARRT off the grown. We appreciate everyone's support!

 

THE IMPACT

ONE ARRT strives to be the brand that provides quality art products/supplies while contributing towards organizations that provide educational programs in music, dance, film, visual arts, theater, and the literary arts around the country.

Having a strong network and gaining many supporters over the years with previous projects have given the knowledge, expertise, and confidence to launch innovative ideas such as ONE ARRT.

With your support, ONE ARRT will be an art store staple while giving back to deserving artists in our communities.

 

Photo by Ivandrei Pretorius from Pexels

Photos by Steven Van on Unsplash

 

Risks & Challenges

Every new business has its risks and challenges but production and demand will not be an issue. Manufacturing will be done right here in the US! Fulfillment (online shop and participating stores) will begin shortly after the project is funded.

What qualifies ONE ARRT to overcome production hurdles?

  • Rebecca Robinson has over 20 years of experience in manufacturing and the wholesale process. Having a strong relationship with my manufacturer is essential to running a smooth operation. 
  • The key is securing your customer and product demand first.  Once minimum purchase orders have been met, manufacturing can begin to fulfill and ship orders.
  • With the support of the community and those in need, the demand will be expressed in order to sustain operation and build the ONE ARRT brand. By doing so, funds can continue to be distributed to various organizations in need.

What is ONE ARRT's marketing strategy?

  • Having a strong team to assist with branding is always a plus. We want to utilize social media and productive public relations campaigns in addition to building one on one relationships with the organizations we wish to support. ONE ARRT believes if we can work together for the bigger purpose, we can reach our goal to be the 1st art supply brand to contribute towards art organizations that nurture and support all creative people.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that it may not be possible for you to financially support, but please take some time to spread the word about this campaign! 

Share our social media: Instagram @ONEARRT   Facebook: ONE ARRT

Utilize Indiegogo social media tools

Share our ONE ARRT video animation and our Indiegogo  link

 

ONE ARRT IS A REGISTERED TRADEMARK- ALL RIGHTS RESERVED 2019
story_txt:
ONE ARRT believes if we can work together for a bigger purpose, ONE ARRT will reach the goal to be the 1st art supply brand to contribute towards smaller art groups and organizations that nurture and support all creative people.
 
With every ONE ARRT product order- You are contributing towards making a difference in your ART community!
 
1. Several art organizations/small groups go unnoticed and unfunded because of lack
of support. ONE ARRT plans to change that.
2. Smaller communities deserve to have access to the arts, including
workshops and classes.
3. Receiving an art-related grant or scholarship can be a challenge, ONE ARRT would like to assist in making this possible and accessible. 
4. The ONE ARRT residency program for especially for creatives
5. The ONE ARRT Internship/Apprentice

 
ONE ARRT -PROJECT SUMMARY
As an artist, I have always depended on the common “art store” to purchase my art materials and supplies. The most common supplies are acrylic or oil paint, gel mediums, brushes, color pencils, charcoal, and canvas. Without even thinking about it, I personally would walk down the aisle of the art store and grab the art supplies that were within my budget. If I had a bit more to spend, I would treat myself to a higher end item. As an artist, you may find yourself having to purchase art supplies repeatedly and then you realize that sometimes you are buying products more than selling artwork. As artists, we are resourceful and can create with pretty much anything but regardless, options are always a plus! That's where ONE ARRT comes in!
Artist/Founder of ONE ARRT- Rebecca Robinson
 

 
During my career as a professional artist, I always had a love for the creative process. During that process, I had to learn how to hone my craft, create a budget for the supplies I needed to create original artwork and last but not least, brand myself. One of the challenges of my personal art journey was obtaining the proper resources to build a strong platform which in turn would be fulfilling, inspirational to other aspiring artists and lucrative. Being able to do what you love and make a living doing so is possible!!
 
THE ONE ARRT MISSION gives a percentage of profits (after all business expenses are paid) directly to specific educational programs, community projects, privately owned art galleries and museums that focus on the growth and advancement of ALL artists including fine art, performing arts and visual arts. 
ONE ARRT'S goal is to reach as many small groups and art organizations as possible around the country who need our help!
 

HOW ONE ARRT WILL HELP ARTISTS/CREATIVE PEOPLE

Supports creatives who wish to pursue a career in the arts
Supports working artists with resources to further their career
Funding for workshops and classes for children and teens
Supports students who are art majors  or creative concentration at University/College level
Career workshops, portfolio creation, career advising for artists
Funds for artists to participate in art residency programs

HOW ONE ARRT WILL HELP THE COMMUNITY

School-age children who will benefit from exposure to the arts
Community/Public Art projects
Public Art Installations/Projects for communities in need
Funding for privately owned art galleries 
African American owned art galleries/exhibitions
Exhibitions/Small Museums in need
Art Residency programs (Current and Future)
and MORE....


For every ONE ARRT product sold, a percentage of profits is donated to
1. The ONE ARRT Sponsorship - to support various art programs in small towns/cities that may go unnoticed and or unfunded. 
2. The ONE ARRT  Workshop/Classes for deserving communities
3. The ONE ARRT Scholarship for students
4. The ONE ARRT internship/partnership for students/working artists
5.. The ONE ARRT Residency Program 
 
 
PLEASE CONSIDER MAKING A DONATION WHICH WILL  ALSO CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS TRAVEL EXPENSES TO VISIT and FORM PARTNERSHIPS WITH EXHIBITIONS/GALLERIES/SCHOOLS AROUND THE COUNTRY IN ORDER FOR ONE ARRT TO ASSIST WITH RAISING FUNDS FOR THEIR PROGRAMS! 

ONE ARRT
DO YOU HAVE AN ORGANIZATION YOU WOULD LIKE TO SEE RECEIVE FUNDING? LET US KNOW!
YOUR PROGRAM OF CHOICE MAY BE SELECTED
FOR A DONATION!
OR PICK OUR $500 DONATION PERK AND WE WILL DONATE TO THE ORGANIZATION OF YOUR CHOICE ON YOUR BEHALF UNDER THE ONE ARRT BRAND.
 

ONE ARRT believes if we can work together for a bigger purpose, we can reach our goal to be the 1st art supply brand to contribute towards art programs that nurture and support all creative people!

 
WHERE THE ONE ARRT BRAND WILL BE SOLD RETAIL

ONLINE
PRIVATELY OWNED ART SUPPLY STORES
BOOKSTORES
GIFT SHOPS
SPECIALTY SHOPS

WHERE ONE ARRT WILL BE SOLD WHOLESALE

SCHOOLS/UNIVERSITIES
ART WORKSHOPS/CLASSES
ART SCHOOLS
SPECIAL EVENTS

HOW ONE ARRT WILL CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS THE MARKET

ONE ARRT will provide an additional selection of art supplies to complement the store's diversity
ONE ARRT will provide affordable products for its customers 
ONE ARRT will give customers an opportunity to invest in a quality art brand that also contributes directly to the art community.

 
 
  DID YOU KNOW, THE MAJORITY OF ART SUPPLY COMPANY'S AND MANUFACTURERS ARE 
» Family owned 
» Been in operation since the early 1900s
» Specialize in art supplies and framing
»  Are Manufacturers and distributors
» Design and develop their art supplies
» In house craftsman/production 
» Warehouse efficiency and order inspection 
» Serve millions all over the world
 
ONE ARRT'S MISSION AND BUSINESS OBJECTIVE IS TO ESTABLISH THE BRAND AND BECOME KNOWN IN THE ART SUPPLY MARKET FOR GIVING BACK TO 
SMALLER ART ORGANIZATIONS/GROUPS IN NEED AROUND THE COUNTRY
 

 
YOUR DONATION WILL HELP TOWARDS

Securing a manufacturer (Made in USA)  to develop all products (especially ECO-friendly)
Creating ONE ARRT product samples
Kickstarting the ONE ARRT partnerships
Creating/developing brand image/packaging/website/e-commerce
Advertising/Public Relations Campaign 
Funds for social media advertising/boost
Creating ONE ARRT commercials/ads to reach our target audience 
Securing a Public Relations partnership
Special events to introduce the ONE ARRT brand
Hiring an assistant -To assist with branding, social media presence, presentations

 

 
ABOUT ARTIST REBECCA ROBINSON (aRRt)
If you didn't notice, the name of the art brand is ONE ARRT with two R's in the word "Art" which represents artist Rebecca Robinson's initials. 
Rebecca recognized something was missing in the typical art supply store. There were always art products and supplies, but there weren't any brands that specifically helped the smaller organizations or groups in small towns or cities that are in need.  
ONE ARRT IS ON A MISSION TO FIND ART ORGANIZATIONS/GROUPS THAT ARE MAKING A DIFFERENCE AND NEED OUR HELP!

 “It was a win-win situation. I have always enjoyed browsing the aisles in art supply stores, seeing new products and being excited when my favorite supplies were on sale. Art supplies are expensive. and it is also an investment. It would give me a sense of pride to buy an art product that contributes towards smaller art programs and community projects throughout the county. I have always made it a priority to give back and ONE ARRT will definitely change the way people shop for art supplies"  - Rebecca
 
Rebecca Robinson  BIO
The founder of ONE ARRT, Rebecca Robinson studied fashion design in Atlanta, Ga. and continued her education at North Carolina Central University where she majored in Visual Communications and graduated with honors. Her background includes art history, printmaking, photography, graphic design, and creative marketing. Rebecca is mostly known for her fashion design company psnob.com (pronounced snob) which launched in 2001. In 2016 Rebecca started a new venture "Black ART Matters"  in order to support African-American Creatives/Artists and provide obtainable resources and consultation services.  Rebecca has contributed towards several nonprofit organizations throughout the country by auctioning her one of a kind handbags and fine art. Rebecca's artwork has been featured in dozens of media outlets including; Jezebel Magazine, Pattern Magazine, New York Examiner, Points North Magazine, The National Endowment Of The Arts and most recently, exhibited her artwork at the Chicago Museum of Science and Industry. Rebecca is also a self-published author of the book "Arts Honor".
 
Artist Statement“As long as I can remember art has moved me. Expressing myself with my artwork allows me to convey a thought, an emotion, a personal experience or an important message. As an artist, it is my duty to push the envelope and create artwork that sparks a dialog and remains timeless.” - Rebecca Robinson
 
To learn more about Rebecca Robinson and view her C/V, please visit her website www.psnob.com

 
In the spring of 2014, Rebecca and her father Dr. Earle U. Robinson Jr. had an idea to create a documentary film that would honor her family legacy and also to those who contributed towards medical history. Rebecca reached out to Filmmaker/Writer/Director Joyce Fitzpatrick, Filmmaker/Producer/Director Brian Shackelford of  FLATCAT PRODUCTIONS and Tunnel Vizion Entertainment to get the documentary project underway. 

Joyce Marie Fitzpatrick
Joyce Marie Fitzpatrick is an award-winning, Producer/Writer/Director who has enjoyed a career in television, film, and promotion.  She has produced, written and directed several feature-length documentaries: “Sunshine, Noodles and Me” (aired on PBS) and “Discovering Mary,” along with several mini-docs, short films, web-series, comedy sketches, animation, music videos, and promos.  Her experience includes credits for ABC, NBC, CW/UPN, BET, E! Entertainment, PBS and, the Discovery Channel. Joyce is currently working on several new projects and continually writes.  She is always looking for fresh talent in all areas of film and TV.   https://www.flatcat-productions.com/
 

 
Brian Shackelford (Creator of the ONE ARRT Animation)
Animation script was written by Rebecca Robinson  Voice Over by Rebecca Robinson
Brian Shackelford post-production background includes over 600 hours of original, non-fiction programming for the following companies: 20th Century Fox, VH1, MTV, 51 Minds Entertainment, 44 Blue, Ryan Seacrest Productions, World of Wonder, T Group Productions, Electus, Scott Sternberg Productions, and Down In Front Entertainment.  In 2008 Shackelford created Tunnel Vizion Entertainment, a production and post-production company specializing in giving lower budgeted projects the look and feel of high end

story:
It all started with KTOWN WALLZ PROJECT

About ten years ago, ESPY DPT started the KTOWN WALLZ PROJECT, bringing in artists from all walks of life to paint and beautify my neighborhood. With the permission of the neighbors and local business owners, we have been able to grow and expand to over 200+ walls throughout. Today, our walls are adorned with the works of both notable and up-and-coming international graffiti, streetart, and mural artists.

Our project has helped

  • Keeping the neighborhood safe
  • Increasing property values
  • Beautifying the neighborhood and overall quality of life

 

 

THE IMPACT

These artists are paying their own way for an opportunity to be seen and possibly commissioned to do what we love. Any contribution is greatly appreciated to help artists spread their creative talent with the world. We hope to shine a light on local and international artists that are willing to donate their time, money, and talent to make Los Angeles more beautiful.

 

 

    THE EVENT

    SEPTEMBER 27 (FRIDAY)- Closed to the public (VIP only)

    • Registration for participating artists
    • Artist Meet and Greet BBQ Party
    • Planning for murals

    SEPTEMBER 28 (SATURDAY)- VIP

    • All paintings will be done between 9AM - 6 PM
    • Execution of artwork
    • Gallery openings and connections:
      • ​SHADOWBOX Gallery in DTLA
        • 334 S Main St., 90013
        • @shadowbox_la
      • CATCH ONE LA- Music Event in Koreatown, after hours
        • 4067 W Pico Blvd, 90019
        • @catchonela

    SEPTEMBER 29 (SUNDAY)

    • All activities will be held between 9AM - 6 PM
    • Artists will finish up their work
    • CELEBRATE!

     

    WHAT WE NEED

    • Basic essentials for the event:
      • Porta potties
      • Sinks
      • Waste disposal
      • Security staff
      • Scissor lift
    • Artist supplies:
      • Paint
      • Auxiliary Items
    • Securing of venue spaces
    • Event supplies / Marketing:
      • Passes
      • Maps
      • Stickers
      • Posters
      • T-shirts

     

    PERKS

    As a thank you for donating, we have some beautiful one-of-a-kind artwork by some of our talented artists in the community, like this unique handsculpted Eric B rose made from recycled spraypaint can.  We are also offering 20 VIP tickets that include exclusive backstage hang-out with our artists.

     

     

    DISCLOSURE: Risks & Challenges

    This is our second LA Meeting of Styles and everything is organized by ESPY alone and SOME help from the community. While we will try to be on top of everything and be as professional as possible, please understand that we may not get to everyone's inquiries right away, due to limited staffing. We are NOT getting paid for the event. The campaign will only cover basic costs. Our film/documentation crew are mostly donating their time but your donation will help them get fed and help pay for their equipments.

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

    While we hope to be able to meet our funding goal (which includes 5% fee to Indiegogo), we know there is a possibility that we may not get there. If this is the case, whatever funds we do get will go into all the top priorities. We MAY run into the risk of not being able to provide as many sinks and porta potties as we'd like. However, the perks you have claimed will 100% percent go to you, no matter what the outcome of our campaign!

     

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please share with who you can about our campaign
    • Come to the event (it's free!) and share our work on your social media

    QUESTIONS? COMMENTS?! OR JUST WANNA SHARE YOUR ENTHUSIASM?

    Write them out in the comment section and we'll get back to you ASAP!

     

    This campaign and campaign video was made by ANNIE WOO- IG: @woohooannie

Waste disposal
Security staff
Scissor lift



Artist supplies:
Paint
Auxiliary Items


Securing of venue spaces


Event supplies / Marketing:
Passes
Maps
Stickers
Posters
T-shirts


 

PERKS

As a thank you for donating, we have some beautiful one-of-a-kind artwork by some of our talented artists in the community, like this unique handsculpted Eric B rose made from recycled spraypaint can.  We are also offering 20 VIP tickets that include exclusive backstage hang-out with our artists.
 
 
DISCLOSURE: Risks & Challenges
This is our second LA Meeting of Styles and everything is organized by ESPY alone and SOME help from the community. While we will try to be on top of everything and be as professional as possible, please understand that we may not get to everyone's inquiries right away, due to limited staffing. We are NOT getting paid for the event. The campaign will only cover basic costs. Our film/documentation crew are mostly donating their time but your donation will help them get fed and help pay for their equipments.
 
 

Risks & Challenges
While we hope to be able to meet our funding goal (which includes 5% fee to Indiegogo), we know there is a possibility that we may not get there. If this is the case, whatever funds we do get will go into all the top priorities. We MAY run into the risk of not being able to provide as many sinks and porta potties as we'd like. However, the perks you have claimed will 100% percent go to you, no matter what the outcome of our campaign!
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please share with who you can about our campaign
Come to the event (it's free!) and share our work on your social media

QUESTIONS? COMMENTS?! OR JUST WANNA SHARE YOUR ENTHUSIASM?
Write them out in the comment section and we'll get back to you ASAP!
 This campaign and campaign video was made by ANNIE WOO- IG: @woohooannie

story:
How Designers & E-commerce are holding up in such hard times ? 

 

 Since the pandemic outbreak, several artists, designers, and creators have been severely impacted: no sales, high anxiety levels, and lack of inspiration. Many artists could not pursue their work because of the lockdown and the ban on outdoor activities. Creators and designers have never been this distanced.

Even their customers are anxious, amid this health crisis. Due to the social distancing rules, their shopping experience has changed. Buyers fear to be stuck in crowded areas, that is why they would shop mostly for the essentials quickly. However online shopping can provide them the same old experience and better. They can take their time choosing articles, simulate in augmented reality, and buy whatever they like from across the world in the comfort of your home. 

Stores, NGOs, Sports Clubs, and brands have been dramatically affected by the covid19. The lack of onsite activities prohibited them from promoting their products, exposing new trends, and even collecting donations or support for their activities, International brands need new fresh ideas to promote their new trends. NGOs need a new way to manage campaigns and collect money and Sports Clubs have to push online their products and new designs sales!

Covid19 has changed our daily activities: shopping, social gathering, and events into a never-ending nightmare.

 

We need a solution ... We need Post App ! 

We aim to improve this situation by giving you a support system and a platform where you design, post, and communicate with the biggest artists and designers' community.

Post is here to support and engage with the graphic designers’ community and give them a platform to show off their skills and outstanding designs.

But first, we need your support to finalize our mobile App, to promote and link the best designers and artists in one place, Post App. It will give them a technical and commercial push.

We don’t care about race, ethnicity, nationality, belief, sex, gender, language, sexual orientation, or gender identity, we only care about your skills. This app is for every creative person.

We love to show your creation in our App and bring you buyers all over the world to choose and shop giving you a rate and feedback. The more you’re talented, the more you’ll get money and exposure.

It is also a great opportunity for students and freelancers to make extra cash and get their first recognition.

 

Post is easy to Use !

The app is very simple to use for both designers and buyers. For creators, all they need to do is Design and Post using their personal space. You can share limited number of designs and for limited time to improve creativity and promote diversity.

  

Brands, celebrities, NGOs, and Sports clubs could choose your designs for their merch and to be exposed in their stores and double the chances for your win and notoriety.

 

Brands, VIP, NGOs, Sports Club, Printers and Buyers ... Post is also for you !

You can choose or design using Post App, you can experiment with a new way to customize products ( t-shirts, mugs, Face-masks ...). Our augmented reality feature will help you make the best purchases with no regrets.

With the Post app, all you have to do is search, try, and buy without breaking a sweat. Online shopping was never this easy.

NGOs also need designs for their merch and they could find exceptional creations. Besides, buying from Post is a great way to support small businesses and young designers.

Post is for everyone ... give a hand and be part of our community.

      
Post is a great place for Influence Merch Companies, schools, organizations, clubs, and NGOs to spice up their products and engage with several talented graphic designers. Our app will help t-shirt business owners to add a spin to their products with new innovative designs.

More Traffic ... More Sales with Post App !

Using Post, we will increase your website traffic and your brand awareness. You can make extra cash and increase sales easily by joining us and show off your amazing designs to our large community.

 

Let's Discover What is Post ...

In the video down below, we will show you our main features; that we take pride of developing.

 

With our innovative feature: Augmented Reality, you can experiment with several designs and try whatever you want to buy.

You guessed it! we are not done yet. With our Multi AR you can try different cool designs with your family and friends


We have already a US Patent ...

Those features are exclusively based on an US patent on multi AR. Our hard work paid off when we received it, it was our first milestone.


  We have an ongoing process to have the patent on other countries, such as, Canada, Europe, Japan and Korea. It will be a great achievement for our team and local communities to experiment our full product.

 

Behind this, there is a passionate Team ... 

 "POST is a New Generation Design Application. It is a broad-spectrum, social media and e-commerce AR enabled application, dedicated to connecting designers, photographers, painters, amateurs, and professionals with a buyer-audience of creative design lovers. POST incorporated a patented, in-house multi-detection augmented reality feature and a blockchain technology with the highest security standards, allowing you to transfer your chosen design to your preferred support. Public, celebrities, fashion brands, clubs, NGOs,  communities, charitable foundations and designers can interact in a multifaceted model, they can share their interests while generating tangible revenues." - Michel Kovacevitch, CEO & Founder of Post

 

Your Money will give us a push for a faster launch !

Your financial support will help us finish the development of the app. As soon as we finish the technical work we will launch our app globally by the first quarter of 2021. We will start supporting artists, designers, freelancers and help small business owners. 

In addition, your financial support will benefit the designers too. We will provide them professional training and post their creations on Post app for free.

You can check perks for further details.

Our goal is to collect  1M$ Budget  to invest on finalizing the product and research, to manage our operations, to bring great talents ,and to gather & educate our designers community !

 

Now the ball in your court ... Take action !

story:
2019 will mark the 50th anniversary of one of the most monumental events in the history of mankind - The Apollo 11 Project - the first landing of humans on the moon. This campaign is a celebration of that accomplishment. 

In 1967, two years before the first man set foot on the moon, NASA had charted the entire route that the command module "Columbia" and the landing module "Eagle" would make on its journey from earth to the moon and back home again and released it as a poster. This chart has now been fully restored, recolored, and - thanks to the support of backers like you - will be launched as a special reissue this spring! 

On July 20, 1969, two American astronauts ( Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin ) became the first men to step foot on the moon. It was a dream and a challenge set forth by one man, President John F. Kennedy, when he declared in May of 1961 : 

"I believe this nation should commit itself to achieving the goal, before this decade is out, of landing a man on the moon and returning him safely to earth."

It took years of planning and the work of thousands of people to accomplish this task but on July 16th the massive Saturn V rocket lifted off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center carrying three astronauts on their mission to the moon.

"All this is possible only through the blood, sweat, and tears of a number of people.... All you see [are] the three of us, but beneath the surface are thousands and thousands of others."

                                             - Apollo 11 astronaut Michael Collins

Thousands of people across America and the world watched in anticipation, and all those years of planning culminated in celebration on that exciting day.

The Apollo 11 Lunar Landing Chart proves how well planned out the project was even two years prior to when the Saturn V launched the capsule into space. Stages of the launch, orbit, descent, and return were precisely calculated...and those who owned this chart at the time could have followed along with the astronauts on every leg of the journey. 

This chart is a wonderful paper souvenir of one of the most glorious events in humankind and yet very few people own it. Hopefully, with the reissuing of this chart, that will change. 

I have fully restored this original lunar landing chart, bringing out the deep blacks of outer space, and the details of the capsule drawings. Then I changed the hues of the earth and moon ( to give it that added sci-fi punch ) and colored the text and lines, adding plenty of "stars" too. 

A fifty-year-old chart given new life.....it deserves it. 

 

This reissue of The Apollo 11 Lunar Landing Chart will measure 1' x 3' ( 12" x 36"/30cm x 92cm ). It will be printed on 80lb glossy cover stock with a UV coating and feature a 1/4" border - in black - so it will be easy to frame. The title block will also be printed in metallic ink to really commemorate the occasion. This is a standard U.S. panorama frame size as well, so pre-made frames can easily be purchased. 

Simple rewards for a humble, but worthy, project......

THE STICKER SET - $5

One 4" circular sticker featuring the original artwork from the Apollo 11 mission patch. The astronauts had wanted the image on the patch to be symbolic so they chose a bald eagle with its "landing gear" extended. The eagle is a proud symbol of the United States but it was also the name of the lunar module. To symbolize the peaceful nature of the mission, the eagle is carrying an olive branch - the symbol of peace. 

Also, included will be two 3" x 6" stickers of the original Apollo 11 logo. 

THE APOLLO 11 LUNAR LANDING CHART - $30

One Apollo 11 Lunar Landing Chart + the sticker set. This is what this project is all about. It measures 12" x 36" ( 30cm x 92cm ) and will come shipped rolled in a tube. As a bonus, you'll also receive all of the stickers! 

THE APOLLO 11 LUNAR LANDING CHART X2 - $50 

Two ( 2 ) Apollo 11 Lunar Landing Charts + two ( 2 ) sticker sets. Double the charts, double the stickers! 

While this project is listed under my name - Constance Metzinger - it will actually be a joint effort by my sister, Diana, and myself. I enjoy the restoration work, all design aspects of the project, and handling "customer service" while Diana takes care of packaging duties.

I'd like to thank NASA for generously providing images of the Apollo 11 project and special thanks to all of the men and women involved in the various Apollo projects from its beginning in 1966. This independent project is not endorsed nor affiliated with NASA in any way.

story:
BA Illustration class of 2016 Degree show

We are currently approaching our third year at Camberwell college of the Arts London. In that final year we hope to put on a degree show external to the college to promote our work in a real life context. In order to do so we are in need of support. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for funding of £5000 to help promote the work of up and coming illustrators and artists.  This money will be used in various ways; hiring a space, equipment, exhibition catalog, marketing& promotion etc.  

The Impact

With the recent raise in tuition fees, rent and material costs. Being an art student is a trial in itself. A contribution however small or big will help not only to fundraise for our degree show but be a stepping stone in our future careers as Illustrators/Artists.
We are a dedicated group of students, who want to finish at Camberwell with a bang! by putting on an amazing show in such an inspiring city. 

Please get involved and share our event !!

story:
My name is Jeffrey Lamar. I am an artist/actor living in Arizona via Brooklyn, New York.

 I've always had a healthy love for art. I started a t-shirt company back in the nineties called Celestial Apparel. I did artwork for a mineral company and I've also done album work for some musicians (myself included). So it only makes sense that I would try to create a career out of this. Trying to support a family and create a business is very hard work. I've always had the talent, but not the tools/money, to take my skills to the next level. I will admit having tremendous success with acting, but we all know you need a stable job.

I have five paintings that I have scanned and are waiting to be printed. These prints will be the starting point for what I hope will be a prosperous career.

Below are the prints I'm starting with.  

1. GLAM ROCK

2. SCOEV (Storm Clouds Over East Valley)

3. ITWYRS (Is This What You Remember Seeing?)

4. Route 42

5. Wet N Wild

That's five paintings (10 prints each) large format poster

 Full Color - Blank Luster Gloss Poster Paper plus shipping.

With your contributions I will be able to put the profits from the prints, which I will be charging roughly twenty five dollars a piece for, back into JL ART and it'll help me to secure spots at art festivals, buying business cards/promotions, website maintenance, procuring a merchant licenses/tax licenses,paints, canvas's, merchandise, promotions etc.

Here's some deck mock up's I'm toying with.


You will be there at the ground level, helping someone "you know" achieve their dream of becoming a working artist.

Every little bit counts. Even if you told me that my art sucks...that's still something and I appreciate it. Most of you will be friends who already know how real the struggle is, but for those who don't or are meeting me for the first time, I appreciate the time you took to read this and I hope we'll get the opportunity to meet each other in this life or the next.


What We Need & What You Get

The exact cost for this endeavor is $1,043.79. I'm rounding that number up to 1,100.00 just to cover any extraneous cost I may not have foreseen. 

REWARDS

$50.00 or more donation: Signed print of one of a kind piece.
$100.00 or more donation: 4x4 commission plus signed print (limit 6)
$500.00 or more donation: 18 x 24 full color piece plus 4x4 commission and signed print. (limit 2)

 
Risks & Challenges
There aren't any real risk involved with this challenge. I am so confident that this will succeed because I have the talent and a incredible network of artist/friends who have already established themselves in this genre, to rely on.

Plus, I intend to broaden my reach into other market's like retail (clothing, skateboards, accessories etc), music (music videos,album art,artist merchandise etc),festivals (art festivals, beer and wine festivals, comic cons etc),beers (labels),wines (labels),galleries,postcards,toys,commissions etc.

I will use any and all my resources to help bring this new chapter of my life to fruition.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand times can be tough. I'm an artist. I know, but there's always ways to help. For instance posting this campaign to your Facebook/Twitter/Tumblr or whatever piece of social media tool you like to use. Hell, I'll even take a "Good luck Jeffrey!" or a "Sending good thoughts your way!"

story:
Online Magazine: http://goo.gl/2K3o8F

Who is CCC?

Corean Canadian Creatives (CCC), a nonprofit organization, aims to build a community of young Korean Canadian adults where they can find an environment to proactively develop and nurture their creativity while garnering a supportive audience through both individual and collective production and exhibition of their works.


What is the Collaborative Project about?

The Collaborative Project is planned and managed by CCC, but the actual outcome is created by volunteering participants. Through the public call for applicants, talented individuals from various creative fields are collected together to work on developing and completing the Project. We have set this year's theme for the project as "Korean-Canadian Identity," in an attempt to let young Korean Canadians reflect on their identity as a member of a culturally vibrant city, and share their thoughts with one another, and ultimately, with you. 


Why is funding needed?

This project is now in its 3rd month in the making, but we are just getting started.  Many people have volunteered their time and expertise to finish the first phase of the project. As a result, we now have the final draft of a magazine with creative writing and visual artwork, that is ready to be published. In the second phase, we will call for participants to create videography and music to accompany the writings and visual artwork. We now need to raise funds to hire professional sound mixing studios and to print out physical copies of the magazine. To cover these costs, we require a minimum of $4,000 in funding. 

The funding target can be broken down as the following:

  • Publish the magazine in print form (~$2,000 for 100 copies, the cost per copy will decrease if we raise enough funds to print in larger quantities)
  • Record soundtracks and mix with videography at a professional mixing studio (~$2000)

What's in it for me?

You will receive recognition as a project supporter in both our magazine and videos. Also depending upon your level of support, you can receive postcards with original artwork, a print copy of the magazine, HD digital copies of the magazine and videos in a  8GB USB drive, and a 22" x 28" poster.
story_txt:
Online Magazine: http://goo.gl/2K3o8FWho is CCC? Corean Canadian Creatives (CCC), a nonprofit organization, aims to build a community of young Korean Canadian adults where they can find an environment to proactively develop and nurture their creativity while garnering a supportive audience through both individual and collective production and exhibition of their works.


What is the Collaborative Project about?
The Collaborative Project is planned and managed by CCC, but the actual outcome is created by volunteering participants. Through the public call for applicants, talented individuals from various creative fields are collected together to work on developing and completing the Project. We have set this year's theme for the project as "Korean-Canadian Identity," in an attempt to let young Korean Canadians reflect on their identity as a member of a culturally vibrant city, and share their thoughts with one another, and ultimately, with you. 


  Why is funding needed?
This project is now in its 3rd month in the making, but we are just getting started.  Many people have volunteered their time and expertise to finish the first phase of the project. As a result, we now have the final draft of a magazine with creative writing and visual artwork, that is ready to be published. In the second phase, we will call for participants to create videography and music to accompany the writings and visual artwork. We now need to raise funds to hire professional sound mixing studios and to print out physical copies of the magazine. To cover these costs, we require a minimum of $4,000 in funding. 
 The funding target can be broken down as the following:  Publish the magazine in print form (~$2,000 for 100 copies, the cost per copy will decrease if we raise enough funds to print in larger quantities)
Record soundtracks and mix with videography at a professional mixing studio (~$2000)


    What's in it for me? You will receive recognition as a project supporter in both our magazine and videos. Also depending upon your level of support, you can receive postcards with original artwork, a print copy of the magazine, HD digital copies of the magazine and videos in a  8GB USB drive, and a 22" x 28" poster.

story:
Arts Jam started in 2012, when a small group of passionate people in the town of Chardon, Ohio started meeting at the local coffee shop to ask themselves, "What can we do to make our town more friendly and welcoming to artists, musicians and creative folks of all stripes, and at the same time bring a vitality to our community and the surrounding areas?"  Arts Jam was born as a way to bring together artists and audiences on the Far East Side of Cleveland, for an immersion experience in the pleasure of the arts.  Think FringeFest meets Northeast Ohio! 

This year's Arts Jam is June 25, 2016 on and around beautiful and historic Chardon Square and Main Street, just 25 miles from downtown Cleveland.  All our events during the Jam are either free or of nominal charge.  We get wonderful support from our community, but we need your help, too!   Although we are completely non-profit and all our labor in organizing and executing Arts Jam is volunteer-based, our philosophy is that artists should GET PAID!!  You can help make that happen!

What we need

We already have corporate sponsorships for 2016 of $2500 and plan to generate another $3500 in sponsorships and income.  We need $2000 more to close our budget and bring you another fabulous Arts Jam with over 50 performers and groups and an evening show that will knock your socks off! 

Benefits to you will include:  free tickets to the evening performance with VIP seating, an Arts Jam T-shirt or coffee mug, shout-out 'thank you's' during performances, CD's from participating artists, a custom-written poem on a topic of your choosing, and many more!

We make a difference

Experiencing the arts makes a difference in people's lives - we all know that.  This is not just another arts and crafts show for shopping.  Arts Jam is an experience that encourages participation - with small performance venues, workshops and tutorials, and hands-on experiences for the whole family.  Always wanted to play the clarinet?  Come to the musical 'petting zoo' and give it a whirl!  Think you can't draw?  Learn how to paint your visions on silk scarves that you can take away and wear!  All thumbs when it comes to technology?  Build a doodling robot and see where art meets tech!  And so much more - for kids to grown-ups, we bring creative experience to the forefront of this wonderful day. 

Risks

Arts Jam doesn't have a lot of risks, other than the weather!  Even a rainy day won't stop us, because we have lots of indoor venues we can move to in case of a few drops.  Every bit of support - even if we don't make our goal - will go to making this a great day!

Ways You Can Help

So give as generously as you can - even if it is just $1, we appreciate your support.  And if you can't give money, help us to get the word out and share with your friends using Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter and other social media.    And we LOVE to get volunteers - visit our website at www.chardonartsjam.org for more information about how to get involved!  THANKS!!!!

story:
About This Project:

The National A. Philip Randolph Pullman Porter Museum, a part of the National Park Service Pullman National Monument. The museum pays tribute to some of the most influential African-American leaders in history:  A. Philip Randolph and the Pullman Porters that he organized into the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters union—the first Black labor union chartered in America. Join the “Friends of A. Philip Randolph” in support of an even grander tribute by creating a mural on the side of the museum’s building.  Make a donation now to help us .

100% OF THE PROCEEDS OF THIS FUND RAISING EFFORT WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT AND ENHANCE THE PULLMAN COMMUNITY. THE MONEY RAISED IN THIS CAMPAIGN  WILL PAY FOR A PHOTO MURAL THAT WILL HELP TO ACCURATELY CONNECT AFRICAN AMERICANS TO PULLMAN'S HISTORY, THE PHOTO MURAL WILL GO UP ON THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF 104TH BETWEEN CORLISS AND MARYLAND AVENUE , FACING NORTH.  WE NEED YOUR PLEDGE ASAP TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN. 

Your donation in any amount can help us pay tribute to the men who redefined American labor, American democracy, and civil rights and simultaneously help to elevate the museums profile. Your donation can help  us to incorporate Art, history, and place-making in the neighborhood at the National Park Service New Pullman National Monument.

What is the A. Philip Randolph Pullman Porter Mural About?

The three pillars of vibrant community development are Identity, Sustainability and Mobility. Identity represents a community’s historic and present day character. When we think of China town, we know exactly what we are getting, quality restaurants and an authentic experience of Chinese culture. When we think of Devon Avenue, we know it as place to experience Indian culture.

Pullman is sitting on a gold mine, in addition to the architecture, its connection to the African American contribution to America's labor and civil rights history.

The Impact

This  campaign is a way for everyone to show their respect for the culture and to say, "We know where we've been and we now know exactly where we are going."  This campaign is not an attempt to live in the past, but rather a retracing of our steps back to that fork in the road where we got lost, so that we may start off in the right direction. Show your support today by making a pledge. Your donation will help erect a large (33' x 27') photo mural of A. Philip Randolph, flanked by Firemen supported by the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters (BSCP) labor union.  The Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters was the door opener not just for railroad employees but for all African Americans into America's organized labor movement.   By reminding us of our past, the scale and power of this artworks will get us excited about our future. Be a part of history and pledge today.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Whether or not you donate, help get the word out by talking about this, project and sharing this with all your friends.

story:
Hola!

Soy un estudiante de cine que ama el arte y por sobretodo el efecto social que este produce alrededor del mundo. Hoy, les pido ayuda para recaudar fondos para hacer mi proyecto de grado realidad.
¿A quién le gustaría ser niño de nuevo? Bueno, este cortometraje trata acerca de la niñez que todos seguimos llevando por dentro; pero llevado un poco al exceso. Se trata de un niño atrapado en el cuerpo de un hombre de 50 años, a quién le cuesta pasar de su inocencia a su madurez. 
Este gran paso le costará sus obsesiones más profundas y su única relación amorosa para quedar sólo en el mundo. El personaje que "vive" refugiándose del mundo real acumulando juguetes de recuerdo, terminará superando su miedo a experimentar cosas nuevas debido a la muerte de su madre por su culpa. 
Siento que este corto puede ser bastante universal, por su temática; pero al mismo tiempo único, ya que la relación frente al mundo existe a través de objetos inanimados. Ayúdanos, y  a largo plazo, tu nombre o tu empresa podría dar la vuelta al mundo por los diferentes festivales que existen en el globo, incluido la responsabilidad social frente a los derechos humanos y la libre expresión, sin contar la importancia que se le da a los infantes en general que llevamos todos dentro. Estoy seguro como director de este audiovisual, de poder sacar este proyecto adelante. 

El dinero que estamos tratando de recaudar se destinará al pago de comida, transporte, actores y locaciones involucrados en el corto.Si no tienes dinero, puedes ayudar también dándole compartir a esta página a quien le pueda interesar un proyecto que lo identifique, y que también sea parte de él. Te invitamos a ser testigo de algo que tú viviste, revivirlo y reflexionar acerca de tu madurez.

Sé que pronto nos veremos en una sala de cine para estrenar este cortometraje; ya que cuento con la colaboración de grandes profesionales como cabezas de equipo, un equipo técnico de cámaras, luces y sonido, además de una buena experiencia dirigiendo audiovisuales. Lo único que falta es tu colaboración. Estamos seguros de sacar un gran producto que rompa festivales y vuele cabezas en el mundo.

y tú, ¿qué esperas para ser un niño otra vez?

Gracias por tu atención, ten un buen día y no olvides compartirlo con tus amigos.

Juan Pablo Cote
Estudiante de Cine
3013724873
Bogotá

story:
Short Summary

Discordia is a Burning Man theme camp comprised entirely of people from New Zealand, Australia and the UK. 

In 2015 we're building a huge pyramid in the desert complete with bar, DJ booth, misting fans and public shaded chill space. There will be fun games and challenges including the Wheel of Misfortune, acro-yoga sessions and we're coordinating Burner Bingo - the largest collaborative game on the playa involving over 50 theme camps!

At night the pyramid will be lit with LED lights, UV cannons and projection-mapped visuals.

UPDATE: Discordia will be located in the 9:00 Public Plaza (9 & K) for 2015! 

What We Need & What You Get

We already have all the funding in place for our core infrastructure (close to US$15,000)  but we need a little more to help with lights, decoration and furniture. We also really want to projection-map the pyramid!

We're seeking $3000 to purchase projectors and video equipment, LED lights, batteries and solar panels to really make the Discordia pyramid a truly mind-blowing experience for visitors at Burning Man. 

Sample costs include:

  • Deep-cycle 12V marine batteries ($120 each)
  • Solar panel kits  ($180 each)
  • Power cabling ($100)
  • 50 meters of LED strip, power supplies and controllers ($1500)
  • LED flood and disco lights ($500)
  • LED video projectors & display hardware ($1000)
  • Potable water for misting fans ($70 per barrel)
  • Playatech couches with cushions ($125 each)

100% of profits raised will be spent on infrastructure or consumables (e.g. fuel or water for misting fans). Discordia has no paid staff and is entirely funded through donations or personal member contributions.

In return we're offering a number of swag perks, ranging from stickers and buttons (badges for you non-americans), water bottles, T-shirts and hoodies. In keeping with the Burning Man 10 Principles no on-playa perks are provided, however you are welcome to collect your perks from our camp if you're attending in 2015.  

The Impact

Burning Man is an amazing place full of incredible sights and sounds... this means it takes effort to stand out and be noticed! 

At Discordia we really want to create something that makes people stop and go "Wow!"

For 2015 we've chosen to build a massive pyramid, 26 feet high (nearly 3 stories!), 40 feet wide and 36 feet deep housing a bar, DJ booth, sound system, misting fans and plenty of comfy seating for visitors to relax on.

This alone sounds awesome (and it will be!) however at night we really want the Discordia Pyramid to be a beacon of light, covered in LED lighting effects and projection mapped panels within. 

Your donation will help us decorate and light the pyramid to hopefully allow us to become one of the most memorable experiences at Burning Man. 

Who are Discordia?

Discordia is a Burning Man theme camp started in 2012 by a small group of New Zealanders which has now expanded to include around 60 people each year. 

Our group is entirely international with most members coming from New Zealand, Australia and the UK. 

Discordia is 100% non-profit and is mostly funded from the personal pockets of the camp founders.

More info can be found at https://discordia.camp

Risks & Challenges

Honestly there aren't many risks involved. All our core infrastructure is funded and/or built already, all the crew already have BM tickets, plane tickets and trucks are all booked and paid for.

The biggest risks are: 

  • The playa is hard on electronics. Projectors need to be carefully selected (LED is good) and protected against the harsh environment. Computers driving visuals need air filters and additional cooling.
  • As we are a 100% international camp and we're only in the USA for one week prior to the event there is always the risk of the postal service not delivering on time. We have mitigated this by arranging for our storage facility in Reno to accept packages for us in advance however meeting our fundraising goals early will allow us to place orders early leaving plenty of time for delivery.

story:
Short Summary

I invite you to help support me in funding the framing and preparation of art work for gallery showings of my photography​ based digital art.

As you can imagine, a gallery showing of art work is a very expensive venture for an artist. The cost of preparing 50 canvas, acrylic, metal or​ framed prints for multiple exhibitions​ can run me anywhere from $100​ to $200​ per piece, depending on size and shipping costs. On average, that's $7,500!​

​Your help, at this critical time in my creative career, will provide encouragement and help me in my journey to become independent​.  I so very much appreciate your assistance in ​helping me reach my dream of ​becoming a self-sustaining artist​!​

What are the ​benefits ​for Y​OU? ​ Check out ​some of the pretty cool ​PERKS​!​

story:
This is a page made by the constantes, friends of of Ay Ombe Theater and Josefina Báez.

Josefina Baez (La Romana, Dominican Republic/New York) Storyteller, performer, writer, theatre director, educator, devotee. Founder and director of Ay Ombe Theatre (April 1986). Alchemist of artistic/creative life process, Performance Autology© (creative process based on the autobiography of the doer). Books published: Dominicanish, Comrade, Bliss ain´t playing, Dramaturgia I & II, Como la Una/Como Uma, Levente no. Yolayorkdominicanyork, De Levente. 4 textos para teatro performance, Canto de Plenitud, Latin In and Why is my name Marysol? (a children's book).

Josefina Baez/Ay Ombe Theatre

Independent artist Collective Bliss.

Support Ay Ombe!

story:
Original Ideal is a photography and art project which uses Neuroscience methods to approximate the subjects’ ideal self image. We are raising funds to shoot more material in this ongoing project, in a location voted for by you, and produce a photography book from the results. Our original video launched in October, caused such a stir, we wanted to try our luck at taking our project outside UK.


Methodology

Step 1:

The subject is photographed in the studio.


Step 2:

Versions of their face are produced by manipulating their features.


Step 3:

They are presented with these versions whilst wearing an EEG Brain Scanner to record their preconscious reactions.


Step 4:

The results are analysed to determine which version they have the strongest positive reaction to.


Step 5:

The 'Original' portrait to the left is then presented next to the 'Ideal', preferred version to the right in a diptych.


This is an art project about self-image, not beauty. In our daily lives we constantly make judgements about each other based on appearance and our own quality of life is affected by satisfaction with our own appearance. This project aims to show the difference between a the subjects’ reality and ideal. It is up to the audience to decide what those differences mean.

Goals

The aim of this campaign is to raise sufficient funds to travel to a location voted for by contributors. The artist will stay on location for 5 weeks shooting up to 25 new portraits, obtaining EEG recordings and producing diptychs. The results will become material for a photography book  designed by Irisnegro



Video

A short interview will be conducted with each willing participant after their EEG recording on the subject of self-image. How has it affected them throughout their lives? How does it affect their interactions with others?


Budget Breakdown


Stretch goals

For every $7,000 over the funding goal received we will add another trip, in another location to the tour. Again, these extra locations will be determined by the votes of those contributing $10 or more to the campaign. More Locations means more diptychs and a thicker book! After the 5th location added to the tour the stretch goal would be to put on an exhibition of the work in one city, again voted for by those contributing $10 or more.


Team

Scott Chasserot came up with the idea for Original Ideal three years ago and has been developing the methodology ever since. As an editorial portrait photographer he has 13 years of experience delivering imagery of the highest quality to international brand magazines.


Ignasi Sabaté was instrumental in developing the techniques which allow for the manipulation of digital imagery to produce realistic versions of the subjects’ face. As digital Imaging Technician he will be producing the versions throughout the project in order to test the subjects.


Naureen Nayyar was responsible for the resounding PR success of the pilot project, which was published on over 300 sites and garnering 1.5 million page views for the project in the past few months, instigating this campaign.


These are the latest of this ongoing series. Identical twins Kevin and Paul. With your help we want to continue producing engaging material that questions our assumptions about facial structure, self-image and personality. Our aim is to photograph as diverse a group of people across gender, age, ethnic and cultural divides. Thanks for your help!


@originalideal
#originalideal
originalideal.com

story: It's time to move forward from "Lighting it up BLUE" for autism awareness! It's time to STOP making donations that actually go toward other people's salaries. Move Forward - START EMPOWERING individuals with autism - Help nurture and support individuals with autism to contribute to society in the best way they can. Help boost abilities. Join the movement to promote Autism ABILITIES Awareness and to increase employment opportunities for individuals on the autism spectrum. Strokes of Genius, Inc is a non-profit organization that empowers individuals with autism who have a talent or gift in art. Our participants make friends, share common interests, increase social and communication skills and build self-esteem.  Watch the videos and enjoy the images in our GALLERY link above. For more information about Strokes of Genius, Inc go to www.strokesofgeniusinc.org We are a 501(c) non-profit and all donations are tax deductible to the extent of the law.
