story:
There are many special occasions in a child's life when you want to find a unique gift. 

Our handmade custom plush toys are the perfect gift to transform imagination into a hugable stuffed animal keepsake! 

Drawing is one of the most beautiful forms of expression. Even before they learn to properly form sentences, children create cute masterpieces courtesy of their liberated imagination. Unfortunately, all kinds of the adorable characters are lost in attics and basements or just thrown away. DrawYourToys.com gives parents the opportunity to turn their children’s creation into a memento that the child and his family can cherish for years to come.

Custom stuffed toys based on your children's artwork.

Everything about DrawYourToys.com is associated with the glee and happiness of the young age. The Idea was conceived in the minds of two childhood friends Bor Briscik and Marcel Zver, both of us like to draw, create and build all sorts of crazy things. One of those “crazy childhood ideas” we had is now known as DrawYourToys.com, which combines our passion for arts, drawings and love for children.

How we envisioned the order process, How it all Works

Send us a photo of the drawing and hardworking hands of our talented team of artists, cutters, and seamstress will come together to create each toy. We try to be as precise with every detail from the drawing.

A precious friend

Crafted plush toys made in such way become a precious and beloved child’s friend forever. After all, they have imagined the toy by themselves and is the fruit of their imagination and is entirely theirs.

Unique plush toys stimulate a child’s creativity.

Don’t let your children’s drawings remain forgotten in some closet or even in the basement. Change them into a cuddly toy that your child will love!

Putting safety first

We put a high emphasis on the quality of material used in the toys. We are very aware that all our products are primarily availed by children and hence we take extra care in making them hazard free and safe. So you can have a piece of mind while your child has a great time with his creations brought to life!

What We Need to Make It Happen 
  • We are just starting out in Ljubljana, Slovenia and have already encountered our first problems, particularly with acquiring the right fabrics. More specifically, with the prices and selection of material. 
  • When creating our first toys we tried with fabrics from a retail store, but it was proven to be unprofitable since the price of retail fabrics is to expensive. To be able to create unique toys and start up our business idea, we need to buy fabrics in bulk, directly from the manufacturer. Unfortunately, we are in dire need of funding considering we are just starting out and have already invested all of our savings into this project. 
  • With the received funds, we would be able to contact a wholesale seller in Italy that we have previously spoken to, and acquire the required fabrics. 
  • Also we currently have just one expert seamstress on our team, but additional funds would enable us to hire and train one additional seamstress, to help us with the creation of Unique Plush Toys.
If for whatever reason, our entire goal isn't reached, the project will still persist and the funds will still go toward the DrawYourToys project, although it will take longer to complete. If we exceed our goal, there is a number of other amazing projects that the funding can help support (custom bags, purses and bedding with the motive of the children drawing sewn onto them) – there will be more updates on these as we get closer to our goal.

What You Get

If you contribute, we've got a selection of fantastic fun perks for you, as detailed on the right.  All perks will be given in voucher form, so that you can redeem them online on our DrawYourToys website.

For 80$ Contribution You will receive one Deluxe Draw Your Own Cuddly Plush Toy (size is approx. 36 - 43 cm). A Custom Stuffed toy based on your child's artwork, neatly packaged in a beautiful gift box, with a certificate of special recognition, for giving back and helping children in need. Read more about our charity campaign bellow p.s. Inside you will also find our free surprise gift! 

For 250$ Contribution we offer you additional to receiving one Deluxe Draw-Your-Own-Cuddly Plush Toy an animation that brings to life your child's drawing in a unique short video.  Surprise your child as they see a drawing that they have created come to life not only as a Plush Toy but also as a Animation! You will receive it in our custom gift box with a certificate of special recognition for donating to children in need.

For 500$ Contribution we have created Deluxe Fairytale package 

It includes Deluxe Draw Your Own Cuddly Plush Toy plus you will receive Your Own Fairytale Book with Your Child as the main Hero in a Book with gorgeous illustrations.

and

We will also animate and bring to life your child's drawing, as a short cartoon. Watch the magic in your child's eyes as they see a drawing that they have created come to life as a Plush Toy, Fairytale Book and as a Animation! You will receive it in our custom gift box with a certificate of special recognition for donating to children in need.

Giving Back and Spreading Love

Bringing joy and hope to children in need

Children with their drawings made into plush toys help other children in need by indirectly donating $1 to the charity campaign: "Children Helping Children".

Let's educate our children about the socially useful value of their toys. Open their eyes to the challenges other children experience and teach compassion, tolerance and mutual love.

That was the inspiration for the name of the charity campaign: “Children helping children”.

By purchasing our toy the child also receives a certificate of special recognition, for donation and helping other children.

Want to get involved even more? Let us know if you have a non-profit that works with children with need.


FAQ

How do I collect my perk?

All perks will be given in voucher form, so that you can redeem them online on the DrawYourToys website. We will email you your voucher. Please note, that shipping fee is paid for separately. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can contribute financially to our project, you can help us out greatly by spreading the news about our campaign!  To do this, just use the IndieGogo share tools at the top of the page, or just directly share our campaign link - http://igg.me/at/drawyourtoys

We Hope our custom plush toys will put a smile on children all across the world!

Big Thanks!

from DrawYourToys Team

Please help us spread the word by sharing this campaign with your family and friends.

We would love to hear from you!

You can email us at info@drawyourtoys.com or follow us on Facebook

story:
ARTIST’S STUDIO

#LETStART

Ciao,

Sono Veronica Cestari, giovane artista italiana. Dopo gli studi mi sono trasferita a Londra dove per un anno ho lavorato come assistente di una promettente artista brasiliana. Alla fine di questa esperienza ho deciso di incominciare la mia carriera artistica. Il primo passo per iniziare seriamente questa attività è prendere uno spazio e creare il mio studio d’artista!
Ed è per questo che ho bisogno del tuo aiuto!
Ho lanciato questa raccolta fondi in modo da avere un sostegno economico per tutte le spese di affitto e per i materiali di cui avrò bisogno. Questo portale web dà la possibilità in un modo nuovo di diffondere il progetto in tutto il mondo e raccogliere fondi per far partire e crescere le proprie idee. Con il tuo contributo avrò la possibilità di costruire le basi e per sviluppare il mio lavoro artistico.
Si tratta di un investimento!
Infatti, in cambio al tuo fondamentale supporto, riceverai un mio lavoro artistico, che fa parte di un progetto più grande. Nel 2011 ho prodotto un opera riflettendo sul concetto della memoria, e per tre mesi ho lavorato costantemente creando ogni giorno un quadro, un pezzo unico dove segni e colori potessero esprimere l’esperienza di ogni giorno vissuto. Riceverai quindi un tassello unico, che compone un opera più grande e che sarà punto di connessione tra tutti quelli che decideranno di fare questo investimento.
Ho diviso i lavori sotto quattro diverse fasce di contributo (da 50 a 200€), di seguito e nella Gallery potrete vedere le foto di tutti i quadri e a quale categoria corrispondono ( visibili anche tramite il sito www.veronicacestari.it). Puoi sceglierlo e una volta deciso dovrai versare il contributo tramite PayPal (è necessario che mi comunichi quale hai scelto e il tuo indirizzo con un commento privato fatto tramite questo stesso sito). L’opera sarà poi consegnata per posta incorniciata e con attestato di originalità.

Grazie per il tuo supporto,

Veronica

I primi sette (First seven) - Memory's perks - 50€ each
Febbraio (February) - Memory's perks - 100€ each
Marzo (March) - Memory's perks - 150€ each
Giugno (June) - Memory's perks - 200€ each

Puoi vedere i lavori singolarmente nella Gallery o al sito www.veronicacestari.it

-------------
Dear reader, 
I am Veronica Cestari, a young Italian artist specializing in sculpture with a broad interest in various media. After a year of experience in London as the assistant of a great Brazilian artist, I have decided to go back to Italy and start creating my own artworks. I intend to open my personal studio to realize this project.

In fact, I need my own lovely place where I could come up with my ideas and create great pieces. That's why, dear reader, I need your help! 

Nowadays life for a young artist is really tough and it's hard to sustain all the costs especially at the beginning. I need to cover the costs of the rent, tools, materials and furniture. Thus, I really need some external help. Thanks to this web portal, I am trying to raise funds that would allow me to start working. With your contribution I would be able to lay the foundations for my long-term project and really express my ideas. I could finally convey my own style and contribute to the complex and beautiful world of Art.

In order to open my studio and reach my goal, I have decided to start selling pieces of my artwork. You will receive one of my pieces as a perk of your fundamental support.

In 2011 I produced an art piece that allowed me to investigate the concept of memory. I worked on it for three months of my life and each day became a picture, a unique piece where signs and colors expressed the impression that I lived.

I have decided to give these "days of my life" to those who contribute to my future.

I am glad to spread these pieces of memory around as they can be, in some way, a connection between me, the artist, and you, the one that is making my start possible.

I hope to hear from you soon and don't hesitate to write to me for more information about my work, my history and my future.

Thanks for your help.

Veronica 

(see images at www.veronicacestari.it or in the Gallery)

Why is the goal 7000€? 

I have estimated my expenses around 500€ for the monthly rent and some extra costs, so that 7000€ will allow me to cover one year of work.


I primi sette (First seven) - Memory's perk - 50€ each

Febbraio (February) - Memory's perks - 100€ each

Marzo (March) - Memory's perks - 150€ each

Giugno (June) - Memory's perks - 200€ each


MORE ABOUT THE MEMORY PIECES

The work is about memory and it represents my daily memory turned into visual impression. I dedicated myself to observing how and what happened to me every day constantly for three months. I used objects and colors to focus on what consciously and unconsciously was stacked in my mind at the end of the day. The result was paintings with traces which try to emerge through a plain surface and which are still packed in a kind of envelope.

This work represented a challenge to myself that helped me to understand the importance of memory.

I found that images can be part of a recollection: the painting becomes an object through which memory can be brought back to life.

This work tries to deepen the concept of how we are shaped in time through that which we come across day by day.

Personal impressions are now packed and barely seen, but they still carry the intensity of something that has been lived by someone and that could lead to a recollection or a connection between something else that has happened in someone else’s life experience.

I used various materials, most of which are things from daily life, or tiny objects that I found on my way, that, in some way, are related with what happened to me. These have been mixed and stitched with wire, wax, or enamel on boards. After this act of collection, I gently covered the whole combination with a sheet of paper on a board. The final surface has been oiled and it interacts with the different layers. The result is an amalgamation of seen and un-seen images, where the experience comes alive through the recollection of fragments.

Each pieces is 11x18 cm big, in a 23x32 cm frame.

see the works in the Gallery or at  www.veronicacestari.it

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT

If you aren’t able to help with money, you can always support me by spreading the buzz to your friends or people you know that might be interested in art.

Moreover you can keep yourself informed about me and my projects, by following me on my instagram profile @veronica.cestari or on my facebook profile, Veronica Cestari. In this way, I will be able to share my work in progress with you.

Facebook link: http://goo.gl/zXePD0

Instagram link: http://instagram.com/veronica.cestari/

SHOWS

2014 – Donne in Opera, Camera del lavoro, Ravenna

2014 - Arte sotto Milano, Museo della Permanente, Milano, Italy

2013 - Breart, il laboratorio dell’arte futura, Accademia di Belle Arti di Brera, Milano, Italy

2012 - Performig Shapes, collaboration with the stylist Chiara Boni, ProjectB   Contemporary Art Gallery, Milano, Italy

2011 -  Next Arts, MAGA, shortlisted, Gallarate, Italy

2011 - Y-PUB Art, villa Torri, 2° award, Vimodrone, Italy

2010 - End of Term Group Show, University of Leeds, Leed, Uk

2010 - Semimistici, Museo Cividini, Bergamo, Italy

2008 - 2° Biennale dei Giovani, Accademia di Belle Arti, Bologna, Italy
story_txt:
ARTIST’S STUDIO
#LETStART


Ciao,
Sono Veronica Cestari, giovane artista italiana. Dopo
gli studi mi sono trasferita a Londra dove per un anno ho lavorato come
assistente di una promettente artista brasiliana. Alla fine di questa
esperienza ho deciso di incominciare la mia carriera artistica. Il primo passo
per iniziare seriamente questa attività è prendere uno spazio e creare il mio
studio d’artista!Ed è per questo che ho bisogno del tuo aiuto!Ho lanciato questa raccolta fondi in modo da avere un
sostegno economico per tutte le spese di affitto e per i materiali di cui avrò
bisogno. Questo portale web dà la possibilità in un modo nuovo di diffondere il
progetto in tutto il mondo e raccogliere fondi per far partire e crescere le
proprie idee. Con il tuo contributo avrò la possibilità di costruire le basi e
per sviluppare il mio lavoro artistico.Si tratta di un investimento!Infatti, in cambio al tuo fondamentale supporto,
riceverai un mio lavoro artistico, che fa parte di un progetto più grande. Nel
2011 ho prodotto un opera riflettendo sul concetto della memoria, e per tre
mesi ho lavorato costantemente creando ogni giorno un quadro, un pezzo unico
dove segni e colori potessero esprimere l’esperienza di ogni giorno vissuto.
Riceverai quindi un tassello unico, che compone un opera più grande e che sarà
punto di connessione tra tutti quelli che decideranno di fare questo
investimento.Ho diviso i lavori sotto quattro diverse fasce di
contributo (da 50 a 200€), di seguito e nella Gallery potrete vedere le foto di
tutti i quadri e a quale categoria corrispondono ( visibili anche tramite il
sito www.veronicacestari.it). Puoi sceglierlo e una volta deciso dovrai versare il contributo tramite PayPal (è necessario che mi comunichi quale hai scelto e il tuo indirizzo con un commento privato fatto tramite questo
stesso sito). L’opera sarà poi consegnata per posta incorniciata e con
attestato di originalità.
Grazie per il tuo supporto,
Veronica
I primi sette (First seven) - Memory's perks - 50€ eachFebbraio (February) - Memory's perks - 100€ eachMarzo (March) - Memory's perks - 150€ eachGiugno (June) - Memory's perks - 200€ eachPuoi vedere i lavori singolarmente nella Gallery o al sito www.veronicacestari.it
-------------Dear reader, I am Veronica Cestari, a young
Italian artist specializing in sculpture with a broad interest in various
media. After a year of experience in London as the assistant of a great
Brazilian artist, I have decided to go back to Italy and start creating my own
artworks. I intend to open my personal studio to realize this project.
In fact, I need my own
lovely place where I could come up with my ideas and create great pieces.
That's why, dear reader, I need your help! 
Nowadays life for a young
artist is really tough and it's hard to sustain all the costs especially at the
beginning. I need to cover the costs of the rent, tools, materials and
furniture. Thus, I really need some external help. Thanks to this web portal, I
am trying to raise funds that would allow me to start working. With your
contribution I would be able to lay the foundations for my long-term project
and really express my ideas. I could finally convey my own style and contribute
to the complex and beautiful world of Art.
In order to open my studio and
reach my goal, I have decided to start selling pieces of my artwork. You
will receive one of my pieces as a perk of your fundamental support.In 2011 I produced an art
piece that allowed me to investigate the concept of memory. I worked on it for three
months of my life and each day became a picture, a unique piece where signs and
colors expressed the impression that I lived. 
I have decided to give these
"days of my life" to those who contribute to my future. I am glad to spread these pieces of memory around as they can be, in some way, a connection between me,
the artist, and you, the one that is making my start possible.
I hope to hear
from you soon and don't hesitate to write to me for more information about my
work, my history and my future.
Thanks for your help.
Veronica (see images at www.veronicacestari.it or in the Gallery)Why is the goal 7000€? I have estimated my expenses around 500€ for the monthly rent and some extra costs, so that 7000€ will allow me to cover one year of work.I primi sette (First seven) - Memory's perk - 50€ each

Febbraio (February) - Memory's perks - 100€ each



Marzo (March) - Memory's perks - 150€ each



Giugno (June) - Memory's perks - 200€ each





MORE ABOUT THE MEMORY PIECES
The work is about memory and
it represents my daily memory turned into visual impression. I dedicated myself
to observing how and what happened to me every day constantly for three months.
I used objects and colors to focus on what consciously and unconsciously was
stacked in my mind at the end of the day. The result was paintings with traces
which try to emerge through a plain surface and which are still packed in a
kind of envelope.
This work represented a
challenge to myself that helped me to understand the importance of memory. 
I found that images can be
part of a recollection: the painting becomes an object through which memory can
be brought back to life.
This work tries to deepen the
concept of how we are shaped in time through that which we come across day by day.
Personal impressions are
now packed and barely seen, but they still carry the intensity of something
that has been lived by someone and that could
lead to a recollection or a connection between something else that has happened
in someone else’s life experience.
I used various materials, most of which are things from daily life, or tiny objects that I
found on my way, that, in some way, are related with what happened to me. These
have been mixed and stitched with wire, wax, or enamel on boards. After this
act of collection, I gently covered the
whole combination with a sheet of paper on a board.
The final surface has been oiled and it interacts with the different layers.
The result is an amalgamation of seen and un-seen images, where the experience comes alive through the recollection of fragments.
Each pieces is 11x18 cm big,
in a 23x32 cm frame.
see the works in the Gallery or at  www.veronicacestari.it

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT
If you aren’t able to help with money, you can always support me by spreading the buzz to your friends or people you know that might be interested in art.
Moreover you can keep yourself informed about me and my projects, by following me on my instagram profile @veronica.cestari or on my facebook profile, Veronica Cestari. In this way, I will be able to share my work in progress with you.
Facebook link: http://goo.gl/zXePD0
Instagram link: http://instagram.com/veronica.cestari/


SHOWS
2014 – Donne in Opera, Camera del lavoro, Ravenna
2014 - Arte sotto Milano, Museo della Permanente, Milano, Italy
2013 - Breart, il laboratorio dell’arte futura, Accademia di Belle Arti
di Brera, Milano, Italy
2012 - Performig Shapes, collaboration with the stylist Chiara Boni,
ProjectB   Contemporary Art Gallery, Milano, Italy
2011 -  Next Arts, MAGA, shortlisted, Gallarate, Italy
2011 - Y-PUB Art, villa Torri, 2° award, Vimodrone, Italy
2010 - End of Term Group Show, University of Leeds, Leed, Uk
2010 - Semimistici, Museo Cividini, Bergamo, Italy
2008 - 2° Biennale dei Giovani, Accademia di Belle Arti, Bologna, Italy

story:
We're more than a series. We're a community.

With nearly four years behind us, Breadline has become a space and series of events cultivating literary discourse in Seattle. We've been open to all, and we love how so many types of people have enjoyed our presence. It's time to bring everyone together in a new space, a new medium, and see the new beauty that results.

It's time for a book.

Breadline has been entirely about the events. Up until now. The organizers asked around and everyone agrees an anthology is the next step. We've gathered submissions from our features, as well as open mic'ers, and it's time to make the book we've envisioned a reality. Here's what it costs:

  • Design. A portion of the funding raised will go directly to a professional book designer, who has years of experience behind her.
  • Printing. This is a physical book. Physical books of all shapes and sizes cost money to make. This one's going to be special. Quality. Color. And the thickness representative of Breadline's life. It all comes together in one delicious artifact. Our estimated total number of copies are 500, with estimated pages being around 225.
  • Distribution. We're going to either have the books shipped up to us from the secret bookmaker's lair in Southern Washington State, or make 'em ourselves. Either way, we'll need dough (the green variety) to pay for either our own gas, for someone else's gas and fine handling.
Once the books are in Seattle, they'll be available for purchase at future Breadline events, as well as online through a personalized delivery, and, of course, at the many bookstores around the city. One way or another, the books are going out into the public and bringing the artists we've come to know and love together in a new way.

This is literary. And it's literature.

From our poets and novelists to our essayists and lecturers, from our painters and illustrators to our video collagists and sound artists, this anthology will be an imprint on the community unlike any other. Anthologies have existed before, but not as intimate as the Breadline Anthology. We hope the charm and influence will inspire, enlighten, and connect people in Seattle with the great visions of those who have graced Breadline's stage.

Beyond the money?

As with the series, we know not everyone's able to commit their hard-earned cash. And we respect that. If you're interested in helping us, but not financially, consider spreading the word to those you know with deep pockets, and please keep supporting the Breadline events, which are sure to continue as long as the bakers are by the oven.

story:
Be ToonBombed Now


Hip Hop Culture in Korea is huge. Korean youths wear high quality fashion such a snapbacks, timberlands, and accessories reflecting the culture. Many are involved in the community ranging from breakdancing to rapping. I thought hip hop was only big in America...I had no clue hip hop has had such a huge impact on another culture such as Seoul, Korea. 

THE EVENT WILL TAKE PLACE AT THE END OF SEPTEMBER .
If you Interested in Sponsoring FUSION Please Contact at Stewardmaine1993@gmail.com
OR
DONATE TO A GREAT EVENT
  1. MY GOAL is to Create an Event called "FUSION" In Seoul Korea to unify hip hop cultures with live performances by Korean and American rappers, hip hop dancers, a DJ mixing old school and new school hip hop with models wearing my brand and art showcased by my Brand Runur 'DE' Rabbit to show how Hip Hop has inspired me and influenced.

  2.  The Birth of Hip Hop struck the planet in the late 70's in New York, Bronx. Pictures  include the Rocksteady crew who first appeared in the film "Flashdance" in 1979 as well as BeatStreet and showing the world this new and exciting style of dance. Other Legends that gave birth to the hip hop culture were The Fat Boys, Afrika Bambaata  RUNDMC and many more.

  4. Korean Hip Hop is new exciting and fresh. Its has great music and fashion sense such a "Jay Park" a Famous rapper and dancer who has the culture down to a science as well as "TaeYang" whose apart of the famous KPOP Group Big Bang


  6. FUSION will be supported by Hm Entertainment and Hallyumagazine

  7. After being in Korea for a few months one of the biggest Breakdancing events in the world "Red Bull BC one" was being hosted there. This was my first time meeting breakdancers in seoul and being inspired by the community.

  8. FUSION is already a success. The Biggest Breakdancing Event in Korea "R16" R=Respect and 16 standing for 16 different countries. Before leaving Korea I had the experience of attending and watching first hand people unite through hip hop. 

  9. Art By Runur "DE" Rabbit

  10. Have a Runur "DE" Rabbit T-Shirt


  12. Send me your photo and have it designed like a character in Runur "DE" Rabbits Universe.

  13. Send me a selfie and have it bombed by Runur "DE" Rabbit

  14. My name is Jermaine Steward and I am the creator of RUNUR "DE" Rabbit  a new an upcoming Brand. 

  15. The story is about Runur "DE" Rabbit  the leader of a group of misfits heavily influenced by the Hip Hop culture living in a dystopian world, where animals and humans are at war. At Night Runur and his crew run a underground hip hop scene. Humans and animals are free to come together and express themselves through rapping, tagging and dancing . The only rule is to respect everyone. Only problem is when the sun rises humans and animals separate and are forced to run from the law.

  16. Runur and his crews would like to be showcased for the first time at "FUSION" an Event in Seoul Korea with the dream of Unifying Cultures 

  17. Your Support is Needed 

  18. Interested in Sponsoring Event? Please contact at Stewardmaine1993@gmail for Further details

story:
CAN YOU IMAGINE GROWING UP WITHOUT ARTS EDUCATION?              NEITHER CAN WE.

Spearheaded by professional artists and printmakers based in New York Ciy, the “Big Concepts for Little Printmakers” workshop is designed for K through 5 students at the Isaacs Center: about 75 underserved children who regularly attend their afterschool program.  Our talented teaching artists provide the kids with the materials, tools and know-how to make their own lively, original prints using unorthodox materials from sponges to plastic utensils and combs.  Each student will leave the experience with a handmade gift to take home for the holidays!

HOW YOU CAN HELP 

Help us bring contemporary art back to the Isaacs Center youth! Our 2nd annual educational partnership with the International Print Center New York is sure to be just as exciting, colorful and messy . . . in the best way! Your contribution will help us expand the program to include 2 sessions and a family participation day.  It will also cover supplies and instruction by talented printmakers. Most importantly, your support will bring art and artists that are otherwise inaccessible to kids living in the shadow of some of New York City's most eminent cultural institutions.

Curious where your money will go? Here's what we need and how your contribution will help us get there!  All funds raised during this campaign will go towards funding the “Big Concepts for Little Printmakers!” workshop whether or not we reach our goal. 

· $20 Covers supplies for one student

· $100 Covers the stipend of a workshop assistant who will be helping the kids create their original prints (we need 3 assistants for the 3 age-appropriate workshops)

· $250 Covers costs of printmaking tools for one of three workshop groups

· $500 Pays for the teaching artist to lead the workshop. We need 3 for this project.

· $1500 Covers all the supplies needed for the workshop

· $5,000 Pays for an entire workshop!

Can't contribute at this time? You can still help us reach our goal by spreading the word to other art lovers in your network using the Indiegogo share tools! 

REWARDS IMAGES: 

Art Connects Mini Portfolio 

Art Connects Tote Bag

Signed copy of "The Art of You and Me" by author Kimberly Marrero


ABOUT US

At Art Connects New York, we truly believe art is for everyone in our glorious city - not just the members of the art world and the wealthy patrons of contemporary culture. Our tagline, “Good Works Everywhere”, reminds us of that everyday! In that spirit, we work hard to bring the passion and power of contemporary art to some of New York City's most underserved communities: the young, old, infirm and neglected New Yorkers served by the City's dedicated social service agencies.

We've installed over 35 free, permanent contemporary art exhibitions in spaces ranging from senior centers and temporary homes for New Yorkers recovering from addiction to New York City's first permanent home for runaway LGBT youth. In spring 2014, we mounted a museum-quality exhibition of prints at the Stanley M. Isaacs Neighborhood Center Youth Facility: a settlement center on New York City's Upper East Side that serves scores of young people residing in the neighboring public housing units.

story:
Next December I will be landing in Cochabamba, Bolivia to deliver an arts program for children and young adults living in some of the deprived communities in one of the poorest countries in Latin America. Why there? A very good friend of mine is the director of the charity Fundacion Bolivia Digna, a charity that promotes better living conditions and creates opportunities for advancement for people, particularly young people, living in poor or marginal conditions through educational programs and social assistance programs. I am very aware of the difficulties they are facing out there and am a great fan of the amazing work they already do. These charities depend dramatically on the support of volunteers and donors. I felt this is the time I should do  my part in giving my all and hopefully inspire and give the future generations lifelong skills.

These are some of the facts:

•50% (5 million) of population are children and adolescents

•7 out of 10 children are victims of some sort of abuse before age 12

•800, 000 children work

•200 children and adolescents live on the streets in Cochabamba

•The school dropout rate in Bolivia is 15%

Fundacion Bolivia Digna helps children that are at risk of becoming victims of physical, psychological and sexual abuse and human trafficking as they lack support to escape the poverty trap. They provide a safe environment for at least a part of the day, remove some of the burden of responsibility and allow kids to be kids, teach and demonstrate values that are at the core of a healthy society and assist with and augment formal education to improve future prospects.

For more information about Foundacion Bolivia Digna you can visit: http://boliviadigna.org/en/home/

During my visit I will implement a sustainable art program that will be integrated in Fundacion Bolivia Digna's educational project. I will use artistic activities to help children express themselves so we can improve their self-steem and give them skills for life and encourage them to have dreams and aims in life. We want this children to create a positive future for themselves!

Let me introduce you the children of Cochabamba. Here you can see what these children said was important for them when asked about their future president: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmv4Zdg3EDE

The money raised will cover the cost of travel to Cochabamba (once I am there the organisation covers my expenses) and it will contribute towards implementing and establishing the program. My aim is not only to run it but to also guarantee its sustainability for the future.

I will definitely keep you updated about the project once I am there!

story:
Welcome,
So we are obviously not going to even reach ten percent but IF we did
we would have enough as long as we sell our motorcycle etc.. we need 500
in 4 days,.. we've had 1000 views.. if all contributed with 50 cents....
Its more important than ever for us since Daniel got hit by a hit and run driver
on a crosswalk, evil motorist ran a red light and the result is him being banged upp all over and having 4 fractures in his foot and ancle so anything that he can work
with from home would help. PLEASE donate at least 5usd and help make a positive change, WE are trying but luck has not been on our side.

We are Mayhem Troopers we want art and music, laughter and anger,we are husband, wife and friends, artists, musicians, music fans, humble weirdos and lovers of independence. This is our pet project, born from a passion to do what we love and enable others to do the same.

We are partnering with artists and bands to offer a wide variety of t-shirts, patches, posters and buttons.  All bands, current or defunct, will get paid, setting us apart from 95% of the people screening "punk" patches

Our focus is the community we live in, the local bands as well as the global underground art and music community. We will do our small part to keep the scene alive by helping artists generate income from their work.

We are striving to become a solid resource for friends touring the US, with a streamlined setup to deliver quality faster and better.   We will be as mobile as possible to handle merch for bands on the road too so they can focus on the music.

PATCHES!!
Embroidered patches are the main focus with awesome bands, weird artists and our own insane and twisted ideas, this is going to be fun!


SHIRT, PINS, POSTERS?
Yes, yes, yes


The team

Daniel, born and raised in Sweden, with strong ties to the underground diy punk network where he took an active part in from the late eighties, writing zines and websites, running his record label as well as a mail-order and screen print operation.  Eventually he moved to the US to pursue his other passion: roaring engines!  But an urge to be a resource rather than a consumer in a scene he loved refused to leave him alone., He also works a lot on old motorcycles and makes weird stuff.

In the US he met and married Billie Austin, a self-taught lowbrow artist.  She was looking for ways to branch out with her art and decided to make some patch and t shirt designs.  They decided to reach out to more artists and musicians and merge together their creative ambitions, and so the collective Mayhem Troopers was born.


Magnus Jansson 
Lives in Gothenburg, Sweden. These days he is mostly doing ink and pencil drawings, but likes to paint as well. He has had several  solo exhibitions and been represented in fine art museums, as well as doing illustrations for bands like:Avskum, DooM, Skitkids, P.r.o.b.l.e.m.s. and many more.


Colin Ambulance
The Los Angeles-based artist and musician known as Colin Ambulance may be best known for his paintings and illustrations he has sold  primarily online since 2011. He has also been a member of numerous bands and musical projects spanning the last 2 decades as well as designed record covers and graphics for an extensive list of recording artist.


Jonas Wiik
From Stockholm Sweden, he makes high quality leather goods and low quality weirdo art. "Everything I do I do because of punk rock and 80's pop culture. I love to create, and to me it's not important in what material. There is no right or wrong when it comes to creating and art."



Bands and artists

These are the bands currently on board

/7
Many more to come, and we'll do embroidered patches and lots of other stuff 
We will also announce a bunch of painters and graphic artists the next couple 
of weeks


What We Need & What You Get

Right now we have an opportunity to buy a large amount of professional equipment at a great price.  This is very time sensitive and we do not want it to pass us by!  Your contributions will allow us to purchase a full screen print setup for t-shirts etc, and embroidery machine, ink, thread, a button maker, etc.  Most of the funds will  go straight to equipment, another chunk to fulfill all our perks and the rest towards first and last month's rent for a small work space.  Any amount raised above our goal will be invested in making our operation mobile.

We realize our goal is set high but we feel that a place that can make it all without relying on other businesses will make it both more cost effective and more reliable.

 If we do NOT reach our goal we will still go forward with our plans.  All funds will go to purchasing equipment and all rewards will be delivered.  We are aiming to be as independent and offer as much selection as possible right away, but we will start with what we get.  We will sell everything we own if we have to.

.

The Impact

We are tired of seeing bands struggling to finance their tours while merch with their name on it is being illegitimately produced and sold across the internet.  We can't fix the music industry or the art scene,  money will always have the upper hand, but we can do our part to provide an alternative source for these products.  We exist to support creativity.  We believe the purpose of band/art merch is to fuel more art and music.  You sell shirts so you can tour.  You sell prints so you can buy paint.  We are not here to capitalize on your goals, we SHARE your goals!  We will sleep where we print if it will let us do what we want to do!
The more we raise the more effective we can be and hence cheaper.


Risks & Challenges

Our challenge is a classic time and resources conundrum.  We need equipment and time to produce our products.  The purpose of this campaign is to acquire an ideal equipment set up.  This would springboard us into maximum productivity right away, rather than spending more time and, in the long run, more money to build our setup one piece at a time.  It would eliminate the need to use any outside fulfillment services, which would streamline our cost structures and allow us to provide the lowest prices for customers, lower overhead in short more money paid to the artists we partner with.  It would allow us more time to dedicate to this with less time spent working for other people just to pay rent.  
We are uniquely qualified to do this the right way.  We are very hard working people with a passion for this project, not fans of materialistic bs.  We do not want to make a cushy living.  We just want to survive independently, without our hard wok going into the pockets of corporate business people.  We are smart, capable, skilled and determined. 


Broke... How can you help?

Spread the world, post our link, tell you friends, every cent helps.

Thanks a lot, get in touch if you want to take an active part, hands on locally, or as a distributor overseas
story_txt:
Welcome,So we are obviously not going to even reach ten percent but IF we didwe would have enough as long as we sell our motorcycle etc.. we need 500in 4 days,.. we've had 1000 views.. if all contributed with 50 cents....Its more important than ever for us since Daniel got hit by a hit and run driveron a crosswalk, evil motorist ran a red light and the result is him being banged upp all over and having 4 fractures in his foot and ancle so anything that he can workwith from home would help. PLEASE donate at least 5usd and help make a positive change, WE are trying but luck has not been on our side.

story:
Make a difference

If you fund this film, you're funding the work of female filmmakers. Only 4.4% of directors in the top 100 box office films each year from 2002 to 2012 were women. Not only is this story written by a woman, but is also directed by a woman.


The story itself is about a young woman that fights against a dismissive and oppressive ex boyfrend, and wins. She is not there to be cute and smile, she’s there to be herself. As complex as she may be. And that's extra cool.

Your support, whether that is by way of funds or by word-of-mouth, means a world of difference to myself and my fellow collaborators, regardless of gender.

Here's a breakdown of our budget:

15% is allotted to our art department, for wardrobe, set decoration, special effects and props.


20% is allotted to our craft food services, for ingredients that are nutritional and fresh, so we can focus on making a great short film!


20% is for our camera department for equipment rental, insurance and miscellaneous items they require that they can't get through our school.


20% will finance the press kits and application fees that we send out to film festivals worldwide.


10% is for contingency, just in case anything goes awry!


15% is for post-production. For any touch ups that we can't do ourselves, that require any outside services for the improvement of our image or sound.


We're more than just filmmakers, we're people that want to change how …

and really thank you for giving to our film!

story:
Short Summary

Remember that scholarship and artistic boost that Mount Gretna School of Art provided students in the incredible summer of 2014?

Now the school needs your help to purchase its first artist cottage.

What We Need

Here's the details:

  • We need the "class of 2014" to raise more than $500 to help reach our goal to purchase and renovate a cottage in Mount Gretna.
  • Every donation will be matched dollar for dollar by a challenge grant. So if we raise $500 then it gets doubled by the grant to $1000!!!  If we raise more than that the dollar for dollar match continues up to $150,000 (just in case and we're not kidding)!
  • If we don't reach our goal we run the risk of being unable to secure housing next year and thereby jeopardizing the program.  Show the greater community of Mount Gretna how much you valued your experience at MGSoA with a donation.

The Impact

Your contribution will:

  • help stabilize housing which has been increasingly difficult and unstable to secure, putting the program in jeopardy.
  • place a foundation under the intensive program that has skyrocketed in reputation, attracting more and more applicants every year and recognition nationwide.
  • motivate other supporters of the school to give even more. It will have a big impact for supporters to see former students pitching in.
  • activate a dollar for dollar challenge match from a foundation grant.  If the "class of 2013" can raise $500, for example, it will be matched by the foundation dollar to dollar having a $1000 overall impact with the match!

Risks & Challenges

We need to act quickly as we have only until August 31st to reach our goal.

  • We already have the BIG donor.  All we need now is for lots of other donors to pitch in their fair share.
  • If everyone in the class of 2014 gives $25, $50 or $100 then we'll meet our goal EASY.
  • Donations large and small are helping.  It all adds up (especially with that matching grant)!

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to know how to help even more?:

  • Ask friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them about the support you received from MGSoA and the impact the intensive program has had!

That's all there is to it.

story:
Art By Peleegirl Colouring Books

My name is Sarah Rupert, aka Peleegirl.  I am artist from southern Ontario with a desire to share my passion for nature with others.   Three years ago, I faced an extremely challenging time at work and I turned to art to express the wide range of feelings I was having about a job that I loved so dearly changing so drastically.  Fast forward three years and I've taken what was an outlet to deal with my negative emotions, and transformed into a thriving artistic adventure.

My passion for nature is apparent in my artwork and I've realized reconnecting to the creative spirit I had as a child has been invaluable to my life.  So many people have told me they wished they could draw, paint or create like I do.  I think that it is in all of us - we just need to reconnect to that inner child, the one that loved to create and didn't care what it looked like...if the grass was purple, it didn't matter, you were proud of what you created. And this is where the idea for the Art by Peleegirl colouring books was born.

I have four books planned in the series - Warbler, Owls, Stinkin' Cute Woodland Creatures and Wildflower Mandalas.  All the of the books will feature stylistic depictions of plants and animals and while you are reconnecting with your creativity, you can also connect to the natural world around you. 

My campaign is modest - I'm looking for support to develop and print these books.  Your funds will assist in four different areas:

1.  Creation of the artwork for the colouring books $400

2. Scanning, editing artwork and creating print ready files for books  - $1300

3. Printing of the initial run of books $1000

4. Administrative fees for campaign and rewards, including exclusive art cards, original paintings and other goodies - $300

I am excited to have the opportunity to share my art with the world.   Until very recently, I was hesitant to call myself an artist or share my work with others.  I see the value in living a creative life and want to help others reconnect with theirs.  I've always thought I would publish a book - I never guessed it would be a colouring book.

I am dedicated to finding a way for this project to move forward - I already have bookstores and other parties interested in my books. so I have the motivation to see this project through to the end.  And I don't want to stop with four books - this is just the stepping stone to more opportunities.

Risks & Challenges

I always have a lot of balls in the air at any given time.  I volunteer much of my free time to several different organizations, I'm dedicated to my work and sometimes time to work on my art is limited.  I have set a deadline of the end of September 2015 to have the first two books printed, to coincide with a major birding convention.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support me financially, I understand - share my campaign with your friends and family.  The more people out there talking about what I'm working on the better.  Stay tuned for the release date for the books,

story:
“Patty’s Green” has been offering high quality children’s programming around the East Coast for the past twenty years. Host and creator, Patty Carver, has shared her love for the arts and her infectious laugh in a variety of live settings. Now, with your help, Patty’s enthusiastic and engaging personality has the opportunity to reach children everywhere!

Be part of “Patty’s Green” initial backers, as we create original content to pitch to several streaming services. Your generous contribution will allow us to pay for the camera crew, sound engineer and video editor. We are thrilled to offer a selection of exclusive perks to those who donate to our campaign. 

Warm wishes,

The “Patty’s Green” team

story:
HYAH!

Howdy, the name's Nick. I'm a small time artist living in the heart of California. I love collecting unique pins, almost as much as I love that first peek when you open a box of pizza.

So here's the details.

This campaign is going to be the basis to spread the love of LoZ and Pizza! This will all go in to the cost of production for both the pins, and stickers. Postage supplies are also included for this campaign, I have left no stone un-turned and have calculated exactly what this campaign needs.

65% pin production

15% sticker production

15% postage supplies

5% IGG fees

If we can reach the stretch goal of $700 a second pin will be added to the campaign! Another epic LoZ pin!

 

The pins are still in pre-production, but the stickers and t-shirts have been completed!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to the campaign, your support and admiration would be greatly appreciated, even if it is just giving the campaign a share!


Now there will be stretch goals that can be met. Here are a couple of examples of additional pins that can be made. Of course the next pin to be made would be left up to a vote from the backers.

My personal pick for the new design would be the Ocarina of Pie,
